Increase the adoption of AI/ML technology within HP’s Commercial Organization by finding applicability of technology in real business challenges, and ensuring adoption of the solutions built

4174873247.title: Junior Data Scientist 1
4174873247.description:
About the job
Mission

If You Have a Passion For Data And Technology And Want To Join a Crew Of Sharp Analytical Minds, Then This May Be The Right Opportunity For You. As a Junior Data Scientist, You Will Get a Chance To Take Part On The Typical Tasks Our Data Scientists Do On a Daily Basis

Translate business needs to technical requirements 
Define strategy for use of data and how data use interacts with data design 
Create and document reusable packages and libraries in Python and other languages 
Perform data studies and data discovery around new data sources or new uses for existing data sources 
Develop, train, finetune and industrialize ML models 
Implement and hands-off data checking and updating procedures to other teams 
Be a member of an AI laboratory performing discovery tasks and developing AI products 
Develop end-to-end data science applications, including complex distributed data processing, creating an analysis framework (e.g. models, algorithms, etc.), developing custom complex visualization tools, and deploying web applications 

Your profile

Until 2 years of experience in data science 
Experience with data programming/ scripting languages (Python, R, SQL) 
Experience in machine-learning methodologies (supervised /unsupervised, deep learning) 
Experience performing ETL functions and understanding data quality steps 
Strong in quantitative analysis, statistics, or mathematics 
Experience in communicating technically, at a level appropriate for the audience 
Ability to work in a fast pace and learn quickly 
(Bonus) Master in Data Science /Machine Learning 
(Bonus) Experience with regression modeling, forecasting, and/ or time series analysis 
(Bonus) Experience with NLP 
(Bonus) Experience with visualization tools (Shiny, Power BI, Tableau) 
(Bonus) AWS Cloud/Azure experience/exposure 

Who are we?

Are you ready to take part in the upcoming AI revolution of the business world? If the answer is a resounding "yes," we have an extraordinary offer for you!

Aily Labs, founded in 2020, is an exciting and rapidly growing startup based in Munich, Barcelona, Madrid, New York and Cluj. With a team consisting of over 300+ passionate and skilled ML Engineers, Data Scientists and Developers, we are dedicated to our ambitious objective of democratizing AI. 

We have harnessed cutting-edge technology to develop an exceptional AI mobile app that goes beyond conventional solutions. By seamlessly providing immediate business insights, we are poised to revolutionise the corporate landscape.

Our vision is to establish ourselves as the preferred platform for AI-driven decision-making, setting new standards in the industry. We firmly believe that our state-of-the-art technology empowers organisations to make faster and more intelligent choices.

By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to be at the forefront of this transformative movement, shaping the future of intelligent decision-making in remarkable ways.

What sets us apart?

We are an internationally diverse and young team with more than 30 nationalities. 
We develop high-quality, beautiful software and thus create sustainable added value for our customers. 
We pay competitive salaries and reward performance 
We live an open feedback culture so that we can constantly reflect and improve. 
We offer flexible remote work with free time management within the projects. 
We enjoy new technologies, are open for innovative ideas and foster trial and error principles. 
We give freedom for further training because lifelong learning is important to us. 
We do cool and fun offsites (e.g. Ibiza. Kitzbühel), and regular casual get-togethers. 

About Us

LEARN MORE

Perform data studies and data discovery around new data sources or new uses for existing data sources

Be a member of an AI laboratory performing discovery tasks and developing AI products 
Develop end-to-end data science applications, including complex distributed data processing, creating an analysis framework (e.g. models, algorithms, etc.), developing custom complex visualization tools, and deploying web applications

We live an open feedback culture so that we can constantly reflect and improve. 
We offer flexible remote work with free time management within the projects. 
We enjoy new technologies, are open for innovative ideas and foster trial and error principles. 
We give freedom for further training because lifelong learning is important to us. 
We do cool and fun offsites (e.g. Ibiza. Kitzbühel), and regular casual get-togethers.

4151467904.title: Data Scientist
4151467904.description:
About the job
Are you a Data Scientist seeking a new interesting challenge? 🔍
If your answer is yes, it’s your lucky day so keep reading, it can be just what you're looking for! 👀

✍️WHAT WILL YOU DO?
We are looking for a dynamic, proactive and talented person to join our team and perform the following tasks:
• Data Analysis and Exploration using Azure Databricks on large data sets to identify patterns and relationships.
• Machine Learning Model Development with Data processing and Feature Engineering
• Collaborating with Data engineers to integrate data pipelines and ensure execution of data flows. 
• Work with DevOps teams to deploy models and optimize scaling to higher datasets.
• Fine Tuning and Optimizing models based on requirement refinements and objective findings.
• Communicate model results and findings through reports and presentations.

🧐 WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
• Experience building, training, and deploying machine learning models using Azure ML.
• Expertise in SQL for querying and manipulating large datasets in Azure SQL Database or SQL Server.
• Proficiency in Python and/or R for data science, machine learning, and statistical analysis.
• Knowledge of machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, or PyTorch.
• Strong background in supervised and unsupervised learning, statistical modeling, time series forecasting and natural language processing (NLP).
• Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to design innovative data science solutions.
• Solid understanding of data preprocessing, feature engineering, model evaluation techniques, and performance metrics.
• Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to business stakeholders and executives.
• Experience working in an agile, collaborative environment with cross-functional teams. 
• Experience with version control (e.g., Git), DevOps, CI/CD
•At least 3 years of professional experience in a similar role
•Fluent English
 
📅 WHERE AND WHEN?
Workplace: Madrid In-office
Work Schedule: Business Hours

🤝 WHAT CAN WE OFFER YOU?
Permanent contract 📋 - We offer indefinite contracts from the first day. Pay and benefits 💸 - Competitive salary and a flexible compensation plan adapted to your needs (Ticket restaurant plan, Childcare Ticket, Transport Ticket and Health Insurance).Opportunity knocks 👍🏻 - Being a part of a growing company, we want to support your path with a career development plan and annual performance-based compensation reviews. Learn as you grow 📚 - Starting with a fantastic onboarding program, TCS has robust learning platforms that will allow you to learn and grow personal as professionally. Bring your buddy 👫 - If you have referred a friend for an open position under the BYB Scheme and she/he is hired you’ll receive a very attractive cash award. Connect globally 🌏 - Work with people from all over the world. You can feel the multicultural workforce. Benefit from being a TCSer 🎟️ – By being part of the TCS Spain family you can enjoy benefits, offers and corporate discounts on the best brands. And so on 🎉 - Appreciations, incentives, Team Building activities, diversity and inclusion programs, sustainability activities, corporative events... This has only just begun!
💡WHO ARE WE?
Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an Information Technology (IT) company founded in 1968 as part of the Indian Tata Group and is one of the top 3 technology companies globally 🚀

With a presence in 55 countries and more than 600,000 employees, TCS is considered one of the 10 best companies to work for worldwide in 2024 according to the Top Employers Institute 🥇

TCS Spain started operations in 2001 and currently has a diverse workforce that collaborates with the main Spanish and multinational companies 🌏

TCS Spain has been certified as a Top Employer 2024 and has also been chosen as one of the 100 Best Companies to Work for in Spain in 2024 according to Forbes🏆

Among the portfolio of services, TCS has information technology services, asset-based solutions, global consulting, engineering and industrial services, digital solutions and services, application maintenance and development, quality assurance and testing services, IT infrastructure and BPS 🎯

Responsible for development, TCS Spain is committed to inclusion, diversity and sustainability, and promotes flexibility policies that support wellbeing and work-life balance 💯

WELCOME, WE ARE WAITING FOR YOU! 🚀

4056510233.title: Data Scientist
4056510233.description:
About the job
About us
Have you always wanted to put your passion for education to use on the job? Would you like to work with an incredible team making an impact on learning around the world? If you answered yes, we can't wait to meet you!

And just who are we? Edpuzzle is a leading edtech company with offices in San Francisco and Barcelona and over 10 years of history helping teachers find and create exciting, interactive video lessons. Over 80% of U.S. schools and millions of teachers and students in 190+ countries around the world are already using Edpuzzle to make education more equitable and engaging.

About the role 
We’re looking for our next Data Scientist to join the Data & Analytics team in Barcelona. You’ll be responsible for adapting techniques from research to specific clients and research problems. You will advise on technical and theoretical possibilities within the data science domain and report and present research findings and developments clearly and efficiently, both internally and externally, verbally and in writing.

At Edpuzzle, our Data Scientists are skilled in the full data journey, from collection to insight. Our Data Scientists work on transversal projects balancing the practical application of machine learning and the development of a variety of tasks that include data exploration, analysis and visualisation to empower decision-making. As part of your growth with us, you’ll have the opportunity to lead Data Science projects. You’ll gain the autonomy to coordinate initiatives, playing an integral role in driving and shaping the future of our Data Science efforts.

Wondering what it’s like to work at Edpuzzle?
Picture a place where you can connect with your teammates, whether remotely or in person, whenever you need support. A place where one day you're helping shape one of the biggest edtech platforms in the world, and the next day you're doing a teambuilding activity with your coworkers. A place where everyone has been selected because they're the best at what they do, and where your manager and team trust your decisions fully. A place where you're encouraged to learn and grow because education is the cornerstone of everything we do. Check out the job details below to see if Edpuzzle could be the right fit for you!

About the job
Extract and query data from our data lake and data warehouse: Undertake the preprocess of structured and unstructured data.
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns, interpret and analyze data problems.
Design, implement and maintain a solid data lake and data warehouse that collects, stores, and processes data, focusing on scalability and reliability.
Develop and refine data visualizations, employing advanced techniques and tools to turn complex data sets into clear, actionable visuals that inform strategic decision-making.
Propose well-thought-out solutions and strategies to business challenges, integrating insights from various data analyses.
Derive detailed insights from our customer’s behaviors & journeys to enhance acquisitions, engagement and retention strategies.
Collaborate with Data Engineering, Strategy Development, and Product teams, contributing with valuable insights and technical expertise.
Perform other duties as needed, showcasing a willingness to take on complex challenges and mentor junior teammates.

About you
You have at least 3 years of proven experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar role.
Graduate degree in Data Science or another quantitative field preferred; BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
You have an analytical mind and are able to work with big amounts of data identifying patterns and relationships.
You can organise, store, protect data, and present it in an accurate and understandable manner.
You have strong math skills (e.g. statistics, algebra) and have an understanding of the underlying principles of common and custom Machine Learning algorithms.
You have deep knowledge of Python and their most useful libraries.
You have knowledge of SQL databases.
You have proven experience managing projects handling multiple stakeholders, identifying constraints, and organising processes to maximise efficiency.
You feel comfortable communicating in Spanish and in English, as they are the main language of our day-to-day operations.
Your are based in Barcelona or near Barcelona, or are willing to relocate.

Bonus skills
Familiarity with Javascript language.
Experience working with AWS console.
Experience using business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau).
Experience with Mixpanel.
… or another amazing skill you bring to the table that we haven’t thought of yet!

What’s it like to work remotely?
Work from the comfort of your own home.
Use the Edpuzzle office as much or as little as you like.
Meet with your manager and team via video calls on Google Meet or Slack.
Connect with coworkers via Slack (with channels for work and for fun!).
To enjoy our remote work policy, you’ll need high-speed internet access.

What we offer
Competitive salary at €36K – €43K based on your professional experience
Yearly salary review based on performance
Free private health insurance policy with AXA.
Meal allowance with Cobee: an annual budget of €2000 to spend on the restaurants and food delivery services you like the most
Free access to Wellhub’s wellness app and discounts on gyms, and well-being activities.
Flexible remuneration for childcare, transportation, and health insurance of immediate family members
24 paid holidays plus December 24th and 31st.
Flexible working hours and reduced working time on Fridays.
Remote-first: Feel free to work 100% remotely or use the Barcelona office whenever you want, for the best of both worlds!
Free coffee, snacks, and drinks in the Barcelona office.
Teambuilding events during working hours.
Incredible opportunity to grow, learn, and build lifetime bonds with other passionate people.

Edpuzzle is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.

This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Edpuzzle makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.

References from previous employers will be requested from candidates during the selection process. If you'd like to be considered for this position, please apply below. We look forward to hearing from you!

Apply for this job 🚀

4163537439.title: Data Scientist (Andorra)
4163537439.description:
About the job
At Gauss & Neumann, we are looking for PhDs, MSc and BS mathematics, physics and engineering to work with us in our office in Andorra. We do Search Engine Marketing (SEM) worldwide and work for international clients. We love and breath technology and everyone at the company has a tech background.

We believe that advertising on search engines (SEM) should provide perfect answers to the users. Gauss & Neumann creates data structures and technologies that help our clients deliver a perfect response to queries and provide value to search engine customers like Google or Bing.

What we look for:
Professionals with a PhD, MSc or bachelor degree in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or other engineering disciplines. We search for natural problem solvers with initiative that push the needle always a bit further and have the self-discipline to get things done. We look for people that have fun at work and create a great atmosphere with their teammates. We value personal attitude at the very top.

Responsibilities: 
Design SEM keyword structures for international clients
Create predictive algorithms for bidding in real time
Create scripts for optimizing keyword structures
Create technologies that disrupt the SEM industry
Data research and visualization
Manage campaign daily operations with large clients mainly in the United States.

What you need to have:
Bachelor, MSc or PhD level degree in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science or Software Engineering or similar engineering degree.
Programming skills (Python, SQL, PHP, R...).
Statistics knowledge

Other skills we value:
English fluency (written and verbal)
Project management experience
Natural ability to deal with ratios and numbers
Being up to date with programming libraries
Willingness to learn and go beyond what's necessary.

Why joining Gauss & Neumann: 
Gauss & Neumann provides an open environment of excellence with some of the best SEM professionals in the advertising industry. Most of our staff holds a PhD in Mathematics or Physics. G&N open culture provides unlimited vacation time, total daily autonomy, private insurance and the ability to run your own projects and take relevant decisions within the company.

Location: 
Our new office is right in the heart of the capital of Andorra, in the main shopping area in the center, with stunning views of the mountains and in a natural environment. Ideal for those who love outdoors and work surrounded by nature.

4141630586.title: Data Scientist
4141630586.description:
About the job
✨ ¿Te apasiona la tecnología y quieres impactar el sector energético? ✨
En Grupo DISA buscamos a una persona especialista en Ciencia de Datos para unirse a nuestro equipo de Transformación Digital. Disponemos de sedes en Tenerife, Gran Canaria y Madrid. Tu labor será clave para explotar el potencial de nuestros datos, generando modelos avanzados que optimicen procesos internos y redefinan la experiencia de las personas usuarias. 🔄

🎯 Tus principales responsabilidades
Diseñar y desarrollar modelos de Inteligencia Artificial, Aprendizaje Automático y Series Temporales para mejorar la toma de decisiones.
Aprovechar los activos de datos existentes e identificar nuevas oportunidades de análisis para impulsar el negocio.
Comprender los retos de nuestras personas usuarias y proponer soluciones innovadoras basadas en datos.

🛠️ Estas son las tecnologías con las que trabajarás:
Programación orientada a objetos: Python, Java, R 💻
Frameworks de Machine Learning: Scikit-learn, XGBoost, PyTorch, TensorFlow 🤖
Ecosistemas Big Data: Databricks, Spark, Scala 📊
Herramientas de visualización: Dash, Power BI, Qlik, Tableau 📊
Sistemas de gestión de repositorios de código: Git 🎓

💡 Requisitos y por qué son importantes
Grado en Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística, Física o similar: Esencial para comprender los fundamentos matemáticos y lógicos del análisis de datos.

🌟 Valorable:
Experiencia previa en un puesto similar (+2 años). Sin esta habilidad, sería imposible extraer insights valiosos.
Analítica avanzada y Machine Learning: La base para desarrollar modelos predictivos y optimizar procesos.
Análisis estadístico: Fundamental para interpretar datos y tomar decisiones basadas en evidencia.
Nivel alto de inglés: Nos permite trabajar con tecnologías globales y colaborar en entornos internacionales.
Conocimientos en protección de datos.

💼 Lo que ofrecemos:
 ✨ Contrato indefinido e incorporación inmediata.
 🎓 Formación continua y desarrollo profesional.
 ✨ Cultura de innovación y un equipo apasionado por la tecnología.
 🚀 Flexibilidad horaria y opciones de teletrabajo. Si resides en uno de nuestros centros de trabajo (Tenerife / Gran Canaria / Madrid) podrás acudir a nuestras sedes un día a la semana para conocer al equipo de trabajo. Tu horario: lunes a jueves entrada flexible de 7:30 a 9:00 a compensar con la salida de 16:30 a 18:00. / Viernes entrada flexible de 08:00 a 9:00 a compensar con la salida de 14:00 a 15:00

Si eres una persona proactiva, con ganas de aprender y de transformar el sector energético con datos, ¡esta es tu oportunidad! 🚀 ¡Únete a Grupo DISA y forma parte del cambio! 🌟

Las personas que concurran a los procesos de selección y evaluación serán valoradas en base a los requisitos del puesto de trabajo con objetividad, transparencia y respetando el principio de igualdad de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres.
✨ ¿Te apasiona la tecnología y quieres impactar el sector energético? ✨
En Grupo DISA buscamos a una persona especialista en Ciencia de Datos para unirse a nuestro equipo de Transformación Digital. Disponemos de sedes en Tenerife, Gran Canaria y Madrid. Tu labor será clave para explotar el potencial de nuestros datos, generando modelos avanzados que optimicen procesos internos y redefinan la experiencia de las personas usuarias. 🔄
🔄
🎯 Tus principales responsabilidades
Diseñar y desarrollar modelos de Inteligencia Artificial, Aprendizaje Automático y Series Temporales para mejorar la toma de decisiones.
Aprovechar los activos de datos existentes e identificar nuevas oportunidades de análisis para impulsar el negocio.
Comprender los retos de nuestras personas usuarias y proponer soluciones innovadoras basadas en datos.

Programación orientada a objetos: Python, Java, R 💻

Ecosistemas Big Data: Databricks, Spark, Scala 📊

4154540203.title: Data Scientist
4154540203.description:
About the job
En Imperia desarrollamos y comercializamos nuestro software de planificación de la cadena de suministro para que nuestros clientes puedan planificar de manera óptima su demanda, producción y compras. Actualmente nos encontramos en búsqueda de un R&D Specialist que se incorpore a nuestro equipo de Desarrollo. 

Requisitos para el puesto 👨🏽‍💻 

Ser graduado/a en Matemáticas, Estadística, Data Science o similares. 
Dominio de Python/R. 
Valorable conocimiento en C#. 
Ser una persona con capacidad de análisis y resolución de problemas. 
Valoraremos positivamente que tengas dominio de SQL y conocimientos básicos de programación. 

Serás responsable de… 🎯 

Diseñar y definir modelos de forecasting utilizando nuevas metodologías. 
Evaluar el rendimiento de los modelos actuales y realizar comparaciones contra los modelos de referencia. 
Desarrollo de algoritmos de optimización de operaciones, decisiones y gestión del mundo empresarial. 
Experimentar con diferentes modelos y estrategias de machine learning, RL, metaheurísticos. 
Trabajo de la mano del equipo de desarrollo para implementar las mejoras/nuevos diseños de modelos. 

Condiciones y beneficios 🍀
  Conciliación laboral y personal: no tenemos horario de entrada y salida fijo y los viernes hacemos jornada intensiva. 
Modalidad híbrida. 
Estabilidad laboral: contrato indefinido y a jornada completa. 
Revisiones salariales cada 6 meses + retribución flexible. 
23 días de vacaciones y la tarde del día de cumpleaños libre. 
Posibilidad de crecimiento y plan de carrera.  
Oficinas luminosas ubicadas en el Puerto de Valencia. 

Qué esperamos de ti 🙌🏼 

Mentalidad de crecimiento: ganas de superarse, aprender y buscar ser mejor cada día. 
Responsabilidad sobre el trabajo: sentido de responsabilidad y compromiso con lo que haces. 
Sinceridad y transparencia: autenticidad en cada cosa que hagas. 
 ¿Te unes al equipo? ¡Te estamos esperando! 🚀

4144168410.title: DATA SCIENTIST
4144168410.description:
About the job
Participa en un innovador proyecto de un organismo internacional, aportando al equipo tu experiencia como Data Scientist.

En ALTEN tenemos claro que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si cuentas con experiencia como Data Scientist y cuentas con amplia experiencia en Python y SQL, nosotros nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Te unes a nuestro #WelcomeHome? ¡Sigue leyendo!

¿Qué estamos buscando?
Experiencia de, al menos, 2-3 años en ciencia de datos, aprendizaje automático o modelado estadístico.
Dominio de Python, con experiencia en bibliotecas como Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow o PyTorch.
Fuertes habilidades en SQL para consultar y manipular grandes conjuntos de datos.
Experiencia con herramientas de visualización de datos como Power BI.
Conocimiento de plataformas en la nube como AWS o Azure es una ventaja.

¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?
Modelo híbrido en Barcelona
Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.
Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.
Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.
Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.
Retribución competitiva.

¿Quiénes somos?
Somos un equipo. Formamos parte de ALTEN, una multinacional europea especializada en proporcionar servicios de consultoría, tecnología de la información y servicios de ingeniería a las principales compañías del mercado español.

Si te gustan las cifras, te diremos que en España tenemos una facturación de 217 millones de euros, 9 sedes y un equipo formado por 5.240 personas.

Además, en ALTEN nos enorgullecemos de ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades con independencia de género, edad, diversidad de capacidades o país de origen. Nuestro compromiso está con el talento y con las personas que lo tienen.

Si crees que eres talento, apúntate!

4154307102.title: Data Scientist
4154307102.description:
About the job
You will join us as our new data scientist to work with large and complex data sets, with the autonomy to make a huge impact on the success of our mobile game titles. You will work as part of an experienced and highly skilled team with opportunities to learn and develop.

What You'll Do
Translate ambiguous business problems into measurable analytical components involving developing Statistical, Machine Learning models and simulation tools.
Research and implement model frameworks/techniques/methodologies to continuously improve the way of evaluating and monitoring player lifecycles, engagement, retention and payment trends, etc. in our games.
Write advanced SQL queries to extract/format data as well as use Python/ R to do exploratory analysis and develop models.
Translate computational solutions/statistical/ML models to implementable codes (mainly Python) and work with ML engineers to put the developed models into production.
Produce Model KPIs for monitoring the model performances post production to ensure the models work as expected.
Construct recommendations and strategic/tactical plans based on business data and market knowledge.
Collaborate with other related teams on Data Science and big data projects.

What We're Looking For
Ambiguity - able to deal with moderate levels of ambiguity by bringing clarity to the problem and communicating plans toward a solution with both technical and non-technical people.
Communication - able to talk, write, and listen effectively (in English) with business peers.
Business Acumen - understand key divisional business drivers, follow important game KPIs, familiar with key competitors.
Self-directed - suggest changes to high value process improvements, drive initiatives independently, maintain status updates, deliver project work in a timely manner with little supervision.
Analytical - experience with statistical and machine learning techniques, high degree of intellectual curiosity.
Good understanding of visualisations techniques and tools
About you: 
Typically have 2+ years of related work experience.
Bachelor/Master/PhD degree in a relevant technical field, or equivalent experience in a relevant role (Ideally Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Physics)
Experience in using Python and SQL. R-users are welcome but intermediate level of Python is required for this job due to the model productionalisation process.
Experience in working with large data sets, experience with moving computation towards the data layer.

Why Product Madness?

As part of the Aristocrat family, we share their mission of bringing joy to life through the power of play, with a world-class team who creates top-grossing, leading titles in the social casino genre, including Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino.

With 800 team members across the globe, Product Madness is headquartered in London, with offices in Barcelona, Gdańsk, Lviv, Montreal and a remote team spanning the USA, making us a truly global powerhouse.

We live by our People First principle. Regardless of where, when, or how they work, our team members have opportunities to elevate their careers, and grow alongside us. We take pride in fostering an inclusive culture, where our people are encouraged to be their very best, every day.

But don’t just take our word for it. In 2024, we made the Global Inspiring Workplace Awards list, and won a bronze award at the Stevies for Great Employers in the ‘Employer of the Year - Media and Entertainment’ category.

So, what’s stopping you?

Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Travel Expectations

None

At this time, we are unable to sponsor work visas for this position. Candidates must be authorized to work in the job posting location for this position on a full-time basis without the need for current or future visa sponsorship.
What You'll Do
Translate ambiguous business problems into measurable analytical components involving developing Statistical, Machine Learning models and simulation tools.
Research and implement model frameworks/techniques/methodologies to continuously improve the way of evaluating and monitoring player lifecycles, engagement, retention and payment trends, etc. in our games.
Write advanced SQL queries to extract/format data as well as use Python/ R to do exploratory analysis and develop models.
Translate computational solutions/statistical/ML models to implementable codes (mainly Python) and work with ML engineers to put the developed models into production.
Produce Model KPIs for monitoring the model performances post production to ensure the models work as expected.
Construct recommendations and strategic/tactical plans based on business data and market knowledge.
Collaborate with other related teams on Data Science and big data projects.

4172625305.title: Mid-Level Data Scientist
4172625305.description:
About the job
Company Description
Work smart, have fun and make an impact!

Our purpose is to guide all companies toward a sustainable world. EcoVadis is the leading provider of business sustainability ratings. Our solutions are backed by an international team of experts and powerful technology. We analyze data and build sustainability scorecards that give companies actionable insights into their environmental, social and ethical risks.

Why apply to EcoVadis? Be a part of the global sustainability change in business. Grow your career. Work with extraordinary people. Feel valued for your contribution.
Learn more about our team and culture on EcoVadis careers page.

Job Description
We are looking for a highly motivated Mid-Level Data Scientist to join our growing AI Center of Excellence team, responsible for using machine learning and natural language processing to drive innovation across the organization and accelerate positive impact on our planet and society. You will be part of the team of 25 scientists and engineers delivering solutions for our product portfolio and enhancing operational excellence.
Your global responsibilities will include (but will not be limited to):
Working with large, complex data sets to solve challenging business problems by applying advanced analytical methods as needed
Articulating and translating business questions into technical solutions
Building, benchmarking, and maintaining machine learning models and identifying data annotation efforts
Leveraging Python, MLflow, Azure stack (e.g., Azure cloud, Azure ML, Azure Data Factory) and Databricks to deliver end-to-end solutions
Staying in close contact with customers to evaluate their needs and recommend solutions that increase customer satisfaction and drive business value

Qualifications
Education and experience
Master’s degree in quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics/Applied Math, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science or a related field)
2+ years of overall experience in Machine Learning/NLP and data mining techniques
Knowledge of Machine Learning algorithms, frameworks and libraries, including deep learning frameworks
Good understanding of text representation techniques and experience in implementing NLP solutions (e.g., named entity recognition, information retrieval, question answering)
Strong analytical, mathematical, and coding skills
Strong communication skills
Any experience with Azure or other cloud provider would be a distinct advantage

Skills, abilities and work standards:
Continuous Learner – Ability to continually develop and improve one’s skill and knowledge to perform effectively and adapt to change in the workplace. Development occurs through a variety of learning opportunities, seeking feedback, and individual reflection.
Personally Effective - Making use of all of the personal resources at your disposal (talents, skills, energy, and time) to achieve goals.
Authentic - Being honest and authentic in communication, feedback and strategy.
Results-driven - Setting high goals for themselves and others. They accomplish their goals by effectively working through challenges and demonstrate commitment to the company's goals.
Creative Problem Solver - Focused on improving their practices and results. They are open to new ideas and they maximize available resources.
Collaborator & Partner - Works effectively with others to achieve shared goals through cooperation, sharing knowledge, joint problem-solving, and celebrating success.

Additional Information
Location: Hybrid in Barcelona (4 times a month in the office) or Remote from Spain
Start date: 2025

In return for your expertise, we offer:
Support with all the necessary office and IT equipment
Flexible working hours
Wellness allowance for mental and physical wellbeing
Access to professional mental health support
Referral bonus policy
Learning and development
Sustainability events and community involvement
Peer recognition program
Employee-led resource groups
Hybrid work organization (from the office or from home)
Remote work from abroad policy
Meals and Transportation Vouchers (Cobee card)
Dental Benefits
Life & Accident Insurance + Private Health Insurance
Paid employee volunteer day
Paid moving day (1/year)

Hybrid Monthly Allowance for electricity and Internet

Don’t fit all the criteria but still think you’d be a good candidate? Please apply anyway to give our hiring team the opportunity to assess your skills and to learn more about what you could bring to EcoVadis. We’re interested in hiring capable people, regardless of professional and educational background.

Can the hiring process be adjusted to suit my needs? Yes. We want everyone going through the hiring process with EcoVadis to feel confident that you are able to demonstrate your full potential. We welcome applications from disabled people, people with long-term health conditions, and neurodiverse candidates. If you need any adjustments, including the provision of interview questions, please let the hiring team know.

Our team’s strength comes from everyone’s uniqueness and is founded upon mutual respect. EcoVadis commits to equity, inclusion and reducing bias in our hiring processes. EcoVadis does not accept any form of discrimination based on color, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, citizenship, religion, beliefs, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, parental status, or any other protected characteristic that makes you unique. In your application, we encourage you to remove personal information such as: photographs, marital status, number of children, religion, gender, residential postal code, university graduation date, past medical or parental leave(s) taken, nationality (instead, please state if you are legally eligible to work in the job region/country), university name (instead, please state any degrees obtained and the study major).
Company Description
Work smart, have fun and make an impact!
Our purpose is to guide all companies toward a sustainable world. EcoVadis is the leading provider of business sustainability ratings. Our solutions are backed by an international team of experts and powerful technology. We analyze data and build sustainability scorecards that give companies actionable insights into their environmental, social and ethical risks.
Our purpose is to guide all companies toward a sustainable world
Why apply to EcoVadis? Be a part of the global sustainability change in business. Grow your career. Work with extraordinary people. Feel valued for your contribution.
Why apply to EcoVadis?
Learn more about our team and culture on EcoVadis careers page.
Job Description
We are looking for a highly motivated Mid-Level Data Scientist to join our growing AI Center of Excellence team, responsible for using machine learning and natural language processing to drive innovation across the organization and accelerate positive impact on our planet and society. You will be part of the team of 25 scientists and engineers delivering solutions for our product portfolio and enhancing operational excellence.
Mid-Level Data Scientist
Your global responsibilities will include (but will not be limited to):
Working with large, complex data sets to solve challenging business problems by applying advanced analytical methods as needed
Articulating and translating business questions into technical solutions
Building, benchmarking, and maintaining machine learning models and identifying data annotation efforts
Leveraging Python, MLflow, Azure stack (e.g., Azure cloud, Azure ML, Azure Data Factory) and Databricks to deliver end-to-end solutions
Staying in close contact with customers to evaluate their needs and recommend solutions that increase customer satisfaction and drive business value

Good understanding of text representation techniques and experience in implementing NLP solutions (e.g., named entity recognition, information retrieval, question answering)
Strong analytical, mathematical, and coding skills
Strong communication skills

4175871085.title: Data Scientist
4175871085.description:
About the job
About Halr Tech Group

At Halr Tech Group, we specialise in technology-driven recruitment, seamlessly connecting leading companies with top-tier talent across IT, tech, engineering, and sales. We focus on finding skilled professionals who drive innovation and deliver impactful results.

About the Role
We are seeking a Data Scientist to join a forward-thinking team in the EMEA region. This role involves working with large datasets, applying statistical analysis, and leveraging machine learning to drive business insights and develop predictive models.
The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, experience in data-driven decision-making, and expertise in working with modern data science tools and frameworks.

OTE - Y1 - €60,000

Key Responsibilities
Develop and implement machine learning models to solve complex business problems.
Analyse large datasets to extract meaningful insights and drive strategic decision-making.
Work with structured and unstructured data from multiple sources.
Design and maintain data pipelines for processing and transforming data efficiently.
Collaborate with engineering, product, and business teams to apply data-driven solutions.
Develop and optimise predictive models for forecasting and automation.
Conduct A/B testing and statistical analysis to evaluate performance metrics.
Visualise and present findings using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib.
Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance with industry standards.

Requirements
3+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python, R, or SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms and statistical modelling techniques.
Experience with big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, Databricks) is a plus.
Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes).
Hands-on experience with data visualisation tools and dashboarding.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work with complex datasets.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.

Nice to Have
Experience with deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) or computer vision.
Exposure to MLOps for deploying machine learning models at scale.
Experience in financial services, healthcare, or e-commerce analytics.

Benefits
Highly competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
Remote/hybrid working options across the EMEA region.
Access to cutting-edge AI/ML projects and technologies.
Professional development and certification support.
Comprehensive benefits package (health insurance, pension, etc.).

How to Apply
If you are a data-driven professional passionate about using analytics and machine learning to solve real-world challenges, we encourage you to apply!

4137521822.title: Data Scientist
4137521822.description:
About the job
¿Quieres un desafío profesional en una consultora IT de primer nivel? ¡Esta es tu oportunidad! En Intelequia, nos encontramos en búsqueda de talento innovador y apasionado por las tecnologías de vanguardia para unirse a nuestro equipo.


Con más de 15 años de experiencia en el sector y reconocidos como una de las mejores empresas de tecnología para trabajar en España, según Great Place To Work, estamos especializados en realizar servicios TIC en la nube operando a nivel nacional e internacional, abarcando áreas como Infraestructura, Ciberseguridad, Inteligencia Artificial y Desarrollos en .NET y Low Code

.
Nuestra misión es acompañar a nuestros clientes en cada etapa de sus proyectos de IT, liderando sus iniciativas y ofreciendo soluciones punteras que impulsen su crecimiento y eficiencia en un entorno tecnológico cada vez más competitivo. Si estás dispuesto a asumir nuevos retos y formar parte de un equipo comprometido con la excelencia, ¡queremos conocerte!

¿QUÉ BUSCAMOS?
Un/a Data Scientist, con al menos 2 años de experiencia en el sector.

FUNCIONES
Realizar análisis exploratorios de datos para comprender los patrones y tendencias de los datos.
Construir y entrenar modelos de machine learning para resolver problemas de negocio y predecir resultados.
Implementar modelos de machine learning en sistemas de producción.
Interpretar y comunicar los resultados del análisis de datos a stakeholders técnicos y no técnicos.
Mantenerse actualizado sobre las últimas técnicas y herramientas de ciencia de datos.

REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS

Formación en Ingeniería Técnica/Informática o similares.
Valorable estar en posición de master vinculado al sector IT
Conocimientos en Python o R.
Conocimientos sólidos en estadística y técnicas de machine learning.
Experiencia con bibliotecas de machine learning populares (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn).
Habilidades de visualización de datos para comunicar resultados de forma clara y efectiva (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly).
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y colaboración.
Capacidad para trabajar de forma independiente y como parte de un equipo.
Orientación a los detalles y capacidad para resolver problemas.

Porque en Intelequia creemos firmemente que el bienestar de nuestro equipo influye directamente en el trabajo realizado, para ello TE OFRECEMOS:

Incorporarte a un proyecto ilusionante y motivador, que despertará la pasión que hay en ti.
Plan de desarrollo profesional para potenciar tu perfil (certificaciones, formaciones en idiomas y competencias profesionales, etc.)
Modelo de trabajo híbrido (sólo 2 días de trabajo al mes en nuestra sede de Tenerife).
Jornada laboral de 38 horas/semana.
25 días hábiles de vacaciones al año.
Tarde de cumpleaños libre.
Plan de retribución flexible para tu beneficio.
Formar parte de una empresa Great Place to Work.
Crecer y aportar junto a grandes profesionales, dentro de un buen clima laboral.

4149266631.title: Data Scientist
4149266631.description:
About the job
Description

Ryanair Labs is the technology brand of Ryanair, a start-up inside a corporation and a state of-the-art digital & IT innovation hub creating Europe’s Leading Travel Experience for customers. More than 600+ IT enthusiasts are working on 30+ projects with a collaboration of our Dublin, Madrid, Wroclaw and Portugal Labs teams and are making your travel experience unique. As a result of our continued expansion, we want to hear from the best IT experts the European market has to offer to join our Labs.

The Role

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join a multi-disciplinary team tackling complex, unsolved challenges with the potential for real business impact across the Ryanair network. You will own your work from ideation and problem definition to final implementation, driving solutions for high-impact commercial projects.

Requirements

Relevant work experience.
Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, etc.).
Proven problem solver – the ability to come up with unique solutions to unique problems.
Professional experience in working with large data sets.
Strong programming skills in Python and knowledge of analytical packages (pandas, NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn etc.) and SQL.
Strong statistical background – Ability to back claims in your findings with rigorous statistical analysis.
Following good coding practises (OOP, code review, unit testing, PEP8 guidelines etc.).
At least basic knowledge of code versioning systems (e.g. Git) and DevOps tools (e.g. Docker, CI/CD).
Broad knowledge of Machine Learning topics (clustering, forecasting, classification, regression, anomaly detection).
Experiment design knowledge – Ability to set up an experiment to measure the impact of your models against company goals.
Proven track record of being able to deliver insight with the ability to visualize and explain a model to a target audience.
Experience implementing real-world projects in commercial area.
Fluent in English

Nice To Have

Experience in pricing.
Experience with real-time data projects.
Experience with PySpark.
Experience in cloud technologies (AWS, Databricks, Azure …).
Experience in causal inference. 

Benefits

We promote innovation, all our teams are Agile and several PoCs of new technologies or innovative ideas are launched every week.
A competitive but flexible technical career plan.
We believe in an hybrid working model, you can work up to three days per week remote, but you are also going to enjoy the excellent work environment at our modern offices in the heart of Madrid.
Optional discounts on health insurances (various companies).
Travel discounts, of course!

Competencies

Dependability

Communication

Interpersonal Skills

Following good coding practises (OOP, code review, unit testing, PEP8 guidelines etc.).
At least basic knowledge of code versioning systems (e.g. Git) and DevOps tools (e.g. Docker, CI/CD).
Broad knowledge of Machine Learning topics (clustering, forecasting, classification, regression, anomaly detection).
Experiment design knowledge – Ability to set up an experiment to measure the impact of your models against company goals.
Proven track record of being able to deliver insight with the ability to visualize and explain a model to a target audience.
Experience implementing real-world projects in commercial area.
Fluent in English
Nice To Have
Experience in pricing.
Experience with real-time data projects.
Experience with PySpark.
Experience in cloud technologies (AWS, Databricks, Azure …).
Experience in causal inference.

Experience in causal inference.
Benefits
We promote innovation, all our teams are Agile and several PoCs of new technologies or innovative ideas are launched every week.
A competitive but flexible technical career plan.
We believe in an hybrid working model, you can work up to three days per week remote, but you are also going to enjoy the excellent work environment at our modern offices in the heart of Madrid.
Optional discounts on health insurances (various companies).

4173586482.title: Data Scientist
4173586482.description:
About the job
Únete al equipo de un proyecto del sector comercio y demuestra tu experiencia como Data Scientist.

En ALTEN tenemos claro que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes experiencia como Data Scientist, nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Te unes a nuestro #WelcomeHome? ¡Sigue leyendo!

¿Qué buscamos?
Experiencia de, al menos, 2 años como Data Scientist.
Experiencia con base de datos SQL.
Experiencia con Python.
Experiencia en librerías como Panda o NymPy.
Experiencia en visualización de datos con PowerBI.
Valorable experiencia en entorno cloud con AWS o Azure.
Valorable formación en Data Science, Estadística, Matemáticas o similar.
Interés en modalidad híbrida en Barcelona.

¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?
Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.
Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.
Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.
Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.
Retribución competitiva.

¿Quiénes somos?
Somos un equipo. Formamos parte de ALTEN, una multinacional europea especializada en proporcionar servicios de consultoría, tecnología de la información y servicios de ingeniería a las principales compañías del mercado español.

Si te gustan las cifras, te diremos que en España tenemos una facturación de 217 millones de euros, 9 sedes y un equipo formado por 5.240 personas.

Además, en ALTEN nos enorgullecemos de ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades con independencia de género, edad, diversidad de capacidades o país de origen. Nuestro compromiso está con el talento y con las personas que lo tienen.

Si crees que eres talento, ¡apúntate!

4154305365.title: Data Scientist
4154305365.description:
About the job
You will join us as our new data scientist to work with large and complex data sets, with the autonomy to make a huge impact on the success of our mobile game titles. You will work as part of an experienced and highly skilled team with opportunities to learn and develop.

What You'll Do
Translate ambiguous business problems into measurable analytical components involving developing Statistical, Machine Learning models and simulation tools.
Research and implement model frameworks/techniques/methodologies to continuously improve the way of evaluating and monitoring player lifecycles, engagement, retention and payment trends, etc. in our games.
Write advanced SQL queries to extract/format data as well as use Python/ R to do exploratory analysis and develop models.
Translate computational solutions/statistical/ML models to implementable codes (mainly Python) and work with ML engineers to put the developed models into production.
Produce Model KPIs for monitoring the model performances post production to ensure the models work as expected.
Construct recommendations and strategic/tactical plans based on business data and market knowledge.
Collaborate with other related teams on Data Science and big data projects.

What We're Looking For
Ambiguity - able to deal with moderate levels of ambiguity by bringing clarity to the problem and communicating plans toward a solution with both technical and non-technical people.
Communication - able to talk, write, and listen effectively (in English) with business peers.
Business Acumen - understand key divisional business drivers, follow important game KPIs, familiar with key competitors.
Self-directed - suggest changes to high value process improvements, drive initiatives independently, maintain status updates, deliver project work in a timely manner with little supervision.
Analytical - experience with statistical and machine learning techniques, high degree of intellectual curiosity.
Good understanding of visualisations techniques and tools
About you: 
Typically have 2+ years of related work experience.
Bachelor/Master/PhD degree in a relevant technical field, or equivalent experience in a relevant role (Ideally Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Physics)
Experience in using Python and SQL. R-users are welcome but intermediate level of Python is required for this job due to the model productionalisation process.
Experience in working with large data sets, experience with moving computation towards the data layer.

Why Product Madness?

As part of the Aristocrat family, we share their mission of bringing joy to life through the power of play, with a world-class team who creates top-grossing, leading titles in the social casino genre, including Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino.

With 800 team members across the globe, Product Madness is headquartered in London, with offices in Barcelona, Gdańsk, Lviv, Montreal and a remote team spanning the USA, making us a truly global powerhouse.

We live by our People First principle. Regardless of where, when, or how they work, our team members have opportunities to elevate their careers, and grow alongside us. We take pride in fostering an inclusive culture, where our people are encouraged to be their very best, every day.

But don’t just take our word for it. In 2024, we made the Global Inspiring Workplace Awards list, and won a bronze award at the Stevies for Great Employers in the ‘Employer of the Year - Media and Entertainment’ category.

So, what’s stopping you?

Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Travel Expectations

None

At this time, we are unable to sponsor work visas for this position. Candidates must be authorized to work in the job posting location for this position on a full-time basis without the need for current or future visa sponsorship.
What You'll Do
Translate ambiguous business problems into measurable analytical components involving developing Statistical, Machine Learning models and simulation tools.
Research and implement model frameworks/techniques/methodologies to continuously improve the way of evaluating and monitoring player lifecycles, engagement, retention and payment trends, etc. in our games.
Write advanced SQL queries to extract/format data as well as use Python/ R to do exploratory analysis and develop models.
Translate computational solutions/statistical/ML models to implementable codes (mainly Python) and work with ML engineers to put the developed models into production.
Produce Model KPIs for monitoring the model performances post production to ensure the models work as expected.
Construct recommendations and strategic/tactical plans based on business data and market knowledge.
Collaborate with other related teams on Data Science and big data projects.

4135284000.title: Data Scientist
4135284000.location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
4135284000.description:
About the job
Sobre nosotros: 
En ORBIDI, somos pioneros en el uso de tecnología avanzada, inteligencia artificial y modelos predictivos para propulsar el crecimiento de las pequeñas y medianas empresas (PYMEs). Nuestra pasión por la innovación y el marketing nos motiva a buscar soluciones creativas que permitan a las empresas no solo competir, sino destacar en el mercado actual. Creemos firmemente en el poder de la digitalización y cómo esta puede transformar los negocios para mejor. Buscamos talentos creativos y estratégicos que compartan nuestra visión y deseo de hacer una diferencia tangible en el mundo empresarial.
El rol:
Buscamos un Data Scientist talentoso con la capacidad de analizar grandes conjuntos de datos para extraer insights valiosos y desarrollar modelos predictivos que respalden los objetivos comerciales. El candidato ideal debe tener experiencia en el diseño, implementación y optimización de modelos de machine learning para problemas de pronóstico, clasificación o clustering. Además, se espera que el candidato sea competente en el procesamiento y limpieza de datos, así como en la creación de visualizaciones claras y reportes que comuniquen hallazgos a las partes interesadas. Se valorará la capacidad de trabajar en equipos multidisciplinarios para entender las necesidades de datos y presentar recomendaciones basadas en análisis rigurosos. El conocimiento de herramientas de big data y técnicas estadísticas avanzadas es esencial, así como el compromiso con el aprendizaje continuo en el campo de la ciencia de datos.
¿Cuál será tu misión?
Analizar grandes conjuntos de datos para extraer insights accionables, identificar tendencias y desarrollar modelos predictivos que respalden los objetivos comerciales.
Diseñar, implementar y optimizar modelos de machine learning para problemas de pronóstico, clasificación o agrupamiento.
Procesar, limpiar y verificar la integridad de los datos utilizados para el análisis; identificar patrones, tendencias y relaciones en los datos.
Crear visualizaciones de datos claras y fáciles de entender, así como informes para comunicar insights y hallazgos a las partes interesadas.
Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con equipos multidisciplinarios (ingeniería, producto, marketing, etc.) para entender las necesidades de datos, desarrollar soluciones y presentar recomendaciones.
Diseñar y analizar pruebas A/B para medir la efectividad de los cambios y mejoras en productos o procesos.
Utilizar herramientas de big data (Hadoop, Spark, etc.) y plataformas en la nube (AWS, GCP, Azure) para procesar y analizar datos a gran escala.
Aplicar técnicas estadísticas avanzadas como análisis de regresión, pruebas de hipótesis y análisis de series temporales.
Ayudar en el desarrollo de estrategias de datos y políticas de gobernanza de datos para la organización.
Mantenerse al día con las últimas herramientas, técnicas y mejores prácticas de ciencia de datos; participar en el aprendizaje continuo y en el desarrollo profesional.
Lo que te hará triunfar:
Título universitario (se prefiere maestría o doctorado) en Ciencia de Datos, Estadística, Informática, Matemáticas o un campo relacionado.
Más de 2 años de experiencia en ciencia de datos, machine learning o un campo relacionado.
Dominio de lenguajes de programación como Python o R.
Sólido conocimiento de frameworks de machine learning (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, etc.).
Experiencia con bibliotecas de manipulación de datos (Pandas, NumPy).
Habilidades en SQL para consultar bases de datos.
Familiaridad con herramientas de visualización de datos (Tableau, Power BI o matplotlib).
Experiencia con plataformas de computación en la nube (AWS, GCP, Azure).
Fuerte base en estadísticas, probabilidad y técnicas de optimización matemática.
Capacidad para explicar conceptos técnicos complejos a partes interesadas no técnicas de manera clara y concisa.
Capacidad demostrada para resolver problemas complejos y pensar de manera crítica y creativa.
Beneficios:
🕑Flexibilidad horaria
💎Oficinas modernas en Sant Cugat, frente a la estación de FGC de Mirasol.
💰Salario competitivo y contrato indefinido
🤑Bonus basado en el cumplimiento de objetivos de tu equipo
🌴23 días laborales de vacaciones + 🎂día de cumpleaños
🏠Formato Híbrido con teletrabajo 2 días a la semana.
😍Jornada intensiva todos los viernes del año.
📅Agosto flexible
🥳Actividades de teambuilding y celebraciones y off-sites
🤩Referral Program
🤸🏻‍♀️Descuento en gimnasio
🍎Fruta en oficina
Si tienes una pasión por el marketing digital, la creación de contenido y el diseño, y buscas un rol donde puedas dejar tu huella y contribuir al éxito de las PYMEs, ¡ORBIDI es el lugar para ti! Te invitamos a aplicar y ser parte de nuestro equipo creativo y estratégico.

4172636856.title: Senior Data Scientist
4172636856.location: Campo de Criptana, Castile-La Mancha, Spain
4172636856.description:
About the job
¡TRABAJA CON NOSOTROS COMO SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST!

Buscamos un profesional altamente capacitado en la explotación de datos, análisis avanzado y machine learning para impulsar proyectos de analítica avanzada y predicción en un entorno de Big Data, además de liderar la toma de decisiones sobre la explotación de datos, el diseño de pipelines de datos, la selección de algoritmos para proyectos de machine learning y la definición del ciclo de vida completo de estos proyectos.

¿Conoces la empresa?

Cojali S. L. es una multinacional española 🇪🇸📍 fabricante de componentes y electrónica, que desarrolla, además, soluciones de diagnosis avanzada, conectividad y diagnosis remota para vehículo industrial, maquinaria agrícola, maquinaria de construcción, equipo de manejo de material y embarcaciones, así como soluciones de compatibilidad ISOBUS para tractores e implementos. 🚛🚌🚜🚤

🏅 Gracias a la amplia experiencia en el desarrollo de soluciones tecnológicas embarcadas y para el taller, Cojali trabaja activamente en el análisis y tratamiento de datos 📲💻, siendo esta una actividad estratégica de la empresa que le permite introducir procesos de mejora y nuevos productos al mercado. 📈

🌍 La empresa está ubicada en Campo de Criptana (Ciudad Real) 📌, pero además cuenta con tres filiales (Italia 🇮🇹, Francia 🇫🇷 y Estados Unidos 🇺🇸) y cuatro oficinas comerciales (Alemania 🇩🇪, Rusia 🇷🇺, Turquía 🇹🇷, México 🇲🇽 e India 🇮🇳).

💪🏼👥 Contamos con más de 30 años de experiencia y con un equipo humano de más de 550 profesionales dedicados a diferentes áreas.

😊📈 Para nosotros es de vital importancia el crecimiento personal y profesional de nuestros empleados, por ello, apostamos por la formación continua 👨‍🏫, el trabajo en equipo 🤜🏼🤛🏼, la innovación 💡 y el desarrollo del talento.

🤓 Si te gustaría formar parte de la familia Cojali, te contamos un poco más ⬇

¿Qué tiene Cojali para ti?

✅ Flexibilidad horaria para que puedas compaginar tu vida personal y profesional. 🕐
✅ Un ambiente de trabajo agradable y dinámico. 🤗
✅ Plan de carrera en base a tus intereses profesionales. 🔍
✅ Incorporación a un equipo joven en constante crecimiento. 😎
✅ Promoción interna. 📈👏🏼
✅ Salario competitivo y progresivo según valía. 💰

¿Qué tipo de personas estamos buscando?

🧐🔍 Buscamos personas con actitud positiva, espíritu proactivo, dinámicas y resolutivas, que les guste trabajar en equipo, que estén comprometidas con la empresa y que, por supuesto, tengan capacidad para proyectar nuevas ideas y desarrollar su creatividad, proponiendo nuevas maneras de hacer las cosas.

¿Cómo será tu día a día?

Entre otras funciones las más habituales serán…

Procesamiento y explotación de datos:
✅Diseño y optimización de pipelines de datos para el procesamiento de grandes volúmenes de datos estructurados y no estructurados.
✅Integración de fuentes de datos externas e internas, asegurando la calidad y la consistencia de los datos.
✅Análisis exploratorio de datos (EDA), limpieza, transformación y enriquecimiento de datos para su posterior análisis.
✅Desarrollo de análisis descriptivos e inferenciales para identificar patrones, tendencias y relaciones en los datos.

Implementación de proyectos de Machine Learning:
✅Enfoque y liderazgo en la implementación de proyectos de machine learning predictivo, desde la concepción hasta la producción.
✅Selección de modelos adecuados (regresión, clasificación, clustering, etc.), pruebas y optimización de algoritmos (XGBoost, Random Forest, SVM, redes neuronales, etc.).
✅Gestión del ciclo de vida completo del proyecto de machine learning, desde la recolección y preparación de datos hasta la validación, evaluación y despliegue de modelos.
✅Implementación de modelos en producción utilizando técnicas de DevOps para ML (MLops), y monitoreo de su rendimiento.

Colaboración y liderazgo técnico:
✅Colaborar estrechamente con otros miembros del equipo.
✅Orientar y apoyar en la toma de decisiones sobre la selección de tecnologías, herramientas y metodologías de análisis de datos.
✅Definir y aplicar buenas prácticas de gestión de proyectos de datos y documentación técnica.


¿Cuáles son los requisitos?

Eres un/a excelente candidato/a si cuentas con…

✅Python avanzado
✅Conocimiento en SQL y NoSQL
✅Experiencia en entornos de Big Data (por ejemplo, Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.) y procesamiento de grandes volúmenes de datos.
✅Profundo conocimiento en machine learning supervisado y no supervisado, técnicas de deep learning (si es aplicable), y evaluación de modelos (validación cruzada, métricas de desempeño, etc.).
✅Conocimiento de modelos avanzados: redes neuronales, aprendizaje profundo, y técnicas de optimización.
✅Familiaridad en entorno Azure.
✅Experiencia mínima de 3 a 5 años en roles relacionados con análisis de datos, machine learning y Big Data.
✅Experiencia en implementación de modelos predictivos en proyectos reales y despliegue de estos en producción.

¿Cómo puedes destacar entre los candidatos?

Serías un candidato ideal si cuentas con…

✅ Conocimientos en MLOps y el ciclo de vida de los modelos (preparación de datos, entrenamiento, validación, despliegue, monitoreo).
✅Experiencia trabajando con entornos de Big Data y herramientas relacionadas.
✅Capacidad para seleccionar las herramientas y metodologías más adecuadas según el proyecto.
✅ Habilidad para comunicar insights técnicos y complejos de manera clara a equipos no técnicos.
✅ Capacidad para liderar y gestionar proyectos de machine learning de principio a fin.
✅ Colaboración con equipos multifuncionales y stakeholders para la correcta implementación de soluciones.
✅Conocimiento de metodologías ágiles (Scrum, Kanban).

Si crees que este puede ser tu perfil... ¡Te estamos esperando! 😏 ¡Únete a nuestro equipo! 🙌
¡TRABAJA CON NOSOTROS COMO SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST!
SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST
Buscamos un profesional altamente capacitado en la explotación de datos, análisis avanzado y machine learning para impulsar proyectos de analítica avanzada y predicción en un entorno de Big Data, además de liderar la toma de decisiones sobre la explotación de datos, el diseño de pipelines de datos, la selección de algoritmos para proyectos de machine learning y la definición del ciclo de vida completo de estos proyectos.
explotación de datos
análisis avanzado
machine learning

Cojali S. L. es una multinacional española 🇪🇸📍 fabricante de componentes y electrónica, que desarrolla, además, soluciones de diagnosis avanzada, conectividad y diagnosis remota para vehículo industrial, maquinaria agrícola, maquinaria de construcción, equipo de manejo de material y embarcaciones, así como soluciones de compatibilidad ISOBUS para tractores e implementos. 🚛🚌🚜🚤
Cojali S. L.
🏅 Gracias a la amplia experiencia en el desarrollo de soluciones tecnológicas embarcadas y para el taller, Cojali trabaja activamente en el análisis y tratamiento de datos 📲💻, siendo esta una actividad estratégica de la empresa que le permite introducir procesos de mejora y nuevos productos al mercado. 📈
🌍 La empresa está ubicada en Campo de Criptana (Ciudad Real) 📌, pero además cuenta con tres filiales (Italia 🇮🇹, Francia 🇫🇷 y Estados Unidos 🇺🇸) y cuatro oficinas comerciales (Alemania 🇩🇪, Rusia 🇷🇺, Turquía 🇹🇷, México 🇲🇽 e India 🇮🇳).

4167543057.title: Data Scientist
4167543057.description:
About the job
¡Hola! 🙋

¿Todavía no conoces HIBERUS TECNOLOGÍA? Somos una empresa de #tecnología construida con un ingrediente diferencial, la HIPERESPECIALIZACIÓN.

Formar parte de Hiberus significa crecimiento, pasión por la tecnología, interés por la innovación, ambiente laboral flexible y colaborativo, compañerismo, aprendizaje, formación continua, motivación y superación ante nuevos retos...y esto es solo el principio.
Somos más de 3.500 profesionales y no paramos de crecer!🙌
Actualmente contamos con más de 36 hubs de desarrollo en España, EEUU, Reino Unido, Alemania, Rumanía, Italia, Andorra, Marruecos, Argentina, México y Colombia ¡Estamos redefiniendo el mapa tecnológico mundial! 🌐 💻

Trabajamos muy duro, para transformar nuestra vida a través de la tecnología y queremos contar contigo para seguir creciendo. Si lo tuyo es el mundo IT, te gusta estar al día en las últimas tecnologías y quieres asumir un nuevo reto profesional ¡Sigue leyendo, te estamos buscando!!

🔎¿Qué estamos buscando?
Buscamos un/a Data Scientist para formar parte de grandes proyectos retadores.
Buscamos personas que nos ayuden a seguir creciendo, con ganas de aportar y seguir evolucionando de la mano de los mejores profesionales, pero sobre todo... ¡en Hiberus buscamos buena gente!😉

📋🖋️ Habilidades y requisitos
2-3 años de experiencia en optimización matemática y experiencia en modelización y resolución de problemas, tanto con métodos exactos como procedimientos heurísticos.
Conocimiento de fundamentos de optimización lineal y aplicaciones en problemas con variables enteras y binarias
Dominio de Python y librería pandas y programación orientada a objetos.

💻 Algunas de tus funciones 
Participación en sesiones con los usuarios de la unidad de negocio para entender los requerimientos.
Proponer soluciones basadas en optimización matemática que cumplan las necesidades de los usuarios.
Probar varias formulaciones.
Encajar el modelo dentro de un producto y llegar a tenerlo en producción para el uso real.
Estar en el continuo contacto con los usuarios para introducir posibles cambios o ajustes.

🙌¿Qué te ofrecemos?
💼 Contrato indefinido en una compañía puramente tecnológica, que forma parte de un gran grupo, solvente y en crecimiento.
💰 Salario fijo competitivo + bonificación
🏖️ Ambiente familiar, cercano, ¡como una gran familia!
⏰ Conciliación con nuestra vida personal y laboral mediante horario flexible, desconexión digital, jornada intensiva viernes y verano.
🤙 Cultura “techie”, nos gusta estar en contacto con la tecnología, herramientas, y últimas novedades!
📚 ¡Formación! Siempre que quieras, disfrutarás de un amplio catálogo de cursos formativos, adaptados a tu perfil profesional, inquietudes y novedades del sector. Para ello, pondremos a tu disposición todo el potencial de nuestra Hiberus University y los acuerdos con los principales fabricantes.
💳 ¡Benefíciate! Programa de retribución flexible a medida: seguro médico, tarjeta de transporte público, cheques guardería, tarjeta restaurante, etc.

En Hiberus estamos viviendo un crecimiento explosivo 💥 y queremos que formes parte de nuestro equipo.
Suena bien, ¿verdad? Si quieres saber más, ¡inscríbete y te contamos!
Si quieres saber más busca nuestros hashtag #somoshiberus #lascosasocurrenaquí y conoce todo lo que hacemos.


Hablamos?

www.hiberus.com

#somosHiberus y tú? Te animas?🚀
