4178482425.title: Data Scientist - (F/H)
4178482425.description:
About the job
Started in France in 2016, Mytraffic mission is to empower commerce professionals with the best location analytics and insights to be smarter every day and design the best experiences in physical locations.

We already serve more than 500 customers in many different sectors (Retail, Real Estate, Consulting Companies, Cities…) all over Europe to help them expand their businesses, analyze or predict performances of investments, understand their customers’ habits, benchmark their results with competition… Mytraffic is a hyper growing scale up (+110%/year) supported by 30 Millions € Series B fundraising round with Axa Venture Partners, Alven and Kernel Investissements in November 2022 to finance its European expansion.

In January 2024, Mytraffic announced the strategic acquisition of the Spanish start up Geoblink, becoming Europe's premier location intelligence platform.

📝Job Description

As a Data Scientist at Mytraffic you will be responsible for answering business questions vital to our clients, based on data.

Mytraffic relies on a large amount of spatial datasets to model urban behaviour, which can be used to make decisions such as: where are my competitors? Which is the best location for a new site? Which features are driving my sales? Is my point of sale under/over performing with respect to its potential?

Our dataset streams come from both internal data (coming directly from our customers for their own use) and external data (retrieved, cleaned and prepared internally at Mytraffic from several sources), which are used to deliver analyses and insights allowing our customers to understand their current and past business situation (descriptive analytics), providing them with models and tools to be able to predict the impact and effects of potential business actions and decisions (predictive analytics) and, at a higher level, recommend them which of those actions and decisions should be taken to maximise their final revenue (prescriptive analytics).

To do so we rely heavily on Python, and more precisely, on three different types of technology: data management and analysis tools (e.g. Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn,Plotnine, Jupyter...), machine learning frameworks (e.g. scikit-learn, LIME...) and software development oriented libraries (e.g. Flask, Pytest..)

🤝 About Our Team

You will be part of a team called Predictive Analytics, responsible for answering business questions vital to our clients, based on data.

💼 To give you more details about your day-to-day at MyTraffic :

 Design, develop, monitor and maintain a wide range of explanatory and predictive models and integrate them into the production environment so users can make predictions in real time.
 Analyze the most extensive and complete spatial database to understand a wide range of industries (retail, real-state, fmcg, e-mobility) consumer's behaviour patterns, etc.
 Load & Extract data from our datalakes and databases to support clients or build reports.
 Work closely with the rest of the team including Business profiles, the CustomerSuccess team, and other Data Scientists and Software Engineers to understand everyone’s needs and develop optimal solutions.

🫵 About You

We are looking for a Data Scientist (at least 3 years experiences excluding internships) passionate about finding, processing and modelling data to solve real world problems.

You would be one of the main points of reference for clients to, given a business problem, figure out how to solve it with the existing datasets, or how to find out those which could be useful to complement the existing ones.

Here Are Some Other Things We’re Looking For

 BS or MS in degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or a related field. The candidate should have a solid foundation in the relevant technical concepts and principles.
 You have the ability to approach complex problems with analytical capabilities and critical thinking skills, enjoy facing challenging problems, and are able to apply logical reasoning to find solutions.
 Proficiency in Python programming, including the ability to write functions and classes. You must be comfortable using Python as your primary programming language and be willing to learn and apply additional patterns and best practices.
 Experience in analyzing data using Python and common libraries such asPandas and Scikit-learn.
 You have an excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, SVM, Decision Trees, Random Forests, XGBoost, etc., although you are aware that the best solution sometimes is the simplest, and you know when to use one or another solution.
 A good understanding of statistics, including probability theory and common statistical tests.
 Experience with SQL queries, an understanding of different types of joins and the ability to retrieve and manipulate data from relational databases effectively.
 Experience working on projects involving data analysis.
 Familiarity with Linux systems and comfort working through the command line. This means being able to navigate and perform tasks using the command line interface.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills, particularly the ability to explain complex analyses to non-technical audiences (stakeholders and clients) in Spanis hand English.
 Ability to find a balance between real-life constraints (e.g.,deadlines, available data) and desired outcomes (e.g., accuracy, over delivery).
 Passionate about what you do. You care deeply about the things you build.

You Will Get Extra Kudos If You Have

 Client-facing experience
 Fluency or understanding of French or German.
 Experience working in a cloud based environment (AWS, GCP...)
 Experience working with distributed databases like Google BigQuery.
 Experience working with spatial data or GIS systems and/or mobility data.
You are familiar with writing Python packages and tested code (e.g. PEP8, Pytest...)

🎁 What We Offer

Joining our scale-up means:

✅ Tailored support – Join an experienced team that will help you grow and develop your skills.

✅ A real impact – Your contributions will play a key role in our clients' strategic decisions.

✅ A culture of innovation – Thrive in an environment that values creativity and ambition to deliver the best to our clients.

✅ Flexibility – Enjoy two days of remote work per week to better balance your professional and personal life.

⚙️ The Recruitment Process

1️⃣ 30 min with our Talent Acquisition

2️⃣ 30 min with your futur manager, Clara

3️⃣ Technical Test with two members of the team

4️⃣ 45 min Values Interview

5️⃣ 30 min with Antoine, Head of Professional Services & Predictive Analytics

We empower the physical world with the capabilities of digital technology.

MyTraffic is a platform that helps organizations make better, more accurate, and more reliable investment decisions for their physical locations.
📝Job Description
🤝 About Our Team
To give you more details about your day-to-day at MyTraffic :
Design, develop, monitor and maintain a wide range of explanatory and predictive models and integrate them into the production environment so users can make predictions in real time.
 Analyze the most extensive and complete spatial database to understand a wide range of industries (retail, real-state, fmcg, e-mobility) consumer's behaviour patterns, etc.
 Load & Extract data from our datalakes and databases to support clients or build reports.
 Work closely with the rest of the team including Business profiles, the CustomerSuccess team, and other Data Scientists and Software Engineers to understand everyone’s needs and develop optimal solutions.

 Ability to find a balance between real-life constraints (e.g.,deadlines, available data) and desired outcomes (e.g., accuracy, over delivery).
 Passionate about what you do. You care deeply about the things you build.

You have the ability to approach complex problems with analytical capabilities and critical thinking skills, enjoy facing challenging problems, and are able to apply logical reasoning to find solutions.
Proficiency in Python programming, including the ability to write functions and classes. You must be comfortable using Python as your primary programming language and be willing to learn and apply additional patterns and best practices.
Experience in analyzing data using Python and common libraries such asPandas and Scikit-learn.
You have an excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, SVM, Decision Trees, Random Forests, XGBoost, etc., although you are aware that the best solution sometimes is the simplest, and you know when to use one or another solution.
A good understanding of statistics, including probability theory and common statistical tests.
Experience with SQL queries, an understanding of different types of joins and the ability to retrieve and manipulate data from relational databases effectively.

4153845711.title: Senior Data Scientist - EY wavespace Data & AI hub
4153845711.description:
About the job
EY wavespace Madrid is looking for a data scientist with background in Generative AI technologies to help design and build cutting edge Gen AI solutions. EY wavespace is creating innovative AI technology and products that will transform EY and our clients. We are creating a model for how AI can reinvent large companies, and industries. Through EY’s network of more than 250,000 professionals working in every sector, we have an opportunity to offer AI products and services that transform how business is done in all types of enterprises and to realize the vision of building a better working world.

You’ll lead substantial parts of the design, development, and implementation of state-of-the-art Generative AI models to automate tax-related processes and improve efficiency. You will drive development of large portions of critical project deliverables. You may guide other engineers, estimate task effort, and communicate your approach and results effectively. You will be part of a team with a global mindset and with team members from all over the world, with mentors who will help you grow in both technical and business domains.

Responsibilities
Lead the design, development, and implementation of state-of-the-art Generative AI models to automate tax-related processes and improve efficiency.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and challenges.
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in Generative AI.
Optimize and fine-tune existing Generative AI models to enhance their performance and accuracy.
Provide technical guidance and support to junior members of the team, promoting knowledge sharing.
Communicate complex concepts and findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through documentation and presentations.
Stay informed about industry trends, and emerging technologies related to Generative AI.

Requirementss:
Master's in Computer Science, Data Science, AI, or any related field.
3-5 years of hands-on experience in developing and deploying AI models, preferably in finance or tax domain.
Experience developing complex software systems that have been deployed to an active userbase.
Good understanding of Machien Learning models. 
Experience in Natural Language Processing.
Proven track record of successfully delivering complex Generative AI projects and generating actionable insights from large-scale datasets.
Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to think creatively and strategically to develop innovative solutions.
Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and present complex concepts to stakeholders.
A portfolio showcasing successful projects or research papers is highly desirable.

If you feel that you meet these requirements, please apply with your ENGLISH CV. 

Our commitment to diversity & inclusion
We are genuinely passionate about inclusion and we support individuals of all groups; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, or disability status.

4150704821.title: Data Scientist III, Product & Technology Analytics
4150704821.description:
About the job
Expedia Group brands power global travel for everyone, everywhere. We design cutting-edge tech to make travel smoother and more memorable, and we create groundbreaking solutions for our partners. Our diverse, vibrant, and welcoming community is essential in driving our success.

Why Join Us?

To shape the future of travel, people must come first. Guided by our Values and Leadership Agreements, we foster an open culture where everyone belongs, differences are celebrated and know that when one of us wins, we all win.

We provide a full benefits package, including exciting travel perks, generous time-off, parental leave, a global hybrid work setup (with some pretty cool offices), and career development resources, all to fuel our employees' passion for travel and ensure a rewarding career journey. We’re building a more open world. Join us.

Data Scientist III, Product & Technology Analytics

Introduction to team

Private Label Solutions (PLS) is the B2B arm of Expedia Group. We bring Expedia Group’s innovative technology and distribution solutions to partners across the world. These businesses include global financial institutions, corporate managed travel, offline travel agents, global travel suppliers (like major airlines) and many more.

Private Label Solutions (PLS) leverages the best of the Expedia Group’s partner-facing APIs and Template products with a laser focus on B2B, powering thousands of partners around the world. As Expedia Group’s partner-focused arm, the PLS mission is to provide its partners with solutions to fuel their growth. 

 

PLS partners with businesses across a wide range of verticals, including loyalty programs, airlines, travel agents, corporate travel management companies and online retailers who remarket rates and availabilities to their travellers. Partners can access PLS products in the way that best suits their business, whether that is a fully customizable environment through PLS APIs, an ‘off-the-shelf’ white-label or cobranded template solution offering or its agent tools. 

PLS’s Rapid API, White Label Template and TAAP products power end-to-end hotel booking functionality for the world’s leading airlines, online travel agencies, and loyalty and membership programs. By providing access to over 700,000 properties across 250,000 destinations, Rapid enables partners to build a custom booking experience with easy integration, industry-leading supply, and competitive rates.

As Data Scientist III, Product & Technology Analytics you will play a vital role in the future of our fast growing B2B business. You will be part of the Product & Technology Analytics team, guiding analytical thinking, contributing to the strategic direction, sizing revenue opportunities, and quantifying risks.

You will help define our understanding of success drivers, evaluate commercial performance, and lead analysis on traffic, conversion and revenue drivers with detailed understanding of our partners’ business model, hotel and air supply, market trends and the industry. You will work with various teams across the company including Technology, Product, Sales, Finance and Analytics.

You will have the opportunity to own and develop new insights, to drive new ways of working, to build something innovative and be part of an international team.

The ideal candidate would have strong analytical & technical skills, paired with commercial acumen and strong communication skills, with an interest in technology & travel!

In This Role, You Will

You will own analysis, evaluate revenue opportunities and build business cases to ensure future growth of the business 
You will participate in cross-divisional work partnering with Product and Tech teams representing analytics 
You will perform deep-dive analysis and statistical tests to get to the bottom of performance drivers for our partners, provide recommendation for improvements and quantify results 
You will build frameworks, create dashboards and design metrics to analyse performance and visualize insights 
Communicate analysis findings and recommendations to various levels including organization leadership and external partners 
You will represent the team in meetings, ensuring perspectives of the broader Analytics team are incorporated 

Experience And Qualifications

At least 5 years’ analytical experience in online travel, online retail, banking, or another data-intensive commercial environment 
Firm understanding of revenue drivers and commercial environment 
Strong understanding of marketing attribution methodologies and web analytics tools 
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex analysis in a format that is easily understandable for the target audience 
Good understanding of statistics with ability to apply to commercial problem solving 
Ability to analyse large amounts of data, ideally experience with SQL, R or similar language, with demonstrated skills in understanding conversion drivers in an online environment 
Strong SQL skills, with ability to write SQL from scratch, and good understanding of databases. Web analytics experience preferred
Experience with data visualization tools (i.e. Tableau) 

What You Can Expect

Ability to innovate and create something new in one of the fastest growing divisions in Expedia Group 
International work environment, being part of a global team 
Exposure to various levels of internal and external stakeholders 

Accommodation requests

If you need assistance with any part of the application or recruiting process due to a disability, or other physical or mental health conditions, please reach out to our Recruiting Accommodations Team through the Accommodation Request.

We are proud to be named as a Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2024 and be recognized for award-winning culture by organizations like Forbes, TIME, Disability:IN, and others.

Expedia Group's family of brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Vrbo®, trivago®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Hotwire®, Wotif®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Expedia Group™ Media Solutions, Expedia Local Expert®, CarRentals.com™, and Expedia Cruises™. © 2024 Expedia, Inc. All rights reserved. Trademarks and logos are the property of their respective owners. CST: 2029030-50

Employment opportunities and job offers at Expedia Group will always come from Expedia Group’s Talent Acquisition and hiring teams. Never provide sensitive, personal information to someone unless you’re confident who the recipient is. Expedia Group does not extend job offers via email or any other messaging tools to individuals with whom we have not made prior contact. Our email domain is @expediagroup.com. The official website to find and apply for job openings at Expedia Group is careers.expediagroup.com/jobs.

Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age.

4109078807.title: Data Scientist
4109078807.description:
About the job
Position Background

Our team is part of the GTM Advanced Analytics CoE, where we help sales teams improve their effectiveness through advanced analytics solutions. We are involved in every stage of Data Science projects: from understanding business needs and data to deploying predictive and non-predictive solutions, and tracking their benefits.

This is a diverse, multicultural, and cross-functional team that collaborates with stakeholders worldwide. The projects we deliver are highly varied, offering opportunities to solve different types of challenges and business problems across industries and functions.

In this role, you’ll work with cutting-edge tools and technologies, gaining exposure to technically challenging problems that drive real business impact. You will collaborate in an agile and supportive team environment, where learning and professional growth are encouraged.

Collaboration and excellence are at the core of our culture, ensuring that the solutions we deliver meet the high standards and impact expected from top-performing teams. By joining us, you’ll contribute to solutions that optimize performance, enhance decision-making, and support the company’s growth.

Responsibilities

 Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their needs and translate complex business requirements into clear, actionable analytical solutions.
 Work closely with the Data Engineering team to ensure data quality, consistency, and stability across all stages of the project lifecycle.
 Explore, analyze, and preprocess data using advanced techniques to uncover insights that drive actionable business decisions.
 Develop, validate, and deploy statistical and Machine Learning models to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of Sales teams.
 Evaluate and monitor the performance of deployed Data Science solutions to ensure they deliver measurable business value, and maintain them for long-term stability.
 Clearly communicate data findings, model outcomes, and actionable recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through visualizations, presentations, and reports.
 Design and implement scalable frameworks to measure, monitor, and improve the business performance of analytical solutions.
 Partner with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment and integration of solutions into existing processes.
 Drive innovation by identifying opportunities to leverage new tools, techniques, and methodologies to solve complex business problems.

Job Requirements

 Experience: 3+ years in a Data Science role, with a proven track record of delivering impactful solutions.
 Education: Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related quantitative field.
 Technical Skills:
 Deep understanding of statistical concepts and their application in solving business problems.
 Strong knowledge of Machine Learning algorithms and frameworks.
 Proficiency in Python or R; experience with PySpark is a plus.
 Solid SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
 Experience working with large datasets
 Analytical Skills: Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking abilities with a strong attention to detail.
 Business Acumen: Ability to translate complex business needs into practical, data-driven solutions.
 Communication: Strong English communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
 Collaboration: Exceptional interpersonal skills and experience working in cross-functional, virtual, and in-person team environments.
 Project Management: Ability to prioritize, manage projects effectively, and deliver high-quality results on time.
 Mindset: Results-oriented, proactive, and committed to delivering quality outcomes that meet business expectations.

4027362940.title: Senior Data Scientist
4027362940.description:
About the job
At TomTom we’re seeking a Senior Data Scientist to join our Maps Quality and Product Insight team in Madrid. As part of the team, you will help TomTom deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps and locations services for the hundreds of millions of drivers maps and products around the world and that will enable the future of autonomous driving. 

The Maps Quality and Product Insight team is focused on providing state-of-the-art data & analytics solutions that enable fast and cost-effective data-driven strategic decision making within TomTom and for our customers and partners. 

What You'll Do

Help to make location content best-in-class by advocating for and implementing changes to technology, process, tools, and systems. 
Drive strategic business decisionswith insightsobtained by manipulating large volumes of data from a variety of different sources system logs, satellite imagery, vertical imagery, street level imagery, GPS traces, etc. individually and by fusing several combinations of these sources 
Design, develop and maintaindata processing pipelines to use these data sources individually or combinedand to predict various map features and attributes by applying statistical models/ ML / AI models 
State the quality level of our maps via statistical experiments that help us understand where we are and why, and deliver effective insights that help drive our map editing strategy 
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model and system performance and data accuracy 
Collaborate with teams from diverse backgrounds (e.g., data scientists, software engineers, product managers, …) across the company and with our customers on projects and knowledge sharing 
Work in a company promoting innovative and modern technologies – Java 8/Python, Continuous Deployment (Docker, Terraform, Azure), Cloud Computing and high code quality and engineering standards 
Dedicate part of your schedule on research and development to acquire new skills, run your own experiments and individual project 

What You'll Need

5+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist or Software Engineer (with relevant experience in data analytics projects) 
Excellent communications skills in English 
Strong problem-solving skills 
To be team-oriented – to be able to communicate with other team members, express doubts, provide and accept constructive feedback 
To be passionate about programming and have a solid foundation of software development, and be always eager to learn and improve your skills 
Work experience in Big Data ecosystems (e.g., Spark, Databricks, …). 
Fair statistical knowledge and expertise in designing and testing experiments and drawing conclusions under uncertainty (sampling strategies, robust statistical estimation,...) 
Experience in various ML / AI techniques and frameworks 
Experience in at least one object-oriented language – Python and PySparkis a must, Scala is a plus 
Fair knowledge level on SQL/NoSQL databases 
Bachelor’s/Masters/PHD in Computer science, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent field 

Nice to have

Experience with Scala 
Previous Experience with working, processing and visualizing GeoSpatial Data at scale (e.g. experience with QGIS or cloud native geospatial tools) 

What We Offer

A competitive compensation package, of course.

Time and resources to grow and develop, including a personal development budget and paid leave for learning days, as well as paid access to e-learning resources such as O’Reilly and LinkedIn Learning.

Time to support life outside of work, with enhanced parental leave plus paid leave to care for loved ones and volunteer in local communities.

Work flexibility, where TomTom’ers, in agreement with their manager and team, use both the office and home to focus, collaborate, learn and socialize. It’s all about getting the best out of both worlds – we ask TomTom’ers to come to the office two days a week, and the remaining three are free to be worked in either location.

Improve your home office with a setup budget and get extra support with a monthly allowance.

Enjoy options to work from your home country and abroad for a set number of days each year, to visit family and friends, or to simply explore the world we’re mapping.

Take the holidays you want with a competitive holiday plan, plus an extra day off to celebrate your birthday.

Join annual events like our Hackathon and DevDays to bring your ideas to life with talented teammates from around the world.

Become a part of our inclusive global culture and have the chance to collaborate with a diverse community – we have over 80 nationalities at TomTom!

Find out more about our global benefits and enjoy additional local benefits tailored to your location.

 Meet your team 

We’re Maps, a global team within TomTom’s Location Technology Products technical unit. Our team is driven to deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps for hundreds of millions of users around the world. Joining our team, you’ll continuously innovate our mapmaking processes, directly contributing to our vision engineering the world's most trusted and useful map.

 At TomTom... 

You’ll help people find their way in the world. In 2004, TomTom revolutionized how the world moves with the introduction of the first portable navigation device. Now, we intend to do it again by engineering the first-ever real-time map, the smartest and most useful map on the planet.

Work with a team of 3,700 unique, curious and passionate problem-solvers. Together, we’ll open up a world of possibilities for car manufacturers, enterprises and developers to help people understand and get closer to the world around them.

 After you apply 

Our recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout your journey with us, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews all the way through onboarding. To find out more about our application process, check out our hiring FAQs .

 TomTom is an equal opportunity employer 

TomTom is where you can find your place in the world. Every day we welcome, nurture and celebrate differences. Why? Because your uniqueness is what makes you, you. No matter your culture or background, you’ll find your impact at TomTom. Research also shows that sometimes women and underrepresented communities can be hesitant to apply for positions unless they believe they meet 100% of the criteria. If you can relate to this, please know that we’d love to hear from you.
What You'll Do
Help to make location content best-in-class by advocating for and implementing changes to technology, process, tools, and systems. 
Drive strategic business decisionswith insightsobtained by manipulating large volumes of data from a variety of different sources system logs, satellite imagery, vertical imagery, street level imagery, GPS traces, etc. individually and by fusing several combinations of these sources 
Design, develop and maintaindata processing pipelines to use these data sources individually or combinedand to predict various map features and attributes by applying statistical models/ ML / AI models 
State the quality level of our maps via statistical experiments that help us understand where we are and why, and deliver effective insights that help drive our map editing strategy 
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model and system performance and data accuracy 
Collaborate with teams from diverse backgrounds (e.g., data scientists, software engineers, product managers, …) across the company and with our customers on projects and knowledge sharing 
Work in a company promoting innovative and modern technologies – Java 8/Python, Continuous Deployment (Docker, Terraform, Azure), Cloud Computing and high code quality and engineering standards 
Dedicate part of your schedule on research and development to acquire new skills, run your own experiments and individual project

Dedicate part of your schedule on research and development to acquire new skills, run your own experiments and individual project
What You'll Need
5+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist or Software Engineer (with relevant experience in data analytics projects) 
Excellent communications skills in English 
Strong problem-solving skills 
To be team-oriented – to be able to communicate with other team members, express doubts, provide and accept constructive feedback 
To be passionate about programming and have a solid foundation of software development, and be always eager to learn and improve your skills 
Work experience in Big Data ecosystems (e.g., Spark, Databricks, …). 
Fair statistical knowledge and expertise in designing and testing experiments and drawing conclusions under uncertainty (sampling strategies, robust statistical estimation,...) 
Experience in various ML / AI techniques and frameworks 
Experience in at least one object-oriented language – Python and PySparkis a must, Scala is a plus 
Fair knowledge level on SQL/NoSQL databases 
Bachelor’s/Masters/PHD in Computer science, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent field

4142639370.title: Data Scientist
4142639370.description:
About the job
Cómo somos por dentro. 

Si quieres saber más sobre el universo VASS, donde la tecnología es nuestra pasión, quédate 🚀.

No te aburriremos con los típicos discursos corporativos, pero sí queremos decirte que, si te unes a nosotros podrás trabajar en diferentes proyectos donde tendrás mucha estabilidad. Somos 5000 personas geniales (¡y orgullosos!) unidas por valores como la confianza y la flexibilidad. 🤝

En VASS, no solo te ofrecemos un empleo, sino un ambiente donde puedas crecer tanto profesional como personalmente.

Únete a nuestro viaje tecnológico y disfruta de la aventura.

¡Te esperamos con los brazos abiertos! 🏠✨

 Beneficios: 

🧠 Carrera profesional a medida: Te ayudamos a diseñar tu trayectoria en función de tus intereses y metas.

🔒 Estabilidad: Continúa creciendo junto a nosotros en un entorno laboral dinámico como parte de un equipo comprometido.

🤝 Proyectos: Oportunidad de cambio en función hacia donde quieres guiar tu carrera profesional, ya que tenemos variedad de clientes en todos los sectores.

🌟 Cercanía con managers: Tu opinión importa. En VASS, siempre serás escuchado y tu voz será valorada.

💼 Flexibilidad: Trabaja desde donde quieras con nuestra modalidad de Smart Working, basada en la filosofía DevOps, para impulsar productividad y eficiencia.

😀 ¡Buen ambiente (con afterworks incluidos)! Somos un equipo muy cercano donde todos nos llevamos bien y disfrutamos vernos.

🏖️ 23 días de vacaciones para esos viajes más largos + 24 y 31 de diciembre para disfrutar con los tuyos.

🌱 Concilia tu vida personal: 5 días extras para que puedas cuidar de lo que más importa.

💻 Jornada intensiva: Todos los viernes y en verano (julio y agosto) trabajamos hasta las 15:00.

🎉 Longweekends: Disfruta de jornadas intensivas el último día laboral de la semana, ¡sea viernes o no!

🛫 Movilidad internacional: Oportunidades para que tu talento viaje por el mundo.

👩🏻‍🏫 Formación continua: Acceso a Udemy ilimitado, webinars, y nuestra propia VASS University para que sigas aprendiendo.

Data & IA: ¡Toc, toc! el equipo de VASS especializado en proyectos de Data, Analítica Avanzada, IA Generativa y Document Solutions llama a tu puerta. Si te gusta la tecnología aplicada, pasarlo bien formando parte de equipos de proyectos innovadores y abordar retos apasionantes para llevar a nuestros clientes y nuestra empresa al siguiente nivel, no dejes pasar de largo nuestras oportunidades de crecimiento.

¿Cuál será tu misión?

Trabajarás en equipos de analítica avanzada, aplicando modelos de ML y de DL para soluciones empresariales.

¿Cómo será tu día a día?

Diseño, desarrollo, productivización y entrenamiento y seguimiento de modelos de ciencia del dato basados en soluciones de Machine Learning y Deep Learning

¿Qué te hará triunfar como Data Scientist? -

Experiencia: Mínimo 3 años de experiencia en ciencia de datos.

Lenguaje de programación: Experiencia avanzada en Python, incluyendo librerías como NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow y/o PyTorch.

Dominio en el desarrollo, ajuste y evaluación de modelos de Machine Learning y Deep Learning.

Experiencia en aprendizaje supervisado y no supervisado, incluyendo algoritmos como regresión, árboles de decisión, redes neuronales, clustering y reducción de dimensionalidad.

Experiencia en técnicas para la detección y gestión de outliers en datos estructurados y no estructurados.

Implementación y Despliegue: Conocimiento en empaquetado y puesta en producción de modelos, incluyendo APIs para inferencia.

Entorno de trabajo: Experiencia con entornos de desarrollo en la nube (AWS, GCP o Azure) o entornos locales con GPUs.

Control de versiones y buenas prácticas: Uso de Git y trabajo en equipos colaborativos siguiendo buenas prácticas de desarrollo.

Nivel alto de inglés

Capacidad para resolver problemas complejos de manera analítica.

Autonomía y proactividad para investigar nuevas técnicas y optimizar modelos.

Habilidad para documentar procesos y comunicar resultados a equipos técnicos y no técnicos.

 Y ahora que has aplicado? 
 Llamada inicial: Comenzamos con una conversación telefónica para conocerte mejor, entender tu perfil y contarte más sobre la posición.
 Entrevista People: En esta fase, un miembro de nuestro equipo te hará preguntas sobre tus habilidades, valores y motivación para asegurarse de que encajas con nuestra cultura.
 Entrevista técnica: Finalmente, realizamos una entrevista técnica para evaluar tus conocimientos y habilidades específicas en el área en la que trabajarías, a través de preguntas o ejercicios prácticos.



Cada una de estas fases está diseñada para asegurarnos de que es la oportunidad adecuada tanto para ti como para nosotros.

Si quieres saber más sobre nosotros, échale un ojo a nuestra página web . 💻👀

En VASS luchamos cada día por lograr un entorno favorable que facilite y potencie la igualdad de oportunidades, la no discriminación, la diversidad y la inclusión de todas las personas. Seleccionamos a nuestro talento en base a las necesidades de negocio, a sus habilidades y sus méritos. 🌟
Cómo somos por dentro.

Carrera profesional a medida:
Estabilidad:
Proyectos:

Flexibilidad:

4143873806.title: Data Scientist
4143873806.description:
About the job
Clarivate is expanding its Data Science team and looking for a talented Senior Data Scientist to join us in Barcelona.

If you're passionate about advancing knowledge search and discovery, this is your chance to make an impact. You'll develop cutting-edge machine learning and AI models to enhance the user experience for customers in the intellectual property and science domains.

Our mission? To empower researchers and professionals to unlock new insights, maximize their potential, and drive meaningful innovation.

About You – Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments

An advanced degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Technology, or Engineering, or equivalent work experience.
5+ years of industry experience, including applying ML and NLP in real-world scenarios.
Excellent analytical and Python programming skills (Java and R are a plus)
Experience in Computer Vision
Effective communicator and presenter, skilled at connecting with stakeholders, gathering insights, and conveying complex ideas.
Ability to rapidly test, adapt, and implement methods—from data extraction to validation.

It would be great if you also had . . . 

Experience with search engines, classification algorithm, recommendation systems and relevance evaluation.
Hands-on experience in Building and deploying ML pipelines.
Background in NLP solutions for he legal domain, experience in patents is a plus.
Master's or PhD with focus on AI/ML.

What will you be doing in this role?

You will research and implement ML and NLP solutions to enhance user experience in Intellectual Property data and products, with a strong focus on the patent domain. This includes identifying and validating algorithms, exploring data for insights, recommending new data sources, and uncovering innovative applications of ML and NLP within Clarivate’s extensive content and datasets.

Product you will be developing

We are working on a wide range of products involving search, predictive and other analytics, as well as decision support. You’ll be helping out with new, state of the art solutions to improve the tools that help both internal and external customers drive innovation at major companies. Your main focus will be taking existing patent drafting software to the next level with all the latest AI technology.

About The Team

You'll be part of a dynamic team of eight Data Scientists based in Belgium, Spain, and the U.S., specializing in Intellectual Property data and products, including trademarks, patents, and case law. As part of a larger Data Science, Search, and Content group of 100+ professionals (including 40+ Data Scientists and ML Engineers), we collaborate closely with Product, Sales, Marketing, and Operations teams to maximize customer value. With experienced Principal Data Scientists on board, we provide strong mentorship and growth opportunities. While many of our projects are driven by customer needs, we also explore new technologies and develop proof-of-concept solutions to showcase their business impact.

Hours of Work 

This is a Full-Time permanent role, in Barcelona – Spain (40 working hours per week)

Hybrid working model, 2-3 days per week from our Office, near Sagrada Familia, central region in the city.

What We Can Offer You

An opportunity to have a real impact on the global IP industry.
30 working days of vacation
Volunteering community, with 40 paid hours of volunteering time
Private Health and Life & Disability insurances.
Tax-free benefits (Ticket Restaurant scheme, kindergarten, and transport cards).

At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

An advanced degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Technology, or Engineering, or equivalent work experience.
5+ years of industry experience, including applying ML and NLP in real-world scenarios.
Excellent analytical and Python programming skills (Java and R are a plus)
Experience in Computer Vision
Effective communicator and presenter, skilled at connecting with stakeholders, gathering insights, and conveying complex ideas.
Ability to rapidly test, adapt, and implement methods—from data extraction to validation.

4146361070.title: Senior Data Scientist
4146361070.description:
About the job
About us
At Principal33 we strive to make happiness at work a reality. Because it's not just about the money, it's also about the work environment and appreciation. It's about creating the best team setup you can imagine and getting involved in the things you're passionate about. And you can be a part of it, because it's fun to get things done!

We want our employees to innovate and we allow them to do what they are truly passionate about. Based on this conviction, Principal33 aligns its strategy around its vision: to become a leading IT service company and a better working-life balance. With currently around 200 employees from different countries, we are actively shaping the future of work.

Your responsibilities:
The Data Scientist is responsible for developing and implementing data-driven solutions, building predictive models, and deriving actionable insights from diverse data sets to support business decisions and strategic initiatives. This role involves applying data science techniques and collaborating with cross-functional teams to foster a data-driven culture within the organization. 
Develop and implement predictive models, machine learning algorithms, and statistical analyses to address business challenges and opportunities.
Perform data exploration, cleaning, and preprocessing to prepare data for analysis and modeling.
Translate data analysis into clear, actionable business insights and present findings to stakeholders.
Work closely with data engineers, business analysts, and product managers to understand data needs and deliver effective data science solutions.
Stay current with advancements in data science, machine learning, and AI, and integrate new techniques and tools into data science practices.
Contribute to team knowledge sharing, code reviews, and collaborative projects.
Quality and accuracy of predictive models as measured by key performance indicators (KPIs) such as precision, recall, F1 score, and AUC-ROC.
Quantifiable impact of data science projects on business outcomes, such as revenue growth, cost reduction, or process optimization.
Feedback from business stakeholders regarding the usability and effectiveness of data science solutions.
Implementation of new data science techniques, tools, or methodologies to enhance analytics capabilities.
Quality of contributions to team projects and collaborative efforts.

Experience and skills:
Good knowledge of Math and Statistics
Good knowledge of Machine Learning algorithms
Good Knowledge of Big-Data technologies
Good knowledge of AI new trends (e.g., LLM)
Experience developing software with Python / R
Experience with machine learning libraries and frameworks (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Experience with data manipulation and analysis tools (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, SciPy)
Proven track record in building and deploying predictive models and machine learning algorithms
Background in statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and A/B testing
Experience working in agile scrum team
Ability to manage multiple priorities
Ability to find creative solutions for business and technical challenges
Strong research skills, problem-solving, and analytical ability
Enhanced presentation, negotiation, and communication skills – both written & oral
Ability to develop strong business relationships across all levels of the business
Able to reach a quick understanding of customer requirements, accurately interpret underlying needs, and change drivers
Fluid in speaking and writing in English language (must)

What we offer:
Way of working: remote 100% 
Unless you would like to join as at our beautiful office in Valencia and work hybrid.

Benefits
Flexible compensation
Flexible work hours
Private medical insurance
Day off on your birthday
Referral bonus if you bring your contacts
Gifts for special occasions
International and multicultural environment
A free week-long accommodation annually at our corporate apartment close to Valencia, Spain (subject to availability)

Events
Summer party!

(Self)-Development
Continuous training, we will help you improve your technical skills, evolve in the tech community and develop as a professional.

We are an active part of the tech-community. You may have the opportunity to attend and participate in local and international tech-events.

Wanna join!?

4157311056.title: Data Scientist - Advance Analytics

4166291832.title: Marketing Data Scientist
4166291832.description:
About the job
Overview

Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world's visionaries and innovators in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions - and our methods for creating them - help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.

Our powerful culture has led to us being independently recognized on Fortune 100's Best Companies List and we are "Great Place to Work" Certified. We're driven, collaborative, ethical, and curious, and we value all ideas, especially bold ones. And our culture extends far beyond our own walls. Our corporate social responsibility efforts support our communities, nurture the next generation of engineers, and promote environmental sustainability.

At Keysight, Inclusion, Equity & Diversity is an integral part of our core values. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers. We believe everyone should be respected in the workplace and in their communities regardless of race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, or any protected class. We continuously challenge ourselves to grow in our understanding of inclusion by engaging in a wide variety of diversity programs, initiatives, employee network groups and mentoring/development. This is Keysight - People and Culture - YouTube
Responsibilities
Keysight Global Marketing (KGM) is hiring a Marketing Data Scientist who will collaborate with team members to implement machine learning models leveraging data from sources across the sales and marketing pipeline. You will be joining a small, highly visible, analytics and operations team reporting into the CMO.


Primary Responsibilities

Use SQL and Python to build models leveraging data from multiple data sources across a multi-touch multi-contact organization-based customer journey
Explain model performance and provide recommendations for feature generation and selection to business users with limited experience in ML concepts
Build and deploy machine learning models leveraging packages like Scikit-learn and Pandas
Design reporting dashboards within Domo, our BI platform, following data visualization best practices
Identify gaps in processes and data collection to proactively ensure data quality across the marketing organization
Collaborate with fully remote teammates: communicating needs, coordinating work, and communicating timelines and deliverables across global time zones

Qualifications

BA in marketing, engineering, statistics, economics, computer science, or equivalent work experience
2+ years building and tuning machine learning models
2+ years working with B2B marketing data with an understanding of the lead journey, lead qualification processes, account-based marketing (ABM) metrics, and the marketing and sales pipeline
2+ years executing work as part of a project-based team (agile project management experience preferred)
1+ years working with Domo or 2+ years working with other BI platforms
Strong understanding of statistics and practical application of machine learning models
Ability to independently build, evaluate performance of, and tune machine learning models
Proficiency in Python; proficiency with git and version control; proficiency in working with APIs
Excellent interpersonal communication skills – especially in the context of a fully-remote team and work environment
Overview
Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world's visionaries and innovators in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions - and our methods for creating them - help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.

Our corporate social responsibility efforts support our communities, nurture the next generation of engineers, and promote environmental sustainability.

2+ years working with B2B marketing data with an understanding of the lead journey, lead qualification processes, account-based marketing (ABM) metrics, and the marketing and sales pipeline
2+ years executing work as part of a project-based team (agile project management experience preferred)
1+ years working with Domo or 2+ years working with other BI platforms
Strong understanding of statistics and practical application of machine learning models
Ability to independently build, evaluate performance of, and tune machine learning models
Proficiency in Python; proficiency with git and version control; proficiency in working with APIs
Excellent interpersonal communication skills – especially in the context of a fully-remote team and work environment

4160830134.title: Lead Data Scientist
4160830134.description:
About the job
Who we are: 
Want to make an impact? Join our pack and come work (and play!) with us.

We believe everyone deserves the unconditional love of a pet—and at Rover, our mission is to make it easier to experience that love. Founded in 2011, the Rover app and website connect dog and cat parents with loving pet sitters and dog walkers in neighborhoods across the US, Canada, and Europe. We empower our community of trusted pet sitters and dog walkers to run their own pet care businesses on Rover with the tools and security of a global company to back them.

Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we work closely with our teams in Barcelona, San Antonio, Spokane, and remote locations. We’ve got a reputation for being a great place to work, having been named among the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Seattle Business Magazine and Washington’s Best Workplaces in the Puget Sound Business Journal. We're an agile, fast-growing company, and our leadership comes from some of the world's most respected tech companies.

At Rover, our furry coworkers are just as important as our human ones—and we wouldn’t have it any other way. Along with making the joys of pet parenthood more accessible, we’re committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming community of pet people—and that starts with our employees.

Who we're looking for:
We are looking for a Lead Data Scientist with experience in mentoring and leading larger projects, ensuring a high level of quality across the team. The ideal candidate will be excited to tackle a broad array of challenges in our two-sided marketplace, from machine learning to analytical problems, in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. We are particularly excited about candidates with expertise in Search, Ranking, and Recommendations, as we have ambitious initiatives in this space.


What does Data Science mean at Rover?
At Rover we obsess over our customers’ needs, relying heavily on data to improve the customer journey, and to continuously optimize outcomes in our marketplaces. Our entire organization is metric driven and underpinned by data science and analytics. Data scientists are responsible for defining the right metrics, understanding nuanced marketplace dynamics, and developing models and algorithms that power our business and technology.

You will be joining the Booking Data Science team, which works specifically on problems of matching (mostly through search and recommendations) and retention (through search and other initiatives in collaboration with Lifecycle Marketing and Operations).

As a Lead Data Scientist in the Booking Data Science team you will:
Iterate on Rover’s search ranking algorithm by developing new contextual features, experimenting with different objective function formulations and researching possible improvements such as with distance, location, past user history.
Lead larger cross-functional data science projects, building a roadmap of iterations and helping define milestones in collaboration with product, engineering and data engineering. Act as a project lead, organizing and mentoring more junior team members, while ensuring high quality output.
Dive deep into marketplace dynamics, extracting valuable insights and providing strategic recommendations to shape our product offerings, using your skills in data mining and data visualization.
Implement best practices in machine learning model development, deployment and monitoring, by working with Data Platform and prioritizing operational improvements.
Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines that serve as the backbone for informed decision-making, monitoring of our systems and features to our models.
Perform statistical analysis to draw inferences, forecast future trends, and predict user behavior. You will also use statistics to estimate the expected impact of interventions or to establish causal relationships when A/B testing is not possible.

Your Toolset Includes:
SQL - you would be comfortable leading a SQL 101 course
Proficient Python and the most common data science libraries – scikit-learn, xgboost, numpy, scipy, pandas
Data visualization (we use Mode as our data visualization tool, but you could have experience in any other tool or library such as Tableau, Sisense, Matplotlib, ggplot)
Experience with big data technology and infrastructure (e.g. Spark, Redshift, AWS) a plus

Your Qualifications:
At least 6 years of experience in a business setting as a data scientist and at least 1 year of mentoring or managing other data scientists
BS in a quantitative discipline; advanced degree (MS or PhD) a plus
Understanding of foundational statistical concepts including probability, hypothesis testing, and experimental design
Robust foundation and in-depth experience with one or more contemporary machine learning or predictive modeling algorithms, such as ensemble methods, natural language processing (NLP) techniques, clustering algorithms or deep learning methods. Specifically, solid experience with Search, Ranking and Recommendations will be preferred
Experience working side-by-side with coordinated teams of developers, analysts, product managers, marketers, and operators
Experience in a two-sided marketplace is a plus

Why We’ll Hire You:
You’re a deeply analytical thinker who is passionate about finding structure in data, and using data to drive real value to the end user (and thus the business).
You are excited both about analysis and model building. You’re not afraid to tackle ambiguous analytical questions or impactful production-facing models, depending on business needs.
You are passionate about our core business. You will instinctively dig into every aspect of what it means to be a pet sitter and a pet owner on the Rover platform.
You can take abstractly defined problems and work with (imperfect) data to drive decisions.
You’re able to fit and interpret results of statistical models, as well as report on key assumptions and limitations.
You show a pattern of being self-started, self-taught and self-directed.
You favor open communication with willingness to ask and answer questions.
You are output- and outcome-oriented.
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to break apart complex processes for non-technical stakeholders.
You play nicely with others (and dogs).

Benefits of Working at Rover.com:
Competitive compensation
Long-term incentive plan with a company performance-based cash payout
Permanent contract
Pension Plan
Meal tickets through Cobee
Generous PTO Allowance
Hybrid schedule
Private health insurance
Discounted Gym Membership
Bring your dog to work (and unlimited puppy time)
Monetary help for adopting a dog plus yearly credit to use on our platform
Flexible work hours, sometimes you’ll need to be in at certain times, but on the whole, we’re pretty flexible when it comes to managing workload and time
Grab snacks, fresh fruit, in our kitchen to keep yourself going
Regular team activities, including happy hours, game nights, and more

Rover is an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting a diverse, inclusive, and inventive environment with the best employees. We’re driven by seeing our people succeed and grow, and we work to ensure everyone contributes to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, protected veteran status, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

3766528138.title: Senior Data Scientist
3766528138.description:
About the job
¡Hola Data Lover! 💙

En SDG, no solo tendrás la oportunidad de formar parte de algo increíble, ¡sino que vivirás lo que significa ser un auténtico especialista en Data & Analytics!

¿Estás preparadx para embarcarte en esta emocionante aventura? con nosotrxs, podrás potenciar todas tus habilidades y capacidades analíticas, tecnológicas y de negocio.

¡Es hora de despegar hacia el futuro mediante el poder de los datos! Únete a nosotros y prepárate para romper las reglas y alcanzar tu mejor versión 🚀✨.

Descubre el poder de SDG: líderes globales en la industria del dato 💥📊

En SDG trabajamos para la mitad de las empresas del IBEX-35, pero también en multitud de compañías internacionales. Gracias al boom de la analítica, estamos en un ritmo constante de crecimiento, y desde 1994 nos hemos convertido en el socio de confianza para empresas que desean maximizar todo el potencial de sus datos.

Si buscas formar parte de una compañía 100% especializada en #Data, #Analytics #InteligenciaArtificial, ¡te estamos esperando!


Requisitos mínimos 👇

Titulación en Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería Informática, o cualquier otra titulación de ámbito técnico y con una base demostrable en técnicas estadísticas y de ciencia de datos.
Al menos 8 años de experiencia profesional como científico de datos, desarrollando casos de uso en diferentes industrias y liderando el diseño de solución al respecto.
Capacidad de entendimiento de problemas de negocio y de traslación de los mismos a términos analíticos, identificando correctamente objetivos de corto y largo plazo, y siendo capaz de estructurar un plan de proyecto acorde a los mismos.
Experiencia demostrable en diferentes ámbitos de solución de machine learning, tanto supervisados como no supervisados: modelos de regresión lineal y logística, series temporales, sistemas de clasificación, problemas de segmentación, deep learning, NLP y procesamiento de imágenes.
Conocimientos cuantitativos en relación a los aspectos que rodean el desarrollo de soluciones de analítica avanzada: contrastes de hipótesis, diseño de experimentos, control estadístico de procesos, análisis de supervivencia…
Experiencia demostrable evaluando el rendimiento de soluciones de analítica predictiva, así como definiendo KPIs de monitorización al respecto.
Conocimiento y experiencia en las tecnologías relevantes para la actividad de la ciencia de datos, esencialmente: SQL, Python, R y herramientas cloud relacionadas.
Habilidades comunicativas.


Requisitos recomendados 👇

Máster y/o doctorado en una temática relacionada con la ciencia de datos y la inteligencia artificial.
Experiencia previa en consultoría dentro del mundo de data & analytics.
Conocimientos teóricos y prácticos acerca del ciclo de vida de las soluciones de ML en contextos empresariales, así como de la metodología MLOps.
Experiencia en la definición de métodos y estrategias para la medición del rendimiento y el impacto de soluciones predictivas.
Experiencia en otros aspectos relacionados con la ciencia de datos más allá de los puramente cuantitativos: ingeniería de datos, desarrollo software, arquitecturas cloud…
Experiencia previa liderando equipos y proyectos en el ámbito de la ciencia de datos.
Certificaciones en tecnologías o ámbitos relevantes para la actividad del científico de datos.


Acerca de la compañía y el puesto 🚀

SDG Group es una firma de consultoría global focalizada exclusivamente en soluciones de data & analytics, cubriendo con ello toda la cadena de valor del dato, y proporcionando planes de carrera tanto de consultoría como de especialización para todos aquellos que quieran progresar en el mundo del dato. Además, a través de nuestra cultura Smart Work tendrás la posibilidad de definir el modelo de trabajo que más se adapte a ti y a tus necesidades personales, al mismo tiempo que puedas colaborar en iniciativas de gran impacto para clientes punteros en sus respectivas industrias.

Como Data Scientist del área de Data Science, tu misión será formar parte de equipos multidisciplinares con el objetivo de ayudar a nuestros clientes a desarrollar soluciones de machine learning e inteligencia artificial en entornos de alta complejidad técnica, y con una visión end-to-end: desde el análisis inicial del negocio y la experimentación, hasta la puesta en producción de los sistemas de analítica avanzada.

Tendrás la posibilidad de utilizar un amplio espectro de tecnologías innovadoras para la construcción de soluciones de IA bajo diversos paradigmas de analítica predictiva y deep learning, aplicando todo ello en una gran diversidad de industrias y contextos de negocio.

Asimismo, gracias a nuestro path de especialista tendrás la oportunidad de crecer como científico de datos, contando con herramientas y recursos para tu continuo aprendizaje y crecimiento, al mismo tiempo que te involucras en diferentes retos que permitan tanto a SDG Group como a nuestros clientes explotar al máximo las posibilidades infinitas que nos ofrece la inteligencia artificial.


Responsabilidades ✍

Desarrollar soluciones basadas en datos para retos empresariales difíciles en una amplia gama de dominios empresariales mediante el uso de técnicas de ciencia de datos de última generación y comprender cómo convertir la teoría y los modelos en operaciones de la empresa.
Trabajar con las partes interesadas de toda la organización para identificar oportunidades de aprovechar los datos internos y externos.
Garantizar la aplicación de la solución de ciencia de datos para generar valor y otros resultados empresariales, así como para respaldar las iniciativas de ahorro de costes.
Trabajar en colaboración con diferentes equipos funcionales y de ingeniería para diseñar e implementar soluciones integrales de análisis avanzado, sobre todo de aprendizaje automático e ingeniería artificial, y supervisar los resultados.
Liderar el desarrollo de procesos y herramientas para supervisar y analizar el rendimiento y la precisión de los sistemas AI/ML (MLOps).
Mantenerse al día de las últimas tendencias tecnológicas en el ámbito de la IA y la ciencia de datos.
Asesoramiento experto al negocio en términos de oportunidades, modelado de datos y ciencia de datos

Certificaciones en tecnologías o ámbitos relevantes para la actividad del científico de datos.
Acerca de la compañía y el puesto 🚀
SDG Group es una firma de consultoría global focalizada exclusivamente en soluciones de data & analytics, cubriendo con ello toda la cadena de valor del dato, y proporcionando planes de carrera tanto de consultoría como de especialización para todos aquellos que quieran progresar en el mundo del dato. Además, a través de nuestra cultura Smart Work tendrás la posibilidad de definir el modelo de trabajo que más se adapte a ti y a tus necesidades personales, al mismo tiempo que puedas colaborar en iniciativas de gran impacto para clientes punteros en sus respectivas industrias.
Como Data Scientist del área de Data Science, tu misión será formar parte de equipos multidisciplinares con el objetivo de ayudar a nuestros clientes a desarrollar soluciones de machine learning e inteligencia artificial en entornos de alta complejidad técnica, y con una visión end-to-end: desde el análisis inicial del negocio y la experimentación, hasta la puesta en producción de los sistemas de analítica avanzada.
Data Scientist
misión
Tendrás la posibilidad de utilizar un amplio espectro de tecnologías innovadoras para la construcción de soluciones de IA bajo diversos paradigmas de analítica predictiva y deep learning, aplicando todo ello en una gran diversidad de industrias y contextos de negocio.
Asimismo, gracias a nuestro path de especialista tendrás la oportunidad de crecer como científico de datos, contando con herramientas y recursos para tu continuo aprendizaje y crecimiento, al mismo tiempo que te involucras en diferentes retos que permitan tanto a SDG Group como a nuestros clientes explotar al máximo las posibilidades infinitas que nos ofrece la inteligencia artificial.
Responsabilidades ✍
Desarrollar soluciones basadas en datos para retos empresariales difíciles en una amplia gama de dominios empresariales mediante el uso de técnicas de ciencia de datos de última generación y comprender cómo convertir la teoría y los modelos en operaciones de la empresa.
Trabajar con las partes interesadas de toda la organización para identificar oportunidades de aprovechar los datos internos y externos.
Garantizar la aplicación de la solución de ciencia de datos para generar valor y otros resultados empresariales, así como para respaldar las iniciativas de ahorro de costes.
Trabajar en colaboración con diferentes equipos funcionales y de ingeniería para diseñar e implementar soluciones integrales de análisis avanzado, sobre todo de aprendizaje automático e ingeniería artificial, y supervisar los resultados.
Liderar el desarrollo de procesos y herramientas para supervisar y analizar el rendimiento y la precisión de los sistemas AI/ML (MLOps).
Mantenerse al día de las últimas tendencias tecnológicas en el ámbito de la IA y la ciencia de datos.
Asesoramiento experto al negocio en términos de oportunidades, modelado de datos y ciencia de datos
Desarrollar soluciones basadas en datos para retos empresariales difíciles en una amplia gama de dominios empresariales mediante el uso de técnicas de ciencia de datos de última generación y comprender cómo convertir la teoría y los modelos en operaciones de la empresa.
Trabajar con las partes interesadas de toda la organización para identificar oportunidades de aprovechar los datos internos y externos.
Garantizar la aplicación de la solución de ciencia de datos para generar valor y otros resultados empresariales, así como para respaldar las iniciativas de ahorro de costes.
Trabajar en colaboración con diferentes equipos funcionales y de ingeniería para diseñar e implementar soluciones integrales de análisis avanzado, sobre todo de aprendizaje automático e ingeniería artificial, y supervisar los resultados.
Liderar el desarrollo de procesos y herramientas para supervisar y analizar el rendimiento y la precisión de los sistemas AI/ML (MLOps).
Mantenerse al día de las últimas tendencias tecnológicas en el ámbito de la IA y la ciencia de datos.
Asesoramiento experto al negocio en términos de oportunidades, modelado de datos y ciencia de datos

4136590772.title: Data Scientist - Global Portfolio Management
4136590772.description:
About the job
Got the drive to shape the future of insurance?

At Prima, you could take on a whole new challenge. As part of our global community, you’d be in the driving seat of your career; learning and growing with a top-tier team around you. Prima is a place where no matter who you are or what your role is — your voice is valued.

Back in 2015, we embarked on a mission: to provide great value car insurance that is designed for everyone. And we’ve come a long way, we’ve created a culture where we can fuel each other’s success. But we need your expertise, as we steer things in a new and exciting direction.

You’re probably thinking… ‘That sounds pretty good’. We agree.

As well as great colleagues and engaging projects, there are loads of ways we can help you do the best work of your life. We’ve shaped our offering to place a focus on well-being, autonomy and development. We see benefits as the fuel that will empower you to succeed, if you decide to embark on this journey with us.

🤸🏽‍♂️ Working in a way that works for you  We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. Whether you like working from the office, home or a mixture of both. We’ll help you find a balance that works best for you. We even have a policy that means you can work from any location for 30 days a year. We trust you to steer us forward.

🏁 The freedom to explore the possibilities  We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. We’re invested in your growth; so we’ll give you access to a teaching and learning marketplace. And you’ll have regular sessions with your manager to establish a personal growth plan.

🌈 Our winning formula: happy and high-performing  From private medical insurance to discounted gym memberships and wellbeing initiatives: we’re here to support you. We know how important your health and well-being is, so we’ll go the extra mile to help you when we can.

If it sounds like we’ve got something that’s up your street, let’s see if you’ve got the skills we’re looking for!

Meet the orchestrators of our global symphony. The Global Portfolio Management team doesn't just manage complexity; they turn it into an efficient, proactive system. Empowering every country to swiftly spot improvement opportunities, they play a vital role in crafting and executing the Pricing and Underwriting strategy. Step into the heartbeat of our global enterprise!

As Data Scientist, some of your activities will be

Define and support the implementation in each country of the key tools to understand how the business is growing, for example, conversion, retention, emerging profitability. The monitoring tools need to be consistent at a global level and at the same time able to adapt to the different stage of evolution of each country.
Support the countries in planning the pricing and UW strategy and consequent follow up.
Develop a strong critical spirit and creativity that can act as an engine for Prima's growth.
Learn avidly with the support of experienced colleagues and grow quickly, assuming more responsibilities within the team.

Are you the ideal candidate for this exciting role? Here's what we're looking for

Impressive academic achievements in Mathematics, Computer science, Physics, Statistics, Mathematical Engineering, Actuarial Science or equivalent STEM.
Excellent logical and analytical acumen.
Good Python programming skills and use of GIT.
Excellent English level, oral & written.
You have a sincere and life-guiding cooperative mindset, with a natural tendency to challenge constructively the status quo.

In addition to the basic requirements, we will carefully evaluate these characteristics as a plus

You have previous work experience in similar roles.
Knowledge of Spark, SQL or any other data-oriented programming language and proficiency with standard data wrangling and modeling libraries (Pandas, Sklearn. Keras, XGBboost, LightGBM, etc.).
Knowledge of BI tools (Tableau or similar).

Research shows that some people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single criteria. At Prima we are committed to building diverse teams so please apply even if your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with the requirements. You might still be a great fit!

Prima is a community made up of talented and ambitious individuals. We offer equal employment opportunities and are oriented towards diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination of any kind based on race, colour, gender, religion, sexual orientation, nationality, disability, genetic information, pregnancy or other protected personal characteristics, as defined by national laws.

4146942950.title: Data Scientist/ Data Engineer (W2/EOR- US/CAN, Europe and LATAM)
4146942950.description:
About the job
Job Description

This is a 6-month contract with possibility of extension, 40 hours/ week. This is classified as an EOR engagement. No C2C Engagements. No visa sponsorship/ visa transfer available.

Open to candidates based in LATAM, Europe, US and/or Canada who are able to overlap PST-EST hours.

Please note: The hourly rate may vary depending on the candidate’s country of residence due to Employer of Record (EOR) fees. These fees, which cover essential services such as payroll processing, benefits administration, and compliance with local employment laws, are country-specific and can impact the final rate offered.

Reddit is a community of communities where people can dive into anything through experiences built around their interests, hobbies, and passions. Our mission is to bring community, belonging, and empowerment to everyone in the world. Reddit users submit, vote, and comment on content, stories, and discussions about the topics they care about the most. From pets to parenting, with over 100,000 active communities and over 70 million daily active users, it is home to the most open and authentic conversations on the internet.

We are looking for a skilled Data Scientist / Data Engineer to join our team and help drive data-driven decision-making. You will be responsible for designing and maintaining data pipelines, building analytical models, and ensuring data availability for business insights. This role requires a mix of engineering expertise, machine learning knowledge, and the ability to work with large datasets.

Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes.
Build, deploy, and optimize machine learning models for predictive analytics.
Ensure data integrity, reliability, and performance across systems.
Develop and maintain data warehouse architectures and data lakes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data analysts, product managers, and software engineers.
Implement best practices for data governance, security, and compliance.
Work with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) to manage data infrastructure.
Develop real-time data processing solutions using Kafka, Spark, or similar technologies.
Create data visualization dashboards and reports for business stakeholders.

Required Qualifications

Programming Languages: Proficiency in Python, SQL, and either Java or Scala.
Data Engineering: Experience with ETL pipelines, Apache Airflow, dbt, or similar tools.
Big Data & Databases: Hands-on experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Snowflake, BigQuery).
Machine Learning (if applicable): Familiarity with scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.
Cloud Platforms: Experience with AWS, GCP, or Azure (e.g., S3, Redshift, BigQuery).
Data Streaming: Knowledge of Kafka, Kinesis, or similar technologies.
Data Warehousing: Understanding of star schema, OLAP, and data modeling principles.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
