4106740215.title: Senior Product Analyst
4106740215.description:
About the job
Are you a creative person who loves a challenge? Solve the complex puzzles you’ve been dreaming of as our Senior Product Analyst. If you have a passion for innovation in tech, we want you on our team! Thrive in this crucial role.

The Product Analyst is a key contributor to our product strategies. Working with Product Managers and Leadership across the organization, Product Analysts collect internal and external data, analyze it, and build visualizations and plans, which feed into business strategies, go-to-market plans, and executive reports. Product Analysts are key advisors and help us make realistic decisions and justify them with data.


Responsibilities
Be the expert on all data-related questions. Drive timely gathering and analysis of data from the business and produce key business insights through easily digestible visual presentations.
Conduct in-depth research of data sources, making sure that the gathered data matches the requested problems and business requirements.
Design, develop and maintain scaled, automated, user-friendly systems/reports/dashboards/workbooks that will support our business needs.
Understand the technical capabilities of our platform, components ownership across Applications Development, and advise on instrumentation strategies and tooling.
Be a "know your data, know your business" champion across Applications Product Development Teams. Educate and collaborate with the Teams so that they take ownership of their own data and insights.
Collaborate with Product Directors and Managers, as well as collaborators from the business, to define and implement success metrics across the product portfolio.
Collaborate with other data science-oriented and data-driven teams within the organization.


Typical work
Data streams, imports and exports
KPIs, visualizations and reports
Financial and usage models and forecasts


What you will bring
5+ years of product analysis and development experience. Degree in Mathematics and Statistical Sciences is a plus.
You are passionate about understanding complex systems, getting deep into data structures and making them talk.
An ability and interest in working, and continuous re-learning, in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.
Ability to build trust by producing high-quality and accurate insights.
High level of autonomy, demonstrating the ability to work in a global, multi-functional team environment, collaborating with groups of subject matter experts (SMEs) and stakeholders at all levels.
Data science and machine learning experience is a plus.


Key skills
Excellent knowledge of statistics and tools for analyzing big data (SQL, Python, etc.)
Advanced skills in data visualizations and story telling.
Excellent analytical, problem discovery, and problem solving skills.
Working knowledge of data mining and big data warehouse.
Great (English) communication and presentation skills.
Great time management, ability to plan and complete with sometimes changing priorities.

If this sounds like you, we hope to meet you!


About the NetSuite Product Team
NetSuite is one of Oracle's top products and kept on operating as its own global business unit (GBU), after its acquisition by Oracle. The world's first cloud-based, multi-tenant ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) and CRM (Customer Relationship Management) service, our focus is on small, emerging and mid-size companies. NetSuite provides a unified experience across a suite of business software: financials, supply chain, order management, omnichannel e-commerce, and all extendable on one platform.

The Product Development Application Team is a multinational team, having members from more than 12 countries, spanning diverse roles: Developers, SW Engineers in Test, Technical Writers, UX Designers, Researchers, Product Analysts and Product Managers. Our mission is to deliver intuitive, unified solutions, to help our customer grow their business. We take a customer-first approach, and organize applications product development across four value streams: acquire & grow new customers, build and deliver products & services, optimize cash & profits, and hire & empower employees. 
Data is at the heart of everything we decide and build. 


We offer more than just a job
Agile environment – Start-up culture backed by a strong enterprise
English-speaking environment and international team
Strong professionals around you that will help accelerate your growth
High-impact learning culture: free access to online learning platform and regular in-house training sessions
Competitive salary and great benefits
Open and diverse environment, with opportunities to give back to the community
Flexible working hours


Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, and disability.
We believe that innovation starts with diversity and inclusion and to create the future we need talent from various backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities.
That’s why we’re committed to creating a workforce where all individuals can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.
Are you a creative person who loves a challenge? Solve the complex puzzles you’ve been dreaming of as our Senior Product Analyst. If you have a passion for innovation in tech, we want you on our team! Thrive in this crucial role.

Product Analysts are key advisors and help us make realistic decisions and justify them with data.

High level of autonomy, demonstrating the ability to work in a global, multi-functional team environment, collaborating with groups of subject matter experts (SMEs) and stakeholders at all levels.
Data science and machine learning experience is a plus.
Key skills
Excellent knowledge of statistics and tools for analyzing big data (SQL, Python, etc.)
Advanced skills in data visualizations and story telling.
Excellent analytical, problem discovery, and problem solving skills.
Working knowledge of data mining and big data warehouse.
Great (English) communication and presentation skills.
Great time management, ability to plan and complete with sometimes changing priorities.

If this sounds like you, we hope to meet you!
About the NetSuite Product Team
NetSuite is one of Oracle's top products and kept on operating as its own global business unit (GBU), after its acquisition by Oracle. The world's first cloud-based, multi-tenant ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) and CRM (Customer Relationship Management) service, our focus is on small, emerging and mid-size companies. NetSuite provides a unified experience across a suite of business software: financials, supply chain, order management, omnichannel e-commerce, and all extendable on one platform.

The Product Development Application Team is a multinational team, having members from more than 12 countries, spanning diverse roles: Developers, SW Engineers in Test, Technical Writers, UX Designers, Researchers, Product Analysts and Product Managers. Our mission is to deliver intuitive, unified solutions, to help our customer grow their business. We take a customer-first approach, and organize applications product development across four value streams: acquire & grow new customers, build and deliver products & services, optimize cash & profits, and hire & empower employees.

4094700111.title: Data Analyst, Solutions and Innovation
4094700111.description:
About the job
What You'll Do:

As a member of our AXSI team, you'll be at the forefront of measurement and experimentation. Your role will be crucial in helping our clients understand and maximise their return on investment while driving innovation in the rapidly evolving digital advertising landscape.

Incrementality measurement: Enable advertisers to quantify and understand the true value of Criteo's solutions through sophisticated measurement methodologies
Client Consultations: Partner with advertisers to deeply understand their business objectives and define meaningful success metrics for their advertising investments
Experimentation Design: Craft and implement robust testing strategies tailored to each client's unique needs and business context
Analysis & Communication: Transform complex experimental data into clear, actionable insights and recommendations for clients
Measurement Innovation: Contribute to our suite of measurement tools, enabling teams across Criteo to evaluate and optimise their initiatives
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with commercial teams and clients to deliver insights that drive revenue and foster client success


Who You Are:

A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges
Solid foundation in statistical inference methodologies and experience in designing and analysing A/B tests
Interested in solving data problems using Python & SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies
Ability to synthesise complex information and present clear, actionable recommendations
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences
Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

4122676751.title: Product Data Analyst
4122676751.description:
About the job
Product Data Analyst (Hybrid) 

As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what’s the next step? Start your journey with us!

We’re seeking an experienced Product Data Analyst to join our eDreams ODIGEO Experiments & Insights team, which is the centre of excellence for Online (AB) Experimentation and for providing best practices to generate insights and learning from and for the experiments. Our goal is to help different teams across the organization to succeed in their mission by providing insights generation and data analysis support in a healthy data-informed environment.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world’s leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

20 million customers – 44 markets – 5 brands – 6.5M members in Prime

16.2 million bookings FY23 – More than 50,000 bookings per day – 100 million daily user searches

1400 employees – More than 50 different nationalities – 99% permanent contracts – 36.3 average age

We’re a leading travel tech company, revolutionising the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world’s first travel subscription program.

We are looking for a Product Data Analyst who has experience working with analytics tools such as SQL (mostly for BigQuery usage) and, as a plus, also R/Python, visualization tools as LookerStudio; that has a strong statistics knowledge and experience in statistics applied to AB testing or experimentation.

In this role, you would be performing as a product data analyst to support a set of product teams, but you will also be part of the next experimentation generation at eDreams ODIGEO. The team is constantly investigating best in class methodologies and processes to implement in our business/analysis and tests, which means you will be required to apply your mathematical knowledge in some strategic projects that are focused on taking more accurate decisions maintaining a strong statistical confidence level.

What you will do:

The Role’s Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. As a Product Data Analyst in the Experiments & Insights team, you will be in charge of:

 Analyse performance and identify behaviours in our different websites and interfaces related to our products; 
 Analyse performance and user behaviours in the A/B Tests experiments or Pre-Post run by the product teams; 
 Help the product teams to generate their testing hypotheses by providing exploratory analysis about our products, past tests, etc, 
 Data cleaning and validation, 
 Definition of new tracking that will all mostly be added in Google Analytics (to be able to answer different kinds of research/product questions); 
 Build and maintain dashboards (mostly using LookerStudio) and/or reports (mostly in Google Sheets) to share performance information with senior management and C-level stakeholders; 
 Lead data-driven initiatives to improve company decision making and business knowledge; 
 Responsible for one or more team’s projects such as the investigation and implementation of new methodologies, new data analysis techniques or the usage of new tools; 
 Collaborate with user researchers and designers to detect gaps in knowledge about our user; identify research opportunities to fill those gaps. 


What you need to succeed:

Job Requirements

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You’ll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team.

 Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline is a requirement (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, etc.), 
 Minimum of 4 years experience in a role with strong analytical component, 
 Previous experience in user behavior analysis (product performance) using data from any of the followings: Google Analytics/Adobe Analytics/Mix Panel/ Amplitude/Matomo/… 
 Strong knowledge of the math and statistical concepts behind A/B testing, 
 Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data, 
 Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc), 
 Knowledge of visualisation tools like LookerStudio, Tableau, Looker or Qlikview, 
 Business Proficiency in English, 
 A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys to have fun! 


Plus:

 R or Python programming skills (mostly for data extraction and data manipulation), 
 Google Analytics knowledge (as well as Google Analytics API, googleAnalyticsR library for R, GA4, etc.), 
 Previous experience in programming, 
 Knowledge on data structure and data sets management in Google Cloud Platform. 


What’s in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture. Here’s what we offer:

 A rewarding Compensation package! 💥 Prime Plus membership, Competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years. 
 Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! 🚀 Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions. 
 Your Well-being is our Priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! 💙 At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You’ll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best. 
 Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! 🎉 Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices. 
 Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! 💫 Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You’ll work in an Agile Mindset environment with recognition at our core. 


Wanna take a peek into what it’s like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.
Product Data Analyst (Hybrid)

4099013550.title: Staff Data Analyst (Product)
4099013550.description:
About the job
Docker is a remote first company with employees across Europe, APAC and the Americas that simplifies the lives of developers who are making world-changing apps. We raised our Series C funding in March 2022 for $105M at a $2.1B valuation. We continued to see exponential revenue growth last year. Join us for a whale of a ride!

We are looking for an experienced and results-driven Senior Data Analyst to join our Product - Data & Growth team. In this role, you will play a critical part in shaping Docker’s data strategy by leading the design, development, and optimization of data models, reports, and dashboards that support strategic business goals. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making across the organization and mentor junior analysts to foster a culture of continuous learning.

This role is perfect for someone with advanced data analysis expertise, a passion for solving complex problems, and a track record of delivering impactful insights. The level of responsibility and scope will be tailored based on your experience and strengths, making it an ideal opportunity for professionals looking to advance their careers in data.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Strategy & Execution: Lead data initiatives by designing, developing, and optimizing data models and reporting structures that support the organization’s strategic objectives.
Data Analysis & Transformation: Conduct advanced data analysis, leveraging tools like Snowflake, DBT, and SQL to ensure accuracy, consistency, and actionable insights across various data sources.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain scalable, robust data models that enable both real-time and ad-hoc analysis, driving key business decisions.
Reporting & Dashboards: Create, manage, and optimize dashboards and reports using Looker, providing stakeholders with clear, actionable insights.
Collaboration: Partner closely with business teams, data engineers, and leadership to understand and meet data needs, aligning data initiatives with broader business goals.
Mentorship & Team Development: Provide mentorship to other analysts, fostering professional growth and encouraging best practices across the team.
Data Governance & Quality: Drive data quality initiatives, identifying and resolving inconsistencies while defining best practices for data governance.
Continuous Improvement: Continuously refine and enhance data models, reporting pipelines, and processes to support evolving business needs and ensure scalability.

Key Skills and Qualifications:

Experience: 5+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, with a proven ability to deliver impactful data solutions in fast-paced environments.
Technical Expertise: Advanced proficiency in SQL and strong experience with data warehousing and ETL/ELT processes. Familiarity with Snowflake, DBT, and Looker is highly desirable.
Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills: Strong analytical thinking with the ability to interpret data, identify trends, and generate actionable insights to inform business decisions.
Communication: Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to distill complex technical concepts for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Leadership & Mentorship: Experience mentoring junior team members and contributing to team development. Ability to influence and lead cross-functional teams in data-driven initiatives.
Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or Mathematics.
Attention to Detail: A meticulous approach to data, ensuring accuracy and reliability in all deliverables, while maintaining a high standard of data quality.

What to expect in the first 30 days:

Understand Docker’s Data Landscape: Deep dive into Docker’s data systems, processes, and business objectives to build a strong foundation for future contributions.
Collaborate with Teams: Engage with cross-functional teams to gain insight into ongoing data initiatives and identify how you can contribute.
Start Contributing: Begin taking ownership of smaller data analysis tasks, providing insights, and shaping solutions that align with business needs.

What to expect in the first 90 days:

Lead Key Projects: Take full ownership of critical data analysis projects, ensuring they are aligned with strategic business goals and delivered on time.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver insights that directly impact business outcomes.
Partner with Data Engineers: Collaborate with data engineers to ensure the scalability, reliability, and optimization of data pipelines and models.
Execute and Deliver: Focus on delivering data solutions that meet timelines, driving execution, and continuously identifying areas for improvement in processes and systems.
Mentor and Support: Provide mentorship to other data analysts, offering guidance and support in executing data projects while fostering a collaborative team environment

What to expect in the first year:

Drive Large-Scale Initiatives: Lead and deliver large-scale data initiatives that meet business objectives and drive meaningful outcomes.
Optimize and Evolve: Continuously optimize data models, dashboards, and reporting structures to support evolving business needs.
Become a Key Contributor: Establish yourself as a strategic leader within Docker’s data team, driving data-driven decision-making and scaling processes to ensure long-term success.

PTO plan that encourages you to take time to do the things you enjoy
Quarterly, company-wide hackathons

Equity; we are a growing start-up and want all employees to have a share in the success of the company
Docker Swag
Medical benefits, retirement and holidays vary by country

Docker embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our company will be.

Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship.

Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or Mathematics.
Attention to Detail: A meticulous approach to data, ensuring accuracy and reliability in all deliverables, while maintaining a high standard of data quality.
What to expect in the first 30 days:
Understand Docker’s Data Landscape: Deep dive into Docker’s data systems, processes, and business objectives to build a strong foundation for future contributions.
Collaborate with Teams: Engage with cross-functional teams to gain insight into ongoing data initiatives and identify how you can contribute.
Start Contributing: Begin taking ownership of smaller data analysis tasks, providing insights, and shaping solutions that align with business needs.

4139628722.title: Data Analyst I (They/She/He)
4139628722.description:
About the job
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique? 

🤝 Our culture and strong values. 

💪 Our career development philosophy. 

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good. 

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

As an Operations Analyst you will work on the Regional forecasting function (supply & demand balance). This role will require a mix of operations, stakeholder management, analytical skills, and creativity to tackle different challenges. We offer a challenging and dynamic environment with many opportunities for learning and development.

THE JOURNEY

Execute forecasts at a city level inAFRICA (Morocco, Tunisia, Kenya, Uganda, Ivory Coast, Nigeria) , being the owner of the process.
Coordinate with the different countries and cities in order to understand key insights about local markets.
Align with each Local Operations owner the strategy in the country, and enable it by managing the demand and supply balance (rider availability)
Perform country and city analysis to come up with insights to help to improve the forecast's accuracy.
You will combine advanced analytical data insights with business understanding and market knowledge.
Work very close with local teams, to ensure the best in class operations in the region.
Implement and standardize analytical processes, and playbooks to ensure quality in Operations.

What You Will Bring To The Ride

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Mathematics/Statistics or in similar roles
2+ years experience in a supply/demand planning position. Experience in Operations is a plus
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Data-driven decision-making is a must.
Ability to engage internal and external stakeholders through excellent communication skills
Proficiency in Excel
Knowledge of SQL
Ability to manage the big picture, and the smallest details. You're always on top of your deadlines and an organization freak.
Proactive, organized, and obsessed with details
Fluent English Level

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? 

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

4133059569.title: Data Analyst, EMEA Performance Media
4133059569.description:
About the job
What You'll Do:

As a Data Analyst in our Analytics Performance Media team, you will drive advertising strategies thanks to your oversight of business objectives and technical expertise of our products.

Client insights: you will analyse complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers’ campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights 
Business strategy: you will partner with account executives, account strategists, and campaign managers to help drive client strategy and direction 
Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership.
Testing: you will design, monitor and analyse A/B tests to understand better how our products work for clients. 
Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company 


Your work environment:

Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!


Who You Are:

At least 2 years of experience in data analysis 
A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Able to solve data problems using Python, SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
You are skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences. 
Experience in online advertising, marketing, or consulting will be a plus.
Fluent in English
Must be eligible to work in Spain full-time with no restrictions.


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.
What You'll Do:
Client insights: you will analyse complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers’ campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights 
Business strategy: you will partner with account executives, account strategists, and campaign managers to help drive client strategy and direction 
Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership.
Testing: you will design, monitor and analyse A/B tests to understand better how our products work for clients. 
Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company

4133434427.title: BI Data Analyst - Hybrid
4133434427.description:
About the job
BI Data Analyst - (Hybrid) 

As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We're seeking an experienced BI Data Analyst to join our team in Barcelona. Our Business Intelligence team is the centre of excellence for providing insights and learning from the Data. Our goal is to help different teams across the organization to succeed in their mission by providing insights generation and data analysis support in a healthy data-informed environment. If you're ready to soar, we're ready to take you there.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

21 million customers – 44 markets – 5 brands – 6.5M members in Prime

More than 100 million searches per day - Up to 1.8 billion daily AI predictions

Over 1,600 employees – More than 60 different nationalities from all continents

99% permanent contracts - 36 average age

We're the world’s leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. We are a tech company revolutionizing the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do:

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. As a Data Analyst in the BI team, you will be in charge of:

 Analyse performance and identify behaviours in different data sets; Translate complex and potentially ambiguous information into a clear structure and actionable deliverables. 
 Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality; 
 Build and maintain dashboards and/or reports to share performance information with senior management and C-level stakeholders; 
 Identify and analyze relevant customer data to drive business goals and validate hypothesis & designs; turn data into actionable insights; 
 Lead data-driven initiatives to improve company decision making and business knowledge 
 Working with multi-disciplinary teams – Qualitative Researchers, Designers, Product Owners, Developers, and Pricing Managers – to blend different statistical and data analytics techniques to generate a holistic understanding of the users and markets. 


What you need to succeed: 

Job Requirements

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:

 Degree in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or other quantitative fields); 
 Minimum 3 years of experience as an analyst in a digital and eCommerce environment. 
 Strong knowledge of tools and programming languages such as BigQuery/SQL, Python, R; 
 Experience with cloud platforms and scalable solutions will be a plus. 
 Self-starter with good time management skills; able to manage multiple tasks and prioritize quickly the most relevant ones; 
 Ability to multitask; desire to work in a challenging, fast-paced, high-performance environment; 
 Written and oral communication skills (in English). 


What’s in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture. Here's what we offer:

 A rewarding Compensation package! 💥 Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years. 
 Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! 📚 Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program. 
 Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! 🚀 Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions. 
 Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! 💙 At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best. 
 Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! 🎉 Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices. 
 Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! 💫 Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core. 


Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO! If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

 Working with multi-disciplinary teams – Qualitative Researchers, Designers, Product Owners, Developers, and Pricing Managers – to blend different statistical and data analytics techniques to generate a holistic understanding of the users and markets.

4142620101.title: Senior Product Analyst (d/f/m)
4142620101.description:
About the job
Personio's intelligent HR platform helps small and medium-sized organizations unlock the power of people by making complicated, time-consuming tasks simple and efficient. Our growing team of 1,800+ Personios across Europe and the US are building user-friendly products that delight our 14,000+ customers and their 1.5 million employees. Ready to make an impact from day one?

The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be hybrid from one of the following office locations: London, Madrid, Munich, Dublin, or Berlin.

Bring your skills. Drive our decisions. Data is on a mission to facilitate better decisions within the company. We build core data products and enable internal teams to create and share their own. Join our team and help us build the foundation of data at Personio.

As an early member of our PTech Analytics team, you’ll be the driving force behind the data revolution within one of our critical product domains. Working as a trusted advisor to leaders from Product, Design & Engineering, you’ll be responsible for leveraging data & insights to directly influence our product strategy & roadmap. You’ll work embedded in our cross-functional product teams helping them to define, measure & maximize their impact with data, ultimately enabling them to build products our customers love.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do

Influence Decision-Making: Use a deep understanding of our product, users, and business to craft compelling data stories that guide product leaders in critical decisions.
Generate Insights: Analyze large, complex datasets to generate insights that shape product strategy and size opportunities to guide prioritization.
Define Success: Guide teams in defining success metrics and setting measurable goals (OKRs) that align with broader product and business objectives.
Monitoring & Reporting: Create engaging dashboards and reports to track product success and monitor performance.
Impact measurement: Work with teams to define hypotheses, develop testing plans and measure impact with statistical rigor.
Data Modeling: Collaborate with engineers to build scalable data models that enable self-service analytics and democratize data access.
Drive Data Literacy: Evangelize the use of data and empower teams to self-serve insights by increasing data literacy through enablement and close partnership.

Role Requirements: What you need to succeed

5+ years experience in a data analytics role, with significant experience directly supporting product teams in B2B or B2C product led companies.
Excellent SQL skills, experience using DBT for data modeling is a plus.
Expert in creating compelling dashboards & visualizations in Looker, Tableau or similar BI tools.
Expert in the fundamentals of product analytics including building metric trees, experimentation, user activity & retention analytics, funnels & customer segmentation.
Experience working with event based tracking data for web or mobile and hands-on experience with a behavioral analytics tool e.g. Amplitude, Heap, MixPanel etc.
Foundational understanding of statistical modeling with proficiency in Python/R (e.g. basic regression/ML models, common statistical tests)
Ability to communicate findings in a succinct and clear manner to a wide variety of stakeholders so that they can draw conclusions quickly and make rapid decisions.

Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:

Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years
Make an impact on the environment and society with 1 Impact Day per year
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities
We follow an office-led, remote-friendly approach, including opportunities to work from home and international locations. Many of our teams have designated days for gathering in the office to enhance collaboration and foster a sense of community.
We enjoy gathering for meals, cultural initiatives, and events like local Summer Sessions and year-end celebrations. There's also healthy snacks, drinks, and a weekly catered lunch.
The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio
This position can be hybrid from one of the following office locations: London, Madrid, Munich, Dublin, or Berlin.
Role Responsibilities: What you'll do
Influence Decision-Making: Use a deep understanding of our product, users, and business to craft compelling data stories that guide product leaders in critical decisions.
Generate Insights: Analyze large, complex datasets to generate insights that shape product strategy and size opportunities to guide prioritization.
Define Success: Guide teams in defining success metrics and setting measurable goals (OKRs) that align with broader product and business objectives.
Monitoring & Reporting: Create engaging dashboards and reports to track product success and monitor performance.
Impact measurement: Work with teams to define hypotheses, develop testing plans and measure impact with statistical rigor.
Data Modeling: Collaborate with engineers to build scalable data models that enable self-service analytics and democratize data access.
Drive Data Literacy: Evangelize the use of data and empower teams to self-serve insights by increasing data literacy through enablement and close partnership.

3942683490.title: System Analyst, Marketplace Recruitment & Dev
3942683490.description:
About the job
Description

We are looking for mid-senior System Analysts with a strong technical background. Do you have passion for using data in order to drive business actions? Are you experienced on reporting and advanced SQL techniques, analytical problem-solving and data visualization?

This is an amazing opportunity if you are you keen to improve current reporting solutions and innovate by creating new and simpler ones providing to the Marketplace business with robust automated insights.

In this role, you will help identify, track and manage Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), partner with the internal and external program teams to identify root-causes of spikes or plummets in key metrics while carrying on mid-term to long-term projects to improve our services, processes and tools and communicating with tech, program and product teams.

Career Growth

We care about your career aspirations and tailor your development to your unique abilities. We want you to grow and progress in Amazon. We will facilitate your growth through an increase in scope of the projects you work on over time, and include in projects for partner teams to experience new and interesting challenges.

Key job responsibilities

 Simplify and automate reporting while building data solutions to have maximum scale, self-service ability by stakeholders and improve productivity
 Solve complex and broad business problems with analytically derived solutions, applying analytical best practices.
 Translate business requirements into reporting while working with internal and external stakeholders to define best output based on business needs
 Effectively collaborate in a fast-paced environment with multiple teams in a large organization.

About The Team

Over 2 million Sellers in 10 countries list their products for sale on the Amazon Marketplace. Sellers are a critical part of Amazon’s ecosystem to deliver on our vision of offering the Earth’s largest selection and lowest prices. These Sellers offer hundreds of millions of unique products providing a broad and diverse inventory of products from Books, Electronics and Apparel to Consumables and beyond. In our vision to build a global marketplace, we will enable Sellers to list, make their selection available to customers globally while optimizing their inventory placement across multiple countries. EU 3P Compliance organization enables Sellers to sell on Amazon’s EU Marketplaces in compliant manner, adhering to EU legislative requirements across Tax, Trade, EPR (Extended Producer Responsibility) and Product Compliance.

Basic Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree or equivalent
 Proficient with SQL
 Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to build reports and metrics for business insights
 Experience working with stakeholders to document data and operational processes
 Familiarity with database types and data models
 Experience with data visualization using Quicksight, or similar tools and Excel (pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.)

Preferred Qualifications

 Master's degree or equivalent
 Experience as business analyst, data analyst or similar role experience
 Proficiency with Python
 Proficiency with Amazon Technologies: AWS S3, RS, Lambda

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.


Company - Amazon Spain Services, S.L.U.

4145768720.title: Qlik Sense Analyst
4145768720.description:
About the job
¡Únete al equipo de SII Group Spain y ayúdanos a impulsar la transformación digital e innovación!

Queremos incorporar a nuestro equipo un Qlik Sense Analyst para uno de nuestros proyectos de referencia.

Si estás buscando nuevas oportunidades donde crecer profesionalmente, no dudes en aplicar a a esta oferta 🚀

Objetivo del proyecto:
El objetivo principal del proyecto es mejorar la capacidad del cliente para analizar y visualizar datos de manera eficiente, permitiendo a los equipos tomar decisiones informadas y estratégicas. El Analista de Qlik Sense será responsable de desarrollar y mantener dashboards y reportes que proporcionen insights clave sobre las operaciones y el rendimiento de la empresa.

Funciones y Requisitos:
Desarrollo de Dashboards y Reportes:
Crear y mantener dashboards interactivos y reportes en Qlik Sense que proporcionen una visión clara y comprensible de los datos operativos y financieros.
Asegurar que los dashboards sean intuitivos y fáciles de usar para los diferentes equipos dentro de Veolia.
Análisis de Datos: 
Realizar análisis de datos detallados para identificar tendencias, patrones y oportunidades de mejora.
Colaborar con diferentes departamentos para entender sus necesidades de datos y proporcionar soluciones analíticas adecuadas.
Automatización de Procesos:
Implementar procesos automatizados para la recopilación, limpieza y transformación de datos, asegurando la integridad y precisión de los mismos.
Desarrollar scripts y herramientas que faciliten la integración de datos de diversas fuentes.
Capacitación y Soporte:
Proporcionar capacitación y soporte a los usuarios finales para asegurar un uso efectivo de los dashboards y reportes. -
Crear documentación y guías de usuario para facilitar la adopción de las herramientas analíticas.
Mejora Continua:
Identificar áreas de mejora en los procesos de análisis de datos y proponer soluciones innovadoras. -
Mantenerse actualizado con las últimas tendencias y tecnologías en análisis de datos y visualización.
Idiomas: Nivel de Ingles B2 o +, proyecto internacional
Posibilidad de acudir presencialmente a las oficinas del cliente en Madrid (Modelo Híbrido)

¿Quiénes somos?
En SII Group Spain damos respuesta a distintos sectores a través de Servicios y Soluciones Digitales y de IT, Ingeniería, y Consultoría de Negocio, ofreciendo una propuesta de valor integral para afrontar desafíos de transformación digital e innovación. El mundo digital ya no es una promesa para el futuro, sino una vibrante realidad que nos desafía y cautiva a cada paso
Nuestro ADN se basa en el motto “we do what we say” como identificador propio de marca: compromiso, transparencia, calidad y profesionalidad son los valores de nuestra empresa. Trabajamos día a día para atraer y fidelizar al mejor talento. Todo ello es lo que nos ha convertido en Great Place To Work.
Además, conscientes del papel que jugamos como empresa global de servicios tecnológicos, actuamos siempre en favor del desarrollo de tecnologías respetuosas con el entorno. Estamos inmersos en políticas ESG y queremos contribuir positivamente a la sociedad gracias al desarrollo profesional y personal de nuestros ingenieros.

¿Qué te ofrecemos?

23+1 días de vacaciones para que desconectes con los tuyos: 🏖️
Disfruta de un merecido descanso con 23 días hábiles de vacaciones, ¡y un día extra para que disfrutes de tiempo de calidad con tus seres queridos!

Contrato indefinido: 📄
Contrato indefinido, brindándote seguridad y confianza en tu futuro profesional.

Jornada intensiva todos los viernes y el mes de agosto: 🗓️
¡Dale la bienvenida al fin de semana antes! Disfruta de jornadas intensivas los viernes y durante todo el mes de agosto para optimizar tu tiempo libre y equilibrar tu vida laboral."

Retribución flexible: 💼
Te ofrecemos una retribución a la carta pudiendo elegir diferentes productos tales como seguro de salud, tickets de comida, guardería, etc.

Metodología SmartWorking: 🌐
Nos adaptamos a tu estilo de vida con nuestra metodología SmartWorking, que fomenta la flexibilidad y el teletrabajo, permitiéndote alcanzar un equilibrio entre tu carrera y tus compromisos personales.

FUNgenieur Campus: 🎓
Sigue creciendo con nosotros a través de nuestro FUNgenieur Campus, donde podrás desarrollar tus habilidades tanto técnicas como blandas, impulsando tu crecimiento profesional y personal.
Además contamos con licencias de Udemy y Coursera a la disposición de nuestros empleados. 📚

Oportunidad de aprender de grandes profesionales: 👨‍🏫
Aprovecha la oportunidad de aprender de los mejores. Nuestros programas de coaching y mentoring te brindan la guía y el apoyo necesarios para alcanzar tu máximo potencial.
Tenemos Convenios con distintas Asociaciones y Colegios de Ingenieros, brindándote la posibilidad de acceder a formaciones y normativa específica. 📝

Proyección de futuro y estabilidad: 🚀
Diseña tu propio camino hacia el éxito con nuestro plan de carrera personalizado, que te ofrece proyección de futuro y estabilidad a largo plazo en un ambiente de trabajo colaborativo y motivador.

Movilidad geográfica: 🌍
Explora nuevas oportunidades y experiencias internacionales con nuestra opción de movilidad geográfica, permitiéndote expandir tus horizontes tanto profesional como personalmente.

Eventos de empresa y networking: 🤝
Forma parte de una comunidad cercana y vibrante. Desde after-works hasta cenas y eventos exclusivos, te ofrecemos la oportunidad de conectar y disfrutar del mejor ambiente laboral. Únete a nuestras fiestas trimestrales. 🎉

Programa de referenciados: 📣
Deseamos atraer a los profesionales más destacados y, para lograrlo, te incentivamos a que nos refieras a aquellos talentos excepcionales que conozcas

Plan de rebranding: 🔄
Forma parte de nuestros embajadores de marca en redes sociales, contribuyendo a la estrategia de rebranding de la empresa, así como optando a distintos premios.

Great Place to Work: 😊
Únete a un equipo donde se valora tu bienestar y se promueve un ambiente inclusivo y positivo. ¡Somos un Great Place to Work reconocido por nuestro excepcional clima laboral!

¿Cómo será el proceso de selección?
En la primera fase se llevará a cabo una llamada telefónica con el reclutador, en la segunda una entrevista con el responsable de Talent y/o Operaciones, junto a una prueba técnica y, por último, se valorará la prueba conjuntamente con el responsable del departamento en cuestión.

En SII Group Spain, garantizamos igualdad de oportunidades para todos los candidatos, sin importar su raza, género, religión o condición sexual. Valoramos la diversidad y creemos en un entorno laboral inclusivo para cada miembro de nuestra comunidad. Trabajamos juntos para construir una organización que respeta y valora las diferencias, asegurando un espacio en el que todos puedan prosperar y contribuir al éxito colectivo.
¡Únete al equipo de SII Group Spain y ayúdanos a impulsar la transformación digital e innovación!
Queremos incorporar a nuestro equipo un Qlik Sense Analyst para uno de nuestros proyectos de referencia.

4075806724.title: Senior Data Analyst - OpenData Clinical
4075806724.description:
About the job
Veeva Systems is a mission-driven organization and pioneer in industry cloud, helping life sciences companies bring therapies to patients faster. As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead.

At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. We're not just any public company – we made history in 2021 by becoming a public benefit corporation (PBC), legally bound to balancing the interests of customers, employees, society, and investors.

As a Work Anywhere company, we support your flexibility to work from home or in the office, so you can thrive in your ideal environment.

Join us in transforming the life sciences industry, committed to making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.

The Role

OpenData Clinical is global reference data on sites and investigators.

As one of our Senior Data Analysts, you will be the subject matter expert for questions regarding OpenData Clinical data structure and quality. You will ensure the data we use meets the product goal and provide data analysis for the various stakeholders. You will closely work with product management, data operations, data governance, software engineering, and quality assurance teams.

To thrive in your role, you need to have an academic background in the technical field and a life science background or experience working with life science data, with substantial experience with data analytics, large databases, and complex data sets. You are a fast learner, detail-oriented, have a growth mindset, and can turn data into valuable insights. You communicate effectively with stakeholders and can deliver high-quality results within a tough timeline.

We care about a great cultural fit. You should enjoy working at speed in multi-cultural teams. We are the optimal fit if you are excited about data, Life Sciences, and working for a fast-growing tech company.

What You'll Do

Assure that data quality and compliance meet our high standards
Monitor data delivery to product
Extract data from databases (e.g., Redshift, Mongo DB)
Analyze large data sets and generate insights
Identify data gaps and quality issues and provide root cause analysis
Perform ad-hoc analysis and create customized reports for various stakeholders

Requirements

University degree in an analytical or technical field, e.g., bioinformatics, applied mathematics
3+ years of working experience in data analysis or data quality, with life science data experience
Experience in complex organizational structures, reporting to senior management
Proven track record managing data analytics projects
Advanced SQL skills
Proficient in Python for data manipulation and analysis
Experience with large databases and complex datasets
Skilled in data visualization tools (e.g., Superset, Tableau, Power BI)
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English

Nice to Have

Experience with workflow orchestration tools (e.g., Apache Airflow)
Experience with data governance and data quality frameworks
Experienced with Atlassian Jira
Ability to create and maintain automated reporting systems

Perks & Benefits

Opportunity to work in a diverse and international workspace
Personal development budget
Fitness reimbursement

Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.

As an equal opportunity employer, Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us at talent_accommodations@veeva.com.

4157277936.title: SCIB Quant Data Analytics & Models Specialist
4157277936.description:
About the job
SCIB is looking for a Quant Data Analytics & Models Specialist, based in our Boadilla del Monte office.

WHY YOU SHOULD CONSIDER THIS OPPORTUNITY

At Santander CIB (www.santandercib.com) we are key players in the transformation of the financial sector. Do you want to join us?

Santander Corporate & Investment Banking (SCIB) is Santander's global division that supports some of the world's most complex and sophisticated corporate and institutional clients, offering customized services and value-added wholesale products to best meet their needs.

Santander is proud of being an organization where there are equal opportunities regardless of gender identity, culture and disability. Our mission is to contribute to help more people and business prosper.

We embrace a strong risk culture and all of our professionals at all levels are expected to take a proactive and responsible approach toward risk management.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

As a Quant Data Analytics & Models Specialist, you will help us in different fronts:
Improvement and support of a Distributed Calculation Engine for metrics, sensitivities and FMtM of XVA.
Engine performance and tuning evaluation. Improving existing tools to monitor and identify bottlenecks of the current solution. (On-prem/cloud)
Collaborate to understand and identify the data required to do the calculations in the XVA engine. Collaborate to define the most accurate data modeling in terms of consistency, scalability and efficiency.
Collaborate on CI/CD automations, testing and data validations.

EXPERIENCE
Between 2-10 years of experience in relevant fields

EDUCATION
Ph.D /MS in Computer Engineering and/or Telecommunication

SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE
Team player
Excellence in analysis, problem solving and summary communication
Proactive
Positive with a critical mind
Fluent English written and spoken. Spanish is desirable
Programming Paradigms: Object-Oriented, Concurrent / Multithreading
Programming Languages:
- Must have: C/C++, Java, Python
- Desirable: Rust, Shell, VBA, Dash
Software architectures: High performance Computing paradigm, Distributed Grid Computing, Pipelines, Micro services, Predictive analysis
Operating Systems: GNU/Linux, Windows
Database:
- SQL is a must for relational databases
- Experience in at least one, Oracle/MSSQL/MariaDB/PostgresSQL
- Document Oriented Database. Experience in MongoDB
- Desirable: Columnar Databases, NoSQL, Graph Database: Experience in at least one, Oracle Graph/Neo4J
Basic Math:
- Graphs & Linear Algebra
- Desirable: Montecarlo Simulation & Stochastic Process, Differentiation
Compiler Construction:
- gcc, ms visual studio
- Desirable Cloud Technologies: Azure, AWS

If you want to know more about us, follow us on https://www.linkedin.com/company/santander-corporate-investment-banking/

Visit our website  https://www.betechwithsantander.com/en/home

4165428978.title: Associate Product Data Analyst - Experiments & Insights
4165428978.description:
About the job
Associate Product Data Analyst - Experiments & Insights - (Hybrid) 

As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We're seeking a junior Product Data Analyst to join our Experiments & Insights team in Barcelona (hybrid) to help different teams across the organization to succeed in their mission by providing insights generation and data analysis support in a healthy data-informed environment. If you're ready to soar, we're ready to take you there.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

21 million customers – 44 markets – 5 brands – 6.5M members in Prime

Over 1,600 employees – More than 60 different nationalities from all continents

99% permanent contracts - 36 average age

We're the world’s leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. We are a tech company revolutionizing the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do: 

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. Our Experiments and Insights team is the centre of excellence for Online (AB) Experimentation and for providing best practices to generate insights and learning from and for the experiments. As an Associate Product Data Analyst inside the team, you will be in charge of:

 Analyse performance and identify behaviours in our different websites and interfaces related to our products; 
 Analyse performance and user behaviours in the A/B Tests experiments or Pre-Post run by the product teams; 
 Help the product teams to generate their testing hypotheses by providing exploratory analysis about our products, past tests, etc, 
 Data cleaning and validation, 
 Definition of new tracking that will all mostly be added in Google Analytics (to be able to answer different kinds of research/product questions); 
 Build and maintain dashboards (mostly using LookerStudio) and/or reports (mostly in Google Sheets) to share performance information with senior management and C-level stakeholders; 
 Lead data-driven initiatives to improve company decision making and business knowledge; 
 Responsible for one or more team’s projects such as the investigation and implementation of new methodologies, new data analysis techniques or the usage of new tools; 
 Collaborate with user researchers and designers to detect gaps in knowledge about our user; identify research opportunities to fill those gaps. 


NOTE: Data you will be using could come from Google Analytics API or Google Analytics tables in BigQuery, other sources of data stored in BigQuery such as internal databases, customer service database, etc., as well as our data stored and accessible in Microstrategy.

What you need to succeed: 

Good to have

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:

 Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline is a requirement (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, etc.), 
 Minimum of 2 years experience in a role with strong analytical component, 
 Previous experience in user behavior analysis (product performance) using data from any of the following: Google Analytics/Adobe Analytics/Mix Panel/ Amplitude/Matomo/… 
 Strong knowledge of the math and statistical concepts behind A/B testing, 
 Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data, 
 Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc), 
 Knowledge of visualisation tools like LookerStudio, Tableau, Looker or Qlikview, 
 Business Proficiency in English, 
 A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys having fun! 


It would be a plus if you have:

 R or Python programming skills (mostly for data extraction and data manipulation), 
 Google Analytics knowledge (as well as Google Analytics API, googleAnalyticsR library for R, GA4, etc.), 
 Knowledge on data structure and data sets management in Google Cloud Platform. 
 Previous experience programming.


What’s in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture.

Here's what we offer:

A rewarding Compensation package! 💥 Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.

Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! 📚 Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.

Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! 🚀 Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.

Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! 💙 At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.

Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! 🎉 Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.

Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! 💫 Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation. Don’t meet every requirement? If you’re excited about this role but do not feel your experience aligns perfectly with all the requirements we strongly encourage you to apply nevertheless.
