4105558500.title: Senior Data Analyst - Partner Ads (They/She/He)
4105558500.description:
About the job
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique? 

🤝 Our culture and strong values. 

💪 Our career development philosophy. 

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good. 

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

You will be a key resource to provide revenue and performance insights to Glovo’s commercial teams dedicated to the sales of advertising and monetisation products. You will use and generate information resources regarding our sales pipelines, and team performance developing data products, analytics and models to drive prioritization, pricing, budgeting and campaigns optimisations.

In this role you will be part of the Monetisation Team at Glovo HQ, being able to Improve Glovo’s food partners P&L and developing a scalable revenue stream from Ads, Promotion and other services to support our Partner’s Growth . Working in the Global team you will play a pivotal role for the teams in all our geographies to deliver the Ads & Monetisation business plan contributing directly to the company P&L.

You’ll be part of a fast growing area and have the opportunity to work on new solutions and bring existing ones to the next level.

THE JOURNEY

Build Kpis, logics and data products to define the Next Best Action per account managed in order to encourage higher sale values, volumes, conversion rates, margin rates, and Advertiser’s satisfaction. 
Build Kpis. logics and data products to measure and optimize sales team performances, and assess the effectiveness of implemented strategies. 
Work closely with multi-disciplinary to lead projects end to end and contribute to strategy definition for revenue development and optimisation. 
Establishing timelines, defining deliverables, and managing stakeholders flow end-to-end for project development. 
Maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools ensuring all related systems are configured correctly, validated and working to full capacity.
Distribute weekly, monthly and quarterly dynamic reporting of expected sales results, variances and budget comparisons.
Conduct trainings to ensure all impacted colleagues are fully competent in the use of all tools, processes and insights 
Drive clarity and solve ambiguous, challenging business problems using data-driven approaches
Provide guidance and support to business leaders and stakeholders on how best to harness available data in support of critical business needs and goal

What You Will Bring To The Ride

2-4 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role, preferably in commercial facing teams
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with analytics/ds libraries such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown
In-depth knowledge of BI tools such as Looker, Tableau, and practical experience analyzing data, program metrics, and performance
Ability to summarize and represent data (e.g., descriptive statistics and graphs).
Ability to create robust, insightful, and story-telling visualizations using modern BI & Analytics tools and ability to identify data Issues.
Familiarity with a collaborative environment and/or version control (GitHub, Git).
Ability to build hypotheses and test them (sometimes by piloting projects entirely)
Project management / coordination skills. Determined to get things done
Understanding of A/B test principles, to design, conduct and analyze different experiments.
You are eager to learn, hungry for knowledge, and want to work towards growing in your career from day one.
You are independent in solving problems within your capabilities and proactive in asking for support when the task is beyond your expertise.
You are not afraid of giving/receiving constant & honest feedback

NICE TO HAVE 

Experience within the digital advertising industry and data monetisation

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? 

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

4135234742.title: Senior Data Analyst
4135234742.description:
About the job
Senior Data Analyst – Monetization & Subscription Analytics

At Ideawise, we build communities that empower people to live authentic and fulfilled lives. Our mission is to create impactful user experiences, and we’re seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join our Monetization Squad.
In this role, you’ll use cutting-edge tools like SQL, Snowflake, and Tableau to analyze subscription-based revenue streams, in-app purchases (IAPs), and ads. If you’re passionate about data storytelling, app monetization, and driving decisions through insights, this is the role for you.

What You’ll Do
Analyze subscription-based revenue models and recommend strategies to maximize LTV, ARPU, ARPPU, and ROAS.
Design and implement A/B testing and multivariate experiments to validate feature impacts.
Build dashboards and tools to support data-driven decisions across Product, Tech, and Business teams.
Estimate potential impacts of product features and sunset non-performing ones.
Collaborate with data engineers to ensure accurate data tracking and pipelines.
Identify high-performing revenue channels and prioritize resource allocation accordingly.
Present actionable insights to stakeholders through compelling data storytelling.

What We’re Looking For
Must-Have Skills and Experience
5+ years of experience in data analysis, ideally in subscription-based businesses.
Expertise in SQL and Python for advanced data analysis.
Experience with cloud-native data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery, or Redshift).
Strong communication skills in English (written and spoken).
Proficiency with BI tools like Tableau, Superset, Power BI, or Looker.
Experience in designing and implementing A/B tests and statistical analyses.
Nice-to-Have Skills
Knowledge of app-based business models (e.g., App Store, Google Play).
Experience in paid user acquisition metrics (e.g., ROAS, LTV, payback periods).
Familiarity with tools like Mixpanel, Amplitude, or Eppo.
Background in the dating or gaming industries with IAPs/ads experience.

Why Join Us?
Impactful Work: Shape the future of our app monetization strategy.
Global Team: Collaborate with talented professionals from around the world.
Remote Flexibility: Work from anywhere with flexible hours.
Growth Opportunities: Access to training, mentorship, and career advancement.

How to Apply
Are you ready to take your data analysis skills to the next level? Apply now!
Submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience with app-based subscription models and data storytelling.

Please send your cover letter directly to wouter@ideawisegroup.com

4172358634.title: VF Analytics Specialist
4172358634.description:
About the job
Description

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. Operations is at the heart of what we do, delivering hundreds of thousands of items each day and fulfilling customer orders from all over the world.

As an VenforFlex Analytics Specialist, you will have the opportunity to support operations to improve and monitoring Customer Experience metrics for Vendor Flex sites across EU. We seek a strong candidate that can prioritize well, communicate clearly, and has a consistent track record of delivery. You must have the experience and capability to partner with other teams to ensure providing insightful call-outs, support and suggested actions to the Operations teams and their stakeholders. You will be responsible of providing added value reports on Transportation, Inventory Quality, Concessions and other Customer Experience (CX) KPIs at an EU level. You will monitor and action CX issues impacting the network.

A key to influencing shareholders is to have the ability to solve complex, technical problems with simple, innovative and practical solutions.

Key job responsibilities

 Business analysis and partnership across Amazon with Supply Chain, Transportation and Ops leaders to develop new standard operating opportunities.
 Leverage ideas from Support Teams to source and nurture creative improvement plans for the Flow Analytics.
 Take proactive steps to ensure that best practices are being shared, standardized across all the sites.
 Be a Subject Matter Expert on Operations, Transportation, and Customer Experience.
 Continuously monitor performance of sites that are attributable to Flow Analytics and take corrective steps whenever required to optimize productivity performance and Customer Experience.

A day in the life

This position is office-based 5 days per week.

Basic Qualifications

 Relevant experience in a logistics/operations environment.
 Intermediate proficiency in verbal and written English (B2 in the Common European Framework of Reference, CEFR)
 Relevant experience working with the MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)

Preferred Qualifications

 Strong analytical skills that allow using data from SQL/workbench/QuickSight to provide thought-provoking and workable solutions. Data is what you look to when given a problem to solve.
 Strong knowledge of Lean / Six Sigma or alternative continuous improvement methods, and their application in industrial settings.
 Previous experience working at Vendor Flex and having a deep knowledge of its systems and processes.
 You typically volunteer to lead projects and help your team achieve goals. You have a track record of taking ownership and driving results.
 You see value in long term thinking and large scale impact to a company. You have interest in developing a long-term career through assignments in multiple operational buildings across the nation. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

4138641512.title: Senior Data Operations Analyst - Link
4138641512.description:
About the job
Veeva Systems is a mission-driven organization and pioneer in industry cloud, helping life sciences companies bring therapies to patients faster. As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead.

At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. We're not just any public company – we made history in 2021 by becoming a public benefit corporation (PBC), legally bound to balancing the interests of customers, employees, society, and investors.

As a Work Anywhere company, we support your flexibility to work from home or in the office, so you can thrive in your ideal environment.

Join us in transforming the life sciences industry, committed to making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.

The Role

Our goal is to create the Industry Cloud for Life Sciences, leveraging cloud technology, data, and consulting to improve efficiency across the industry.

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be the subject matter expert on OpenData Clinical data structure, pipeline, and quality. You’ll ensure data accuracy, align it with product goals, and provide actionable insights to stakeholders. You will analyze large datasets, identify trends, and collaborate with teams across product management, data operations, governance, engineering, and QA to improve data quality and inform decision-making.

Applicants must have the unrestricted right to work in Spain. Veeva will not provide sponsorship at this time.

What You'll Do

Assure that data quality and compliance meet our high standards
Extract data from databases (e.g., Redshift, Mongo DB)
Analyze large data sets and generate insights
Identify data gaps and quality issues and provide root cause analysis
Build and maintain a technical data model (entity relationship diagram)
Create customized reports and dashboards for internal stakeholders

Requirements

3+ years of experience in data analysis or data quality
Proven experience managing data analytics projects and reporting to senior management
Advanced SQL, Python, or R skills for data manipulation and automation
Proficiency with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Strong communication skills in English
Based in Spain or Portugal
Technical background in life sciences data or related fields
Strong analytical skills with large, complex datasets
Detail-oriented, quick learner with a growth mindset
Ability to work in a fast-paced, remote, international environment
Passionate about data, life sciences, and contributing to a growing tech company
Based in Spain

Nice to Have

Lean Six Sigma, PMP, or relevant certifications in data analysis or life sciences
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud) for data storage and analysis
Familiarity with automation tools or workflows to streamline data processing
Basic knowledge or experience with machine learning algorithms and applications
Knowledge of best practices for data governance, quality control, and compliance (e.g., GDPR)
Ability to work with diverse teams (e.g., product, engineering, operations) to align data strategies with business objectives
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot data-related issues efficiently
Proficiency in other languages would be beneficial in an international team environment

Perks & Benefits

1% charitable giving program
Medical private insurance
Dental Cover
Income protection
Private pension plan
Life insurance
Travel Insurance
Fitness reimbursement

#RemoteSpain

Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.

As an equal opportunity employer, Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us at talent_accommodations@veeva.com.

4151326110.title: Online Data Analyst
4151326110.description:
About the job
Online Data Analyst - Spanish (ES)


Job Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community
Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

Qualification Path:
No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in Spanish and English
Being a resident in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Spain
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment:
In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4143291165.title: Risk Analytics Senior Consultant
4143291165.description:
About the job
EY es líder mundial en servicios de auditoría, fiscalidad, asesoramiento en transacciones y consultoría, con más de 250.000 profesionales en más de 150 países.

Nuestro lema, “Building a better working world”, resume la esencia y la razón de ser de EY. Contribuimos activamente en la economía mundial, ayudando a nuestras empresas cliente y al mundo empresarial a mejorar y crecer en un marco ético y responsable.

Además, proporcionamos un entorno de trabajo idóneo para desarrollar personas líderes con carreras exitosas a través de equipos de alto rendimiento. Nos preocupamos por que nuestra gente tenga el mejor desarrollo y formación profesional posible, de manera que se tengan en consideración sus intereses y expectativas, que disfruten de un ambiente de trabajo desafiante y que gocen de reconocimiento.

Contamos con una estrategia, “NextWave”, que es nuestra mejor apuesta para alcanzar el éxito. Nuestra ambición es aportar valor a largo plazo, tanto a nuestros clientes, como a nuestro equipo de profesionales y por supuesto a la sociedad, como la compañía de servicios profesionales más reconocida del mundo.

¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos un Risk Analytics Senior Consultant con un perfil híbrido (combine skills técnicas de Data & Analytics con skills de negocio) y con experiencia, para liderar la vanguardia en la gestión de riesgos y análisis de datos. Este rol estratégico es esencial para fortalecer nuestro enfoque proactivo en la monitorización de auditoría continua, gobernanza de inteligencia artificial, y aseguramiento de la calidad de datos, facilitando así la toma de decisiones basada en análisis de riesgo avanzado y predictivo.

Funciones:

Diseñar e implementar estrategias de monitorización de auditoría continua para identificar riesgos operativos y financieros en tiempo real.
Desarrollar y mantener un marco de gobierno de inteligencia artificial (IA) que asegure la alineación ética y regulatoria de los algoritmos y modelos de datos.
Supervisar la integridad y calidad de los datos, implementando procesos de Data Quality para garantizar la precisión y confiabilidad de la información utilizada en análisis de riesgos.
Liderar proyectos de risk analytics, aplicando técnicas estadísticas y de machine learning para predecir y mitigar riesgos potenciales.
Colaborar estrechamente con equipos interdisciplinarios para integrar soluciones de análisis de riesgos en los procesos de negocio.
Proporcionar orientación experta y formación a los equipos internos sobre las mejores prácticas en análisis de riesgos y uso de datos.
Realizar evaluaciones de riesgo y presentar hallazgos clave a la alta dirección para informar sobre la toma de decisiones estratégicas.
Mantenerse actualizado con las tendencias emergentes en analytics, riesgos y regulaciones, aplicando estos conocimientos para mejorar continuamente las operaciones de la empresa.
Fomentar una cultura de innovación y mejora continua en el análisis de riesgos y la gestión de datos

Requisitos:

Licenciatura/ grado en Ingeniería, administración y Direccion de empresas o ramas afines
Inglés alto
más de 3 años realizando las funciones descritas en empresa de consultoría Big4 o similares
Conocimientos técnicos en SQL, Python, Power BI
Valorable conocimiento en Inteligencia Artificial, Big Data y Risk Management
Disponibilidad para viajar/desplazamiento a cliente
Desarrollo comercial
Gestión de equipos

Qué Buscamos:

Aumentar el valor de nuestro equipo de Technology Risk para, de esta manera dar un mejor servicio a nuestros clientes y ayudar a la transformación digital en un entorno cambiante y dinámico.

Qué ofrecemos:

Aprendizaje continuo: Desarrollarás la mentalidad y las habilidades para enfrentarte a nuevos retos.
Tú defines el éxito: te proporcionaremos herramientas y flexibilidad para que puedas llegar a las metas propuestas.

Si quieres unirte a nosotros, no dudes en hacernos llegar tu candidatura!

La experiencia en EY es excepcional; constrúyela

EY | Building a better working world 

EY existe para construir un mundo de trabajo mejor, ayudamos a nuestros clientes, personas y sociedad a crear un valor a largo plazo para generar valor en el mercado.
Gracias a los datos y la tecnología, tenemos equipos en más de 150 países generando confianza y ayudando a los clientes a crecer, transformarse y operar.
Trabajando en Auditoria, Consultoría, Tax, Estrategia y Transacciones, los equipos de EY se hacen las mejores preguntas para encontrar nuevas respuestas a complejos problemas en los que se encuentra nuestro mundo a día de hoy.
Building a better working world
NextWave
¿Qué buscamos?
Funciones:
Diseñar e implementar estrategias de monitorización de auditoría continua para identificar riesgos operativos y financieros en tiempo real.
Desarrollar y mantener un marco de gobierno de inteligencia artificial (IA) que asegure la alineación ética y regulatoria de los algoritmos y modelos de datos.
Supervisar la integridad y calidad de los datos, implementando procesos de Data Quality para garantizar la precisión y confiabilidad de la información utilizada en análisis de riesgos.
Liderar proyectos de risk analytics, aplicando técnicas estadísticas y de machine learning para predecir y mitigar riesgos potenciales.
Colaborar estrechamente con equipos interdisciplinarios para integrar soluciones de análisis de riesgos en los procesos de negocio.
Proporcionar orientación experta y formación a los equipos internos sobre las mejores prácticas en análisis de riesgos y uso de datos.
Realizar evaluaciones de riesgo y presentar hallazgos clave a la alta dirección para informar sobre la toma de decisiones estratégicas.
Mantenerse actualizado con las tendencias emergentes en analytics, riesgos y regulaciones, aplicando estos conocimientos para mejorar continuamente las operaciones de la empresa.
Fomentar una cultura de innovación y mejora continua en el análisis de riesgos y la gestión de datos

4163318515.title: Data Analyst – Ads & Marketing Analytics (They/She/He)
4163318515.description:
About the job
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique? 

🤝 Our culture and strong values. 

💪 Our career development philosophy. 

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good. 

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY

Advertising performance:
Measure the effectiveness of the implemented commercial initiatives and establish KPIs to assess their performance (e.g., fill-rates, budget exhaustion rates) 
Design new KPIs to measure advertising campaigns success (ie. ROAS, New To Brand, Sales Uplift,)
Build data processing pipelines to make data available in Looker Dashboards for Commercial team
To deliver ad-hoc actionable insights and strategic initiatives to solve critical challenges in each market.
Audience monetization:
To use first-party data to build custom user segments that deliver value for advertiser and combine shopping behaviour and category data to enlarge audience capabilities creation
Create segmentation criteria for our 1P data to make it relevant and useful for Advertisers
Build API integrations with different Ads buying platforms (e.g.: DV360, TTD, CDPs)
Sales performance:
Make local teams' life easier by setting up and supporting centralized dashboards with FMCGs Sales, and performance data.
Contribute to continuous enhancement and innovation on how local teams consume data and share it with brands to unlock new opportunities.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
What You Will Bring To The Ride

3-5 years of professional work experience on analytics in a similar/relevant industry experience in a data analytics role, preferably in advertising facing teams
Demonstrated proficiency in working with clean & optimized SQL and python, querying mid to large volumes of data.
A higher education in scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics.
Knowledge or experience in digital product development
Understanding of A/B test principles, to design, conduct and analyze different experiments.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI
Excellent spoken and written English
Experience working on FMCG/CPG in Analytics is a Plus.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? 

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

4117605146.title: Data Analyst Tax, Global Tax Services
4117605146.description:
About the job
Description

The Data Analyst improves VAT Compliance reporting and data accuracy for Global Tax Services to reflect legislative and business change. In this role, you will work closely with indirect tax compliance customers and internal tech partners to support complex data solutions underpinning Amazon's indirect tax reporting in EMEA. As a Data Analyst, you will be expected to have solid data management experience, strong skills data querying skills and understanding of tax and accounting principles to support indirect tax compliance teams in EMEA.

Key job responsibilities

 Investigating and resolving data quality issues
 Defining technical requirements based on data analysis
 Performing user testing on new system builds
 Using Excel, SQL, Alteryx for reporting, auditing and analysis
 Building relationships with key tech partners and business teams
 Identifying process gaps and improvements
 Escalating technical/operational issues appropriately
 Clearly explaining financial concepts and analysis to stakeholders
 Translating business objectives into actionable analyses
 Leading medium to large projects end-to-end, including establishing timelines, priorities, resource allocation, and keeping stakeholders informed of status and obstacles

About The Team

The Global Tax Services (GTS) team aims to provide scalable, innovative indirect tax data solutions that increase efficiency and reliability. By implementing robust data management standards, we seek to reduce manual work while ensuring stability. Our focus is on delivering exceptional customer service and long-term value through solutions that enable operational scale.

Basic Qualifications

 Experience in tax, finance or a related analytical field
 Experience in Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau
 Experience in business or financial analysis
 Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
 Experience with Excel
 Experience with SQL
 Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders

Preferred Qualifications

 Excellent communication skills; detail-oriented
 3+ year experience in data analytics, business intelligence, tax, or finance
 Bachelor’s degree

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.


Company - Amazon Spain Services, S.L.U.

4150425875.title: Associate in Data Analysis & Reporting
4150425875.description:
About the job
As an Associate in Data Analysis & Reporting (L1), you have the opportunity to be an integral part of our reporting department. You assist in the development of the reporting function within the business, focusing on the provision of standard reporting services.

In this role, you collect the information available on the fundcraft proprietary platform, you assess the completeness of the information, you contribute to the preparation and sending of the reporting to third parties. This role offers an opportunity to develop expertise in the fund administration and fund reportings in particular. You will be enrolled in a training program covering the data collection process, compiling of data, review of report and transmission of data. You will work closely with the technology team to develop efficient and automated processes.

This position is based in Spain, and reports directly to the Risk Manager which is based in Luxembourg.

Key Responsibilities:

Follow the training for a clear understanding of the guidelines related to the different reporting and specific requirements associated to the reporting
Access the fundcraft's platform, and review of the data collected in the context of the preparation of the reports
Identify any missing mandatory data and liaise with the relevant team
Ensure the completeness of the report and data accuracy
Escalate any issues to the team leader
Organise the work to avoid any delays in the sendings
Ensure an appropriate access on third parties portal to facilitate the sending of the reporting
Report to the team leader on the activity via a monitoring dashboard. 
Support and partner with the team in day-to-day duties related to transmission of reporting to third parties
Facilitate the production of reports covering all the fund administration activities ensuring timely and accurate internal and external communications


Requirements

Demonstrate the ability to prioritise workload effectively, take initiative, and manage multiple tasks concurrently, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality reporting
Exhibit a dynamic and proactive approach, with a strong commitment to continuous learning, adapting to new information and methodologies as needed
Maintain a positive and enthusiastic attitude, contributing to a collaborative and motivating work environment that encourages teamwork and shared success
Cultivate strong analytical and critical thinking skills, enabling the assessment of simple but also complex reporting
Foster effective communication skills, both verbal and written, ensuring clarity and precision when collaborating with other members, stakeholders, and clients


Benefits


Why Join Us:

Join a culture that celebrates creativity and welcomes innovative, disruptive ideas, empowering you to make a real impact
Immerse yourself in a fast-paced, diverse workplace where you'll have the chance to collaborate and learn from specialists across various fields, fostering personal and professional growth
Embrace automation and seamless tech integration in your workflows, while our platform boosts operations through tech leverage, ensuring you stay ahead of the curve and updated with new technologies
Enjoy an attractive compensation package that recognizes your contributions and dedication to our shared success, rewarding you fairly for your hard work
Work in a comfortable, ergonomic environment within our spacious, modern offices located conveniently in the heart of Girona, just minutes away from the train station where you can enjoy daily fresh fruit and coffee!
Monthly afterworks organised by the company to unwind and strengthen team connections
Enjoy flexible entry hours that help you balance your personal life with your work commitments

4148270513.title: Data Analyst (Qlik Sense)
4148270513.description:
About the job
¡Únete al equipo de SII Group Spain y ayúdanos a impulsar la transformación digital e innovación!

Te encargarás de analizar y visualizar datos de manera eficiente, ayudando a los equipos a tomar decisiones.

Si estás buscando nuevas oportunidades donde crecer profesionalmente, no dudes en aplicar a a esta oferta 🚀

Funciones Principales

Desarrollar y mantener dashboards en Qlik Sense 📈
Analizar datos para identificar tendencias y oportunidades 📊
Automatizar procesos de recopilación y transformación de datos ⚙️
Capacitar y dar soporte a usuarios internos 🎓
Mejorar continuamente los procesos de análisis 🔄

Requisitos

Experiencia en desarrollo de dashboards con Qlik Sense
Conocimientos en análisis y modelado de datos
Nivel de inglés B2 🌍


¿Quiénes somos?

En SII Group, con más de 16.000 profesionales en 20 países, ofrecemos servicios de IT, Ingeniería y Consultoría que impulsan la transformación digital en múltiples industrias. Nos guiamos por los pilares estratégicos: Growth, People & ESG, manteniendo una cultura de confianza y excelencia reconocida por nuestro equipo con la certificación Great Place to Work.

Let’s Tech Together

Let’s Tech Together es nuestra promesa y filosofía. Nos atrevemos a innovar, a tomar la iniciativa y a construir un futuro tecnológico juntos. Valoramos la autonomía, la experimentación y la inclusión, creando un entorno donde cada idea cuenta y donde cada miembro del equipo puede crecer profesional y personalmente

¿Qué te ofrecemos?

24 días de vacaciones para que desconectes con los tuyos: 🏖️
Disfruta de un merecido descanso con 24 días hábiles de vacaciones, para que disfrutes de tiempo de calidad con tus seres queridos!

Contrato indefinido: 📄

Contrato indefinido, brindándote seguridad y confianza en tu futuro profesional.

Jornada intensiva todos los viernes y el mes de agosto: 🗓️

¡Dale la bienvenida al fin de semana antes! Disfruta de jornadas intensivas los viernes y durante todo el mes de agosto para optimizar tu tiempo libre y equilibrar tu vida laboral."

Retribución flexible: 💼

Te ofrecemos una retribución a la carta pudiendo elegir diferentes productos tales como seguro de salud, tickets de comida, guardería, plataformas de bienestar (WellHub), etc.

Metodología SmartWorking: 🌐

Nos adaptamos a tu estilo de vida con nuestra metodología SmartWorking, que fomenta la flexibilidad y el teletrabajo, permitiéndote alcanzar un equilibrio entre tu carrera y tus compromisos personales.

Oficinas Wellbeing: 🤸‍♂️☕

En nuestra sede de la Agencia West, contamos con instalaciones de bienestar de las que podrás disfrutar: gimnasio equipado, pista de pádel, rocódromo, clases individuales… Además, disponemos de Coffee Corner con café de especialidad para que puedas relajarte y disfrutar de tu pausa.

IT&Engineering Academy: 🎓

Sigue creciendo con nosotros a través de nuestra IT&Engineering Academy, el campus de formación que SII Group Spain pone a tu disposición para que puedas seguir desarrollando nuevas competencias (Hard y Soft Skills), impulsando tu crecimiento profesional y personal.
Además contamos con licencias de Udemy y formación en idiomas. 📚

Oportunidad de aprender de grandes profesionales: 👨‍🏫

Aprovecha la oportunidad de aprender de los mejores. Nuestros programas de coaching y mentoring te brindan la guía y el apoyo necesarios para alcanzar tu máximo potencial.
Tenemos Convenios con distintas Asociaciones y Colegios de Ingenieros, brindándote la posibilidad de acceder a formaciones y normativa específica. 📝

Proyección de futuro y estabilidad: 🚀

Diseña tu propio camino hacia el éxito con nuestro plan de carrera personalizado, que te ofrece proyección de futuro y estabilidad a largo plazo en un ambiente de trabajo colaborativo y motivador.

Movilidad geográfica: 🌍

Explora nuevas oportunidades y experiencias internacionales con nuestra opción de movilidad geográfica, permitiéndote expandir tus horizontes tanto profesional como personalmente.
Eventos de empresa y networking: 🤝

Forma parte de una comunidad cercana y vibrante. Desde after-works hasta cenas y eventos exclusivos, te ofrecemos la oportunidad de conectar y disfrutar del mejor ambiente laboral. Únete a nuestras fiestas trimestrales. 🎉

Programa de referenciados: 📣

Deseamos atraer a los profesionales más destacados y, para lograrlo, te incentivamos a que nos refieras a aquellos talentos excepcionales que conozcas

Plan de rebranding: 🔄

Forma parte de nuestros embajadores de marca en redes sociales, contribuyendo a la estrategia de rebranding de la empresa, así como optando a distintos premios.

Great Place to Work: 😊

Únete a un equipo donde se valora tu bienestar y se promueve un ambiente inclusivo y positivo. ¡Somos un Great Place to Work reconocido por nuestro excepcional clima laboral!

¿Cómo será el proceso de selección?

En la primera fase se llevará a cabo una llamada telefónica con el reclutador, en la segunda una entrevista con el responsable de Talent y/o Operaciones, junto a una prueba técnica y, por último, se valorará la prueba conjuntamente con el responsable del departamento en cuestión.

En SII Group Spain, garantizamos igualdad de oportunidades para todos los candidatos, sin importar su raza, género, religión o condición sexual. Valoramos la diversidad y creemos en un entorno laboral inclusivo para cada miembro de nuestra comunidad. Trabajamos juntos para construir una organización que respeta y valora las diferencias, asegurando un espacio en el que todos puedan prosperar y contribuir al éxito colectivo.
¡Únete al equipo de SII Group Spain y ayúdanos a impulsar la transformación digital e innovación!
Te encargarás de analizar y visualizar datos de manera eficiente, ayudando a los equipos a tomar decisiones.
Si estás buscando nuevas oportunidades donde crecer profesionalmente, no dudes en aplicar a a esta oferta 🚀

4152913529.title: Data and Support Analyst
4152913529.location: San Sebastián de los Reyes, Community of Madrid, Spain
4152913529.description:
About the job
Would you like to join an international atmosphere and being involved in projects across Europe and with impact worldwide having the opportunity to consolidate your career? This is your opportunity!

We are looking for a Data and Support Analyst to join our team!

Description
Ensure IT Service Management processes quality in alignment with Mercedes-Benz standards and best practices for the different support levels.
Collaborate with the different support levels to streamline operations and enhance the reliability of retail systems.
Create and maintains reports and dashboards that visualize trends and performance metrics.
Analyse performance metrics to identify trends, anticipate potential issues, and initiate preventive measures.
Monitoring and analysing support tickets and incidents to improve service quality and efficiency.
Create and maintain Management reporting to inform about the support performance to made decision and prioritization of initiatives.
Ticket clearing: Receive and manage tickets where the responsible solving team is not clear or known.
Ensure continuous improvement by regularly reviewing and updating support and operations protocols.
Facilitate and maintain a comprehensive Contact and Escalation Matrix.
Centralize and coordinate demands related to support from the different stakeholders (support levels, products..)
Ensure knowledge management:
Ensure article quality through proper formatting, approvals, and deletion.
Knowledge base structure and access management

Qualifications 
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Information Systems or a STEM related field.
Proven 3+ years experience working ITSM processes and principles (Certifications such as ITIL is recommended).
Proven experience with reporting tools like ServiceNow, PowerBI..
Understand how to define and measure SLO, SLA & SLI to meet goals for application availability and performance.
Analytical Skills: Ability to analyse incident and ticket data to identify trends and potential issues.
Problem-Solving abilities: Proactive approach to identifying and resolving issues.
Experience in dashboard creation and management monitoring and reporting purposes.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Attention to detail and a commitment to maintaining high standards of ticket and knowledge management quality.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment.

Languages
Proficient in English, both written and spoken.
Knowledge of the German language is a plus.

We offer you the opportunity to grow in an international and dynamic environment, taking part in new projects.

Within our benefits as employee, we provide:
Competitive salary + variable compensation
60% Mobile work
Flexible entering hours
30 working days of holidays
Annual Training Plan
Mercedes-Benz benefits (Renting plans, employee discount)

4143720000.title: Data & Analytics Specialist
4143720000.description:
About the job
Requirements

 Description and Requirements 

The Team You Will Join 

The Data Team is integrated in Transformation, Strategy & Delivery department and is responsible to provide trusted information, ensuring data governance, integrity, and ethical use to support agile decisions, improve the customer journey, and provide informed business responses by collecting, analyzing and transforming data into valuable information.

We are a committed and enthusiastic Team with excellent collaboration with other departments including business, technology & Opps, having an ambitious data roadmap to execute and deliver to our stakeholders.

The Opportunity 

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Data & Analytics Specialist to join our Iberia Data Team to be part of a transformational and ambitious journey, being a reference in this crucial area for MetLife.

The Data & Analytics Specialist will play a critical role in transforming raw data into actionable insights, support data governance initiatives, and contribute to the Organization’s data strategy, implementing solutions that enhance our analytical approach linked to business growth.

How You’ll Help Us Build a Confident Future (Key Responsibilities)

Implement and enhance Iberia Data strategy defined on our ambitious data roadmap, promoting a data-driven culture.
Work on different Data Products through the design and execution of database queries, using BI tools, to perform analysis in response to business needs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and document business requirements and goals ensuring a thorough understanding of business needs and objectives
Analyze our data ecosystem and interpret data to identify trends, patters, and insights, leveraging data to enhance business value through the usage of Data use cases. 
Collaborate with our global Data Science team to develop and industrialize predictive data science models as well as monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of implemented solutions and make adjustments as necessary.
Establish robust data governance frameworks to foster data quality, data ethics and implement data glossary. 
Foster innovation using data-driven insights to create competitive advantages aligned with organization’s data strategy. 
Stay current with the latest developments in data science, machine learning and AI in order to apply that knowledge to enhance existing methodologies.


What You Need To Succeed (Required Qualifications)

Degree/Master’s degree in data science or a related field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Economics 
Minimum of 2 year experience in a Data analyst role
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think critically and strategically
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels 
Experience with data analysis and visualization tools as PowerBI, SQL, Excel and data governance tools 
Ability to understand and interconnect data across various applications
Ability to manage multiple priorities and strong attention to detail
Good written and spoken English 


About MetLife

Recognized on Fortune magazine's list of the 2024 "World's Most Admired Companies" and Fortune World’s 25 Best Workplaces™ for 2024, MetLife , through its subsidiaries and affiliates, is one of the world’s leading financial services companies; providing insurance, annuities, employee benefits and asset management to individual and institutional customers. With operations in more than 40 markets, we hold leading positions in the United States, Latin America, Asia, Europe, and the Middle East.

Our purpose is simple - to help our colleagues, customers, communities, and the world at large create a more confident future. United by purpose and guided by empathy, we’re inspired to transform the next century in financial services.

At MetLife, it’s #AllTogetherPossible . Join us!

4090272969.title: Senior Data Analyst
4090272969.description:
About the job
At Playson, we’re on a mission to create innovative gaming experiences powered by actionable insights. We’re looking for a detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team and help turn complex data into clear, strategic recommendations that drive business growth. If you’re passionate about numbers and want to make a real impact, this role is for you.

What You'll Be Doing

Transform and analyze large, complex data sets representing transactional, financial data, and player behavior to uncover actionable insights.
Deliver proactive recommendations to stakeholders across product, commercial, and technical disciplines to shape optimization and enhance KPIs.
Build and maintain automated dashboards to visualize key metrics and performance trends.
Deliver in-depth researches to check against various business hypotheses and provide actionable recommendations. 
Collaborate across teams to drive data-informed decisions for product improvements.
Own multiple data projects in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.
Contribute to data literacy growth and advancement across the company.

What You’ll Bring

4+ years of analytical experience, ideally in the iGaming, gaming or video streaming industry.
Strong knowledge of SQL for querying and managing large datasets.
Solid expertise in data visualization, including tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms.
A proactive data-driven mindset with curiosity, experience in daily reporting, and insights generation.
Excellent communication and data storytelling skills, with the ability to present findings clearly to all stakeholders, regardless of their data skills.
A self-motivated, detail-oriented approach to work.

Nice-to-Have Skills

Familiarity with ClickHouse and Python (or other scripting languages).
Understanding of iGaming market, game provider business model and relevant metrics
Experience with tools like Redash and Confluence.
Enthusiasm for learning and personal projects in data analytics or machine learning.

What We Offer

Competitive salary with quarterly bonuses.
Unlimited paid vacation and sick leave.
Opportunities for professional growth through training programs.

4137590076.title: Sr. Data Analyst Ads(They/She/He)
4137590076.description:
About the job
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique? 

🤝 Our culture and strong values. 

💪 Our career development philosophy. 

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good. 

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY

Advertising performance:
Measure the effectiveness of the implemented commercial initiatives and establish KPIs to assess their performance (e.g., fill-rates, budget exhaustion rates) 
Design new KPIs to measure advertising campaigns success (ie. ROAS, New To Brand, Sales Uplift,)
Build data processing pipelines to make data available in Looker Dashboards for Commercial team
To deliver ad-hoc actionable insights and strategic initiatives to solve critical challenges in each market.
Audience monetization:
To use first-party data to build custom user segments that deliver value for advertiser and combine shopping behaviour and category data to enlarge audience capabilities creation
Create segmentation criteria for our 1P data to make it relevant and useful for Advertisers
Build API integrations with different Ads buying platforms (e.g.: DV360, TTD, CDPs)
Sales performance:
Make local teams' life easier by setting up and supporting centralized dashboards with FMCGs Sales, and performance data.
Contribute to continuous enhancement and innovation on how local teams consume data and share it with brands to unlock new opportunities.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
What You Will Bring To The Ride

3-5 years of professional work experience on analytics in a similar/relevant industry experience in a data analytics role, preferably in advertising facing teams
Demonstrated proficiency in working with clean & optimized SQL and python, querying mid to large volumes of data.
A higher education in scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics.
Knowledge or experience in digital product development
Understanding of A/B test principles, to design, conduct and analyze different experiments.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI
Excellent spoken and written English
Experience working on FMCG/CPG in Analytics is a Plus.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? 

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

4168623616.title: Senior Product Analyst - (All genders)
4168623616.description:
About the job
Company Description

More than 20 years ago, zooplus was one of the first to bring the pet category into the world of eCommerce. Today, we stand strong as Europe’s leading online pet platform, delivering moments of happiness to more than 9 million pet parents each year.

We're on a mission to create joy for pets and their parents, driven by our core values of Care, Courage, Openness, and Simplicity. At the heart of everything we do, they inspire us to grow, raise the bar for our customers and fuel a pet-first business.

Job Description

As a Senior Product Analyst at zooplus, you will join our Product Analytics team, serving as the advanced analytics service-provider for our product teams, within the CPO division. You'll take ownership of the entire analytics pipeline for your assigned stakeholders, from provisioning analytical data (e.g., via analytical data marts) to crafting reports, designing dashboards, conducting exploratory data analysis, creating visualizations, generating insights, and offering actionable recommendations.

Your role involves close collaboration with designated product areas, understanding their unique business goals and challenges. You'll ensure that the insights you uncover are fully aligned with our product strategy and objectives. When necessary, you'll coordinate with relevant colleagues to ensure data generation and collection meet analytical requirements, ensuring you have all the necessary data to perform your analyses effectively. You'll play a pivotal role in fostering a data-driven culture within zooplus.

By sharing your insights with your assigned product area and business teams, you'll empower them to make informed decisions. Additionally, you'll provide training to team members, enabling them to independently access and utilize reporting data, further strengthening our data-driven approach.

Key Responsibilities:

Own the end-to-end analytics pipeline, focusing on transactional and behavioral data analysis utilizing applied statistics.
Conduct deep dives into product-specific datasets, providing rigorous and actionable insights.
Conduct product discovery analysis aligned with product objectives to identify opportunities, generate hypotheses, and guide experimentation.
Apply statistical techniques (A/B testing, regression analysis, forecasting) to analyze product performance and inform decision-making.
Develop advanced dashboards and SQL-based reports to track key performance indicators.
Present findings and recommendations for action to key stakeholders, adapting communication for different audiences.
Integrate insights from multiple data sources into a cohesive analytical framework.
Act as a data specialist within the product domain, guiding best practices in transactional data and statistical modeling.
Mentor junior team members and contribute to developing the analytics function.
Stay updated on analytical advancements and recommend new methodologies or tools.

Qualifications

Strong analytical and statistical background with a critical thinking mindset.
5+ years of experience in a data-driven product environment, preferably in e-commerce.
Proven ability to apply statistical techniques (A/B testing, regression, forecasting) to business challenges.
Expert-level in SQL (including query optimization, handling large datasets, and data mart creation) and transactional data analysis for evaluating business performance and customer behavior.
Proficiency in Tableau, Power BI, or similar visualization tools.
Experience with Adobe Analytics or similar digital analytics tools is a plus.
Experience working in/with digital customer facing product teams and event data is a plus.
Good knowledge of Python or R for statistical modeling and automation.
Ability to simplify complex data insights and tailor messaging for different audiences.
Experience leading analytics projects that impacted the whole company and working cross-functionally with product and business teams.
Strong communication skills and confidence in presenting findings to senior stakeholders.
First steps in project & team leadership
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field is preferred.

Additional Information

With more than 1,000 passionate professionals located across 6 European offices, we believe our success comes from working together and leveraging our international strengths. Expect a hybrid work setup: 60% in-office, 40% remote, collaborating with colleagues across locations.

Our benefits:

🐾 20% discount in our zooplus shop

📖 Internal and external training

🎈 Team events

✈️ 28 Annual Vacation Days

🩺 Private Medical Health Insurance

⏰ Hybrid working model (up to 40%Home Office per month)

Want to know more? Learn more about zooplus here, and check out our LinkedIn, Instagram, TikTok and YouTube to get a glimpse into the zooplus culture.

zooplus is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members.

4145141558.title: Snr Process Analyst, EU Central Operations
4145141558.description:
About the job
Description

Central Operations refers to a new approach in Amazon Logistics to define a scalable solution to run the increasingly complex and growing last mile delivery network. Central Operations is a key strategic initiative with a vision to transform the way AMZL executes route planning, scheduling and last mile delivery. We are looking for a strong Business Analyst to join the team and drive improvement in in-station processes and technology used within the operational team.

This person will have a strong ability to gather data from multiple data sources (real-time and batch data), build new metrics from these sources and generate actionable insights coming from consumable and interactive dashboards that will allow operations to make quick decisions and avoid in-station volume risks.

The analyst will have the opportunity to start a project from scratch, helping to set up the foundations of an entirely new operational process with metrics, tools and built in AMZL platforms.

The role will provide opportunities to think big, develop original ideas, and partner with AMZL Planning, Transportation, Last Mile Tech, Operations and business expansion teams to develop a strategic approach to scale Central Operations.

Key job responsibilities

 Managing and partnering with Operational teams as an analytical partner, that will define and guide the analytical strategy for operations
 Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
 Partnering with other analysts and BI engineers in planning and analytics to build analytical solutions to deliver on business goals
 Propose and implement business metrics for senior management reviews and work with business intelligence and data engineers to design and develop data infrastructure to support business growth
 Perform deep-dives to find the root causes behind variances of key parameters over a given time-period
 Harness data to create business requirements documents and guide actionable technology requests

Basic Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Information Systems, Engineering, Operations Research, Mathematics or other business/analytical disciplines or equivalent
 Demonstrable relevant professional experience as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, or related - Proficiency in SQL and/or Python, Microsoft Excel, and statistical analysis tools
 Excellent written and oral communication skills in English, including the ability to communicate across business areas

Preferred Qualifications

 Master’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Information Systems, Engineering, Operations Research, Mathematics or other business/analytical disciplines or equivalent
 Direct experience using business intelligence reporting tools (Quicksight, Tableau, etc.) - Working knowledge of Redshift and/or data base management in AWS
 Previous experience in creating detailed Business Requirement Documentation

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

4140795067.title: Data Analyst, Tracking & Analytics
4140795067.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Are you eager to develop and implement tracking and analytics solutions that help large international companies make informed decisions?

Do you want to join our ambitious journey within data tracking & analytics?

Are you ready to make a real impact on how global brands use data?At s360, we're not just collecting data – we're turning it into actionable insights that drive business growth.

Join our new team in Barcelona and help shape the future of ad-tech in a dynamic, startup-like environment while being part of a leading North European agency.Your key responsibilitiesYou will play a crucial role in delivering and advising on tracking and analytics solutions for our clients.

Overall your responsibilities will encompass the development and implementation of durable measurement and tracking setups.More specifically, your responsibilities will include:Responsible for own portfolio of clients within tracking & analyticsDriving strategic roadmaps towards a durable measurement setupPlanning, project management and execution as primary or part of projects for clients on an ad hoc basisAdvising and configuring e.G.

Google Analytics 4, Consent Mode, Enhanced Conversions, Conversion API, and Consent Management Platform (Cookiebot and Cookie Information)Testing, auditing, and ensuring the quality of tracking setupsDeveloping documentation and implementing both smaller and larger tracking setupsImplementing and adjusting conversion tracking/pixel across various channels and platformsDebugging and resolving ad hoc tracking issuesAbout your future teamYou will join our Measurement team who each day collaborate to make sure our clients succeed.

We strive to work closely on projects, complex cases, and troubleshooting while having fun and prioritizing the social aspects of working together.

Staying ahead with the latest technologies and products is part of our DNA, ensuring our clients gain a competitive advantage through future-proof tracking setups.Moreover, as part of our new Barcelona team, you'll contribute to building a collaborative environment.

You will help shape the growth of our office and contribute to building a culture that thrives on innovation, teamwork, and the shared goal of delivering exceptional results for our clients.Your profileYou have 4-6 years of hands-on experience from e.G.

a digital agency or an in-house role in a digital company.

You possess high professionalism as well as personal integrity and thrive in a fast-paced environment, where we constantly strive to improve and create more value for our clients.Furthermore, you:High-level user of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager for ecommerceHave a working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScriptHave experience in driving larger tracking & analytics projects for complex setups and client organizationsComfortable explaining complex and technical concepts both verbally and in writingAble to communicate in English with colleagues and external stakeholders from various locationsAre a problem-solver, unafraid of tackling challenging tasksAre detail-oriented and structured, taking pride in delivering thorough solutionsHave a direct and open communication style, and you are comfortable with giving and receiving constructive feedbackAppreciate collaborative sparring and knowledge-sharing within the team, coupled with the ability to work independently and manage tasks in a structured mannerNote: You must be eligible to work in Spain and the EU without requiring sponsorship.What we offerYou will be a part of a strong team with some of the industry's top specialists who all strive to ensure that our next delivery is always better than before.

You will join an international team working with clients across the s360 group.Moreover, you will be a part of a company characterized by:A culture that is down-to-earth and full of constructive feedback and sparring that drives your personal and professional developmentFreedom under responsibility and flexible working hoursAmbitious and professional colleagues - who also like to have fun!Continuous learning and development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.Social events like our MeetUp for all s360-employeesOur office in the popular Norrsken House Barcelona offers the city's best location with views of the beach and W-hotel, as well as many social and networking activities.We'd love to hear from you!Is this the right fit for you?

Then don't hesitate to apply or reach out to Andrej Plancic, Managing Director, at ****** review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible.

All inquiries are treated confidentially.About s360s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise.

With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain.

In recent years, s360 has been recognized with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.#J-18808-Ljbffr

4161493441.title: Data Analyst (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
4161493441.description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

 Our Purpose –  Bridging the World Through Travel 

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

 Get to Know our  Team: 

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

 In this Role, you’ll get  to: 

Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests
Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others
Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers

 What you’ll Need to  Succeed: 

Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
Ability to communicate fluently in English
Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, Tableau
Good numerical reasoning skills
Proficiency in Excel
Intellectual curiosity and analytical skills

 It’s Great if you  Have: 

Experience in digital marketing
Academic research experience

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
