4151326482.title: Online Data Analyst
4151326482.description:
About the job
Online Data Analyst - Spanish (ES)


Job Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community
Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

Qualification Path:
No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in Spanish and English
Being a resident in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Spain
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment:
In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4128202410.title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
4128202410.description:
About the job
Carry1st is Africa's leading publisher of mobile games and digital content. Operating at the intersection of games, publishing, and fintech, we scale awesome content in frontier markets by solving hard problems. Across our publishing and Pay1st business lines, we are partnered with top global game companies like Riot Games, Activision, and Stillfront. We are backed by top investors like: a16z, Bitkraft, Google, Konvoy, Riot Games, Sony and Nas.

As a Senior Marketing Data Analyst you will generate insights into our players and our acquisition campaigns, leading to strategic recommendations and operational optimisations that drive cost efficient acquisition of high-valued customers.

You will...

Insights & Optimisation: Utilise advanced analytics to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities, translating these into strategic recommendations and/or operational optimisation
Business Needs to Analytical Solutions: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business questions & hypotheses into structured analysis, defining key metrics to track success
Reporting: Develop, operationalise, and maintain dashboards & automated reports - to visualise key performance indicators for senior management and to aid operational decisioning for marketing teams
Experimentation: Design and evaluate A/B tests to validate hypotheses, using deep dives and segmentations to further guide the UA roadmap
Data Management: Ensure data accuracy and integrity, establishing best practices where there is no single source of truth


Requirements

What makes you a great candidate?

Strong understanding of the mobile advertising space - networks, bidding systems, & algorithms - and fluent with the key funnel metrics - CTR, CVR, CPI, ARPU, Retention, LTV
Fluent in SQL. Proficiency in Tableau and Python pluses
Strong analytical skills backed by statistical fundamentals
Strong problem solving acumen backed by the ability to tackle ambiguity
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work cross-functionally with Marketing, Product, and Data teams


Benefits

What will it be like to work at Carry1st?

Carry1st is a fast-paced and dynamic place to work. Our team is diverse and global as we operate fully-remotely across 25+ countries. At Carry1st, you will have the opportunity to...

Build awesome, industry-changing products, every day
Grow with a VC-backed startup at the intersection of gaming and fintech
Work from anywhere in the world with international teammates
Own shares in the Company - enabling you to benefit from the value you create 


Some Additional Perks...

Co-working excursions: Travel to meet your colleagues in cities around the world
Awesome equipment: Get everything you need to work effectively 
Remote working allowance: Put an additional $600 / year to optimise your WFH experience
Learning and development: Attend courses, conferences and training events
Social events: Participate in regular company events to relax and connect with teammates
Birthday leave: Enjoy a paid day off on your special day 

We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. Join us!

Learn More About Carry1st...

 Andreessen Horowitz shared why they invested in Carry1st
 VentureBeat announced that Carry1st has raised $27 million to develop and publish mobile games in Africa
 Remerge hosted Cordel on a podcast to discuss Carry1st and the African gaming market

4173162764.title: Data analyst (Monochains, Multinetwork and Cosmos Hub Ecosystem)
4173162764.description:
About the job
P2P.org is the largest staking and restaking operator, with a TVL of over $10B 🔝.

We are constantly focused on launching new yield products: for example, in Polkadot (adding +15-20% to APR) and Ethereum, where we offer significantly higher APR (+40%) than any other staking operator 💪

We also keep an eye on exciting projects and launch new networks such as TON, Avail, Monad, and Babylon. We strongly believe in Bitcoin and the DeFi ecosystem around it, and we have a dedicated team focused on finding the best yield solutions based on Bitcoin.

We work with partners like BitGo, Crypto.com, Ledger and ByBit.

We are actively expanding our product line, exploring RWA, data, yield, and service products for exchanges, custodians, and banks

P2P.org unites talented individuals globally ❤️

Despite our distributed team, we share a passion for decentralized finance - a fairer system for all. We code, learn, create, and connect to shape finance's future 💰

P2P.org boasts a strong reputation and network. We prioritize customer satisfaction and, as tech enthusiasts, develop innovative solutions that bolster our brand.

You will

Explore blockchain ecosystem to detect possible opportunities and risks
Optimise economy for validation process including research, modeling, and improving business processes. 
Design and develop end-to-end data solutions, from initial analysis and model development to deployment, optimizing for performance and scalability
Provide informative dashboards to team, company, and community. 
Configure data platform instruments to load, process, and transform data
Formulate data requirements for the data engineering team. Decide on granularity, frequency, and data quality. 
Govern your team data marts. Provide data lineage from sources to reporting. 
Provide ad-hoc support to your team

You have

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field. 
Proficiency in advanced SQL, including different joins and window expressions (utilizing Google BigQuery). 
Competence with the analytical Python stack or other programming languages. 
Experience working with ETL instruments such as Airflow and dbt. 
Advanced knowledge of visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Superset, Looker)
Knowledge of data modeling techniques. 
Data research skills, probability theory, and mathematical statistics. Ability to operate in such models as regressions, and ab-tests. 
Data storytelling skills. Ability to form your opinion and prove it with data beyond a reasonable doubt. 
Knowledge of cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology is considered a plus!

4164053878.title: Data Scientist
4164053878.description:
About the job
At TomTom we’re seeking a Data Scientist to join our Maps Quality and Product Insight team in Madrid. As part of the team, you will help TomTom deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps and locations services for the hundreds of millions of drivers and users of our maps and products around the world and that will enable the future of autonomous driving.

The Maps Quality and Insight team is focused on providing state-of-the-art data & analytics solutions that enable fast and cost-effective data-driven strategic decision making within TomTom and for our customers and partners. 

The impact you'll make

Drive strategic business decisions with insights obtained by manipulating large volumes of data from a variety of different sources  system logs, satellite imagery, vertical imagery, street level imagery, GPS traces, etc. individually and by fusing several combinations of these sources
Design, develop and maintain data processing pipelines to use these data sources individually or combined and to predict various map features and attributes by applying statistical models/ ML / AI models 
State the quality level of our maps via statistical experiments that help us understand where we are and why, and deliver effective insights that help drive our map editing strategy 
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model and system performance and data accuracy 
Collaborate with teams from diverse backgrounds (e.g., data scientists, software engineers, product managers, map and GIS experts …) across the company and with our customers on projects and knowledge sharing 

What You'll Need

Minimum 3+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist or Software Engineer (with relevant experience in data analytics projects)
Bachelor’s/Masters in Computer science, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent field 
Good communications skills in English 
Strong problem-solving skills 
To be team-oriented – to be able to communicate with other team members, express doubts, provide and accept constructive feedback 
To be passionate about programming and have a solid foundation of software development, and be always eager to learn and improve your skills 
Fair statistical knowledge and expertise in designing and testing experiments and drawing conclusions under uncertainty (sampling strategies, robust statistical estimation,...) 
Experience in at least one object-oriented language – Python is a must, PySpark and Scala is a plus 
Experience in various ML / AI techniques and frameworks 
Knowledge of SQL and databases 
Experience in processing and analysing data to draw insights and produce visualizations (data storitelling) 
A passion for learning new technologies and techniques and a curiosity for exploring new possibilities and challenges

What Is Nice To Have

Work experience in Big Data and cloud ecosystems (e.g., Spark, Databricks, Azure, AWS, GCP…). 
Prior experience with working with geospatial and map data and/or with NoSQL databases
The impact you'll make
Drive strategic business decisions with insights obtained by manipulating large volumes of data from a variety of different sources  system logs, satellite imagery, vertical imagery, street level imagery, GPS traces, etc. individually and by fusing several combinations of these sources
Design, develop and maintain data processing pipelines to use these data sources individually or combined and to predict various map features and attributes by applying statistical models/ ML / AI models 
State the quality level of our maps via statistical experiments that help us understand where we are and why, and deliver effective insights that help drive our map editing strategy

Collaborate with teams from diverse backgrounds (e.g., data scientists, software engineers, product managers, map and GIS experts …) across the company and with our customers on projects and knowledge sharing

4093338820.title: Global Data Analyst
4093338820.location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
4093338820.description:
About the job
Would you like to join an international team working to improve the future of healthcare? Do you want to enhance the lives of millions of people? Grifols is a global healthcare company that since 1909 has been working to improve the health and well-being of people around the world. We are leaders in plasma-derived medicines and transfusion medicine and develop, produce and market innovative medicines, solutions and services in more than 110 countries and regions.

 We believe that diversity adds value to our business, our teams and our culture. We are committed to equal employment opportunities that foster an inclusive environment. 

We are looking for a Global Data Analyst to join Corporate Compliance Department at Grifols SA.

What Your Responsibilities Will Be

 You will support the design, deployment and maintenance of tools and databases for compliance tracking, monitoring and reporting processes, especially (but not limited to) Transparency reporting, both for legal obligations and industry codes. 
 You will identify, collect and analyze data to prepare reports required for management, regulators, and other stakeholders. 
 You will regularly work with other departments and compliance staff in the continuous enhancement of the Compliance Program, including (but not limited to) training and risk assessment. 


Who You Are

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, education, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions).

 Strong data analysis skills, with a minimum of 3 years’ experience in roles with analyst responsibilities. Experience in external audit, consultancy firms and compliance is desirable. 
 Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Bachelor's degree in business or similar. 
 Advanced level in Excel is essential. Additionally, knowledge of Power BI, Power App and Power Automate will be highly considered. 
 Advanced level in English. 
 Ability to analyze and understand complex data and processes. 
 Ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization and to work as part of a team. 
 Process-oriented, organized and methodical person. 


What We Offer

It is a brilliant opportunity for you, Grifols is fully aware that its employees are one of its major assets. We are committed to maintaining an atmosphere that encourages all our employees to develop their professional careers in an excellent working environment.

Information about Grifols is available at www.grifols.com. If you are interested in joining our company and you have what it takes for such an exciting position, then don’t hesitate to apply!

We look forward to receiving your application!

Grifols is an equal opportunity employer.

 Flexibility for U Program:  Hybrid Model

 Flexible schedule:  Monday-Thursday 8h-17h and Friday 8-15h.

Benefits Package

 Contract of Employment:  Permanent position

 Location:  Sant Cugat del Vallès

www.grifols.com

4153404419.title: Product Analyst (USA Market)
4153404419.description:
About the job
TripleTen is a service that empowers individuals, regardless of their prior experience, to embark on the exciting and challenging journey of mastering tech professions such as software engineering, data science, business intelligence analytics, and QA in a feasible and accessible way, ultimately leading to employment opportunities.

Our mission is to ensure that every student has the opportunity to successfully master a new profession and become a valuable member of the tech industry. We are successfully producing highly desirable tech professionals in the most competitive EdTech market in the world - the US market.

Please note that to apply for this position, you will be required to complete a test assignment after the Introductory call. Thank you for your understanding!

What you will do:

Collaborate on deconstructing product OKRs from business leadership into team-facing leading metrics
Help design and then build dashboards to enable the product team to see if their metrics are on track
Evaluate the effect of implementing features on metrics (without A/B testing)
Conduct exploratory analyses to uncover actionable product insights and opportunities from our existing data
Provide ad-hoc analytics support as needed by product teams such as reviewing statistics done by Product Managers or consulting on the design of internal learning analytics which trigger automated processes

Requirements:

Ability to choose an appropriate statistical test and perform it on real-world data
Experience independently analyzing data and generating hypotheses/insights using industry-standard analytics tools (i.e. SQL, Python)
Strong data communication and interpretation including designing data visualizations (i.e. Tableau), constructing custom metrics, and validating methodologies
English proficiency of B2 or above

Preferred qualifications:

Experience doing analytics on educational products
Experience with Spark

What we can offer you:

Full Time, Remote Contractor
Monthly Compensation of 3300 - 4500 Euros (gross) per month.
A comfortable digital office. We use modern digital tools — Miro, Notion, Google Meet, etc.— to make the process of working together seamless.
Diverse and tight-knit organization which is spread out across the US, LATAM, Brazil, Serbia, Republic of Georgia, and 10+ other countries.

Disclosures

At this time we are unable to offer work sponsorship opportunities.
This job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required. Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities at any time.

4125164497.title: Data Analyst – Brand Advertising (They/She/He)
4125164497.description:
About the job
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique? 

🤝 Our culture and strong values. 

💪 Our career development philosophy. 

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good. 

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY

Advertising performance:
Measure the effectiveness of the implemented commercial initiatives and establish KPIs to assess their performance (e.g., fill-rates, budget exhaustion rates) 
Design new KPIs to measure advertising campaigns success (ie. ROAS, New To Brand, Sales Uplift,)
Build data processing pipelines to make data available in Looker Dashboards for Commercial team
To deliver ad-hoc actionable insights and strategic initiatives to solve critical challenges in each market.
Audience monetization:
To use first-party data to build custom user segments that deliver value for advertiser and combine shopping behaviour and category data to enlarge audience capabilities creation
Create segmentation criteria for our 1P data to make it relevant and useful for Advertisers
Build API integrations with different Ads buying platforms (e.g.: DV360, TTD, CDPs)
Sales performance:
Make local teams' life easier by setting up and supporting centralized dashboards with FMCGs Sales, and performance data.
Contribute to continuous enhancement and innovation on how local teams consume data and share it with brands to unlock new opportunities.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
What You Will Bring To The Ride

3-5 years of professional work experience on analytics in a similar/relevant industry experience in a data analytics role, preferably in advertising facing teams
Demonstrated proficiency in working with clean & optimized SQL and python, querying mid to large volumes of data.
A higher education in scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics.
Knowledge or experience in digital product development
Understanding of A/B test principles, to design, conduct and analyze different experiments.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI
Excellent spoken and written English
Experience working on FMCG/CPG in Analytics is a Plus.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? 

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

4151320678.title: Online Data Analyst
4151320678.description:
About the job
Online Data Analyst - Spanish (ES)


Job Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community
Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

Qualification Path:
No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in Spanish and English
Being a resident in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Spain
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment:
In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4143287451.title: Risk Analytics Senior Consultant
4143287451.description:
About the job
EY es líder mundial en servicios de auditoría, fiscalidad, asesoramiento en transacciones y consultoría, con más de 250.000 profesionales en más de 150 países.

Nuestro lema, “Building a better working world”, resume la esencia y la razón de ser de EY. Contribuimos activamente en la economía mundial, ayudando a nuestras empresas cliente y al mundo empresarial a mejorar y crecer en un marco ético y responsable.

Además, proporcionamos un entorno de trabajo idóneo para desarrollar personas líderes con carreras exitosas a través de equipos de alto rendimiento. Nos preocupamos por que nuestra gente tenga el mejor desarrollo y formación profesional posible, de manera que se tengan en consideración sus intereses y expectativas, que disfruten de un ambiente de trabajo desafiante y que gocen de reconocimiento.

Contamos con una estrategia, “NextWave”, que es nuestra mejor apuesta para alcanzar el éxito. Nuestra ambición es aportar valor a largo plazo, tanto a nuestros clientes, como a nuestro equipo de profesionales y por supuesto a la sociedad, como la compañía de servicios profesionales más reconocida del mundo.

¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos un Risk Analytics Senior Consultant con un perfil híbrido (combine skills técnicas de Data & Analytics con skills de negocio) y con experiencia, para liderar la vanguardia en la gestión de riesgos y análisis de datos. Este rol estratégico es esencial para fortalecer nuestro enfoque proactivo en la monitorización de auditoría continua, gobernanza de inteligencia artificial, y aseguramiento de la calidad de datos, facilitando así la toma de decisiones basada en análisis de riesgo avanzado y predictivo.

Funciones:

Diseñar e implementar estrategias de monitorización de auditoría continua para identificar riesgos operativos y financieros en tiempo real.
Desarrollar y mantener un marco de gobierno de inteligencia artificial (IA) que asegure la alineación ética y regulatoria de los algoritmos y modelos de datos.
Supervisar la integridad y calidad de los datos, implementando procesos de Data Quality para garantizar la precisión y confiabilidad de la información utilizada en análisis de riesgos.
Liderar proyectos de risk analytics, aplicando técnicas estadísticas y de machine learning para predecir y mitigar riesgos potenciales.
Colaborar estrechamente con equipos interdisciplinarios para integrar soluciones de análisis de riesgos en los procesos de negocio.
Proporcionar orientación experta y formación a los equipos internos sobre las mejores prácticas en análisis de riesgos y uso de datos.
Realizar evaluaciones de riesgo y presentar hallazgos clave a la alta dirección para informar sobre la toma de decisiones estratégicas.
Mantenerse actualizado con las tendencias emergentes en analytics, riesgos y regulaciones, aplicando estos conocimientos para mejorar continuamente las operaciones de la empresa.
Fomentar una cultura de innovación y mejora continua en el análisis de riesgos y la gestión de datos

Requisitos:

Licenciatura/ grado en Ingeniería, administración y Direccion de empresas o ramas afines
Inglés alto
más de 3 años realizando las funciones descritas en empresa de consultoría Big4 o similares
Conocimientos técnicos en SQL, Python, Power BI
Valorable conocimiento en Inteligencia Artificial, Big Data y Risk Management
Disponibilidad para viajar/desplazamiento a cliente
Desarrollo comercial
Gestión de equipos

Qué Buscamos:

Aumentar el valor de nuestro equipo de Technology Risk para, de esta manera dar un mejor servicio a nuestros clientes y ayudar a la transformación digital en un entorno cambiante y dinámico.

Qué ofrecemos:

Aprendizaje continuo: Desarrollarás la mentalidad y las habilidades para enfrentarte a nuevos retos.
Tú defines el éxito: te proporcionaremos herramientas y flexibilidad para que puedas llegar a las metas propuestas.
Liderazgo transformacional: Te daremos la confianza y formación para que puedas crecer y llegar a ser un buen líder.
Cultura inclusiva y diversidad: Cada persona es única y tiene algo que aportar, te daremos voz para ello; toda idea es importante.

¿Crees que esta puede ser tu nueva oportunidad?

Si quieres unirte a nosotros, no dudes en hacernos llegar tu candidatura!

La experiencia en EY es excepcional; constrúyela

EY | Building a better working world 

EY existe para construir un mundo de trabajo mejor, ayudamos a nuestros clientes, personas y sociedad a crear un valor a largo plazo para generar valor en el mercado.
Gracias a los datos y la tecnología, tenemos equipos en más de 150 países generando confianza y ayudando a los clientes a crecer, transformarse y operar.
Trabajando en Auditoria, Consultoría, Tax, Estrategia y Transacciones, los equipos de EY se hacen las mejores preguntas para encontrar nuevas respuestas a complejos problemas en los que se encuentra nuestro mundo a día de hoy.
Building a better working world
NextWave

3622215989.title: Tableau Senior Consultant
3622215989.description:
About the job
¡Hola, Data Lover! 💙

¿Quieres llevar tus habilidades en Data, Analytics & IA al siguiente nivel? 🚀.

Somos líderes globales, trabajamos con la mitad del IBEX-35 y no paramos de crecer desde 1994.

Si te apasionan los datos, ¡únete a nosotrxs! ✨📊 


 ¿Cuál será tu misión?✍

Participarás en el análisis funcional de los proyectos, lo que te permitirá entender el negocio y tener una visión global y mayor conocimiento de los clientes.
Realizarás una visualización previa del cuadro de mando para indicar los pasos a seguir de cara al diseño del mismo.
Tendrás un mayor posicionamiento de cara al cliente con constante interlocución y dando soluciones a sus necesidades.
Te encargarás de la formación de usuarios con el fin de que el cliente sepa interpretar los datos de la mejor manera posible.
Te mantendrás actualizadx en las últimas tendencias tecnológicas en el ámbito de Data & Analytics para poder ofrecer las mejores soluciones a nuestros clientes
 
¿Qué te hará triunfar en esta posición?👇

Contar de 2 a 5 años de experiencia trabajando con herramientas de visualización, ETL (modelado del dato) y BBDD SQL ya que son la base de todos los proyectos en los que estarás involucrado.
Experiencia específica en Tableau en lo que se refiere al desarrollo de cuadros de mando.
Estudios en Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Ciencia de datos, Industriales, o contar con un Ciclo Superior u otra salida académica que te haya dotado de capacidad de desarrollo y pensamiento crítico en este ambiente.
Valoraremos muy positivamente formación adicional en Analytics, Big Data, o alguna disciplina similar.
Buenas habilidades comunicativas ya qué, poco a poco, irás ganando peso en la parte funcional y en el trato con cliente.
Que seas capaz de trabajar con autonomía y que puedas gestionar tu propio tiempo de la manera más efectiva posible, también, que seas capaz de organizar a otros compañerxs ya que queremos que vayas ganando más responsabilidad.
Como trabajamos en un entorno global, ¡será un plus que puedas comunicarte en inglés! 


🚀 ¿Qué nos hace únicxs?

Aquí no somos una empresa más... ¡somos un equipo que va a por todas! 💡✨

🔹 La tecnología y los datos son nuestra esencia. No solo trabajamos con lo último del mercado, sino que te formaremos para que domines las herramientas más innovadoras. Contamos con un área de innovación donde exploramos nuevas alianzas con gigantes tecnológicos y centros de I+D.

🔹 Tú marcas el ritmo. Olvídate de estructuras rígidas. Cada semestre, te sentarás con tu responsable para hablar de tus logros, nuevos retos y… ¡ajustes salariales en base a resultados!

🔹 Desde el minuto 1, serás parte de nuestra familia. Aquí nadie camina solx. Siempre habrá un compañerx dispuesto a ayudarte. 🤝😃

🔹 Aprenderás de lxs mejores. Te codearás con cracks del sector (tanto técnicos como de negocio), que estarán encantadxs de compartir su conocimiento y celebrar tu crecimiento. 📈🔥

🔹 Somos una empresa con propósito. Creemos en la diversidad y la inclusión como motores de la creatividad, lo que nos permite superar cualquier desafío. 🌍💜

📌 Y, por si fuera poco…

✅ Contrato indefinido (¡queremos que te quedes mucho tiempo!)
✅ Jornada intensiva en julio y agosto 🏖️
✅ Salario competitivo según tu formación y experiencia
✅ Apoyo económico para el teletrabajo 💻🏡


Si buscas un lugar donde crecer, innovar y sentirte parte de algo grande… ¡este es tu sitio! 🚀💥

4139267733.title: Principal Analyst | Farm Heroes Saga
4139267733.description:
About the job
Craft:

Data, Analytics & Strategy

Job Description:

Farm Heroes Saga is one of King’s beloved casual mobile games and home to all kinds of heroes. We foster an open, inclusive and dynamic environment where people can focus on creating exceptional experiences for our players.

We have an exciting opportunity for a Principal Analyst to join our team, with flexibility to be based in Stockholm, Malmo, Berlin, London or Barcelona.

As a Principal Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in supporting business operations and taking the lead on measuring value creation in our games. Acting as the product owner for important strategic projects, you will coordinate and support sophisticated, cross-area initiatives, as well as defining and supervising criteria for success. Working collaboratively across the organization including the leadership teams, your role will involve taking a lead on business governance, performance management and efficiency tracking for the Farm organization.

Key responsibilities

Collaborate with FLT and Area Leaders to set high-level strategic OKRs that track leading indicators to deliver on business goals
Develop and implement methods for performance and efficiency tracking across the entire team. 
Build and maintain relevant important metrics and insights, ensuring they are updated, supervised, and shared with relevant people. 
Own, gather, aggregate and provide data insights into the operational, financial, and efficiency performance of the game. Build and maintain forecasts, impact calendars and reports to supervise KPIs and monitor performance against business goals. 
Manage budgets related to Game Operations and Outsourcing, ensuring optimal resource allocation and cost management. 
Proactively identify and monitor risks that could impact product development, from live incidents, resource shortages to technical challenges and works pro-actively to mitigate them. 
Establishes quality metrics and standards to ensure we can continuously measure and deliver a reliable player experience. 
Lead communications and information-sharing processes ensuring people at various levels have the right level and amount of information to be engaged, advised, and able to make good decisions. 
Oversee the preparation and coordination of materials for cross-area meetings and other deliverables. Set agendas, distribute tasks, and handle timelines with input from relevant teams, ensuring clear communication and adherence to deadlines. 
Continuously seek to simplify, automate, and improve processes and ways of working for the areas you own and support the rest of the organisation in this space. 

Skills

Experience in managing cross-functional projects and aligning OKRs with business goals to deliver successful outcomes. 
Passion about data and analytics, with skills to create, present and maintain accurate metrics, forecasts and insights to inform decision making and track performance. 
Meticulous attention to detail, ensuring data accuracy and report reliability. 
Self-driven in identifying opportunities for improvement and takes initiative to drive positive change. 
Proven experience in budget management, including resource allocation and cost management. 
Exceptional communication across all contexts, with expertise in creating impactful presentations and slides with the ability to influence cross-functional stakeholders at all levels. 
Skilled at building strong partnerships and effectively coordinating with cross functional stakeholders. 
Self-motivation with a history of exceeding high-performance standards. 
Familiarity with industry trends and key business drivers, with an ability to leverage this knowledge. 
Adaptable and reliable team player committed to supporting team goals and contributing to a collaborative and cohesive environment. 

With the holidays almost upon us and festivities in full swing, we hope you are looking forward to some well-earned time off us much as we are! We wanted to let you know replies may be a little slow over the festive period - but rest assured, we look forward to responding swiftly in the new year.

About King

With a mission of Making the World Playful, King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as Farm Heroes Saga. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king_games on X.

4147193873.title: Digital Analyst
4147193873.description:
About the job
Desarrolla tus competencias como DIGITAL ANALYST en un proyecto del sector retail.

En ALTEN tenemos claro que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes experiencia laboral como digital analyst de más de 3 años, con herramientas como GA4, SQL y CRO, entre otras, nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Quieres construir hoy el mundo de mañana? ¡Sigue leyendo!

¿Qué buscamos?
-Experiencia laboral de mínimo 3 años como digital analyst.
-Experiencia laboral con google analytics.
-Experiencia laboral con Test A/B.
-Experiencia laboral con SQL.
-Experiencia laboral con CRO Ecommerce.
-Experiencia con powerbi.
-Posibilidad de acudir a la oficina en Barcelona de manera puntual.


¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?
Incorporación a una empresa multinacional competitiva en continuo crecimiento.
Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.
Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.
Beneficios Sociales y Plan de Compensación Flexible.
Retribución competitiva.

¿Quiénes somos?
Somos un equipo. Formamos parte de ALTEN, una multinacional europea especializada en proporcionar servicios de consultoría, tecnología de la información y servicios de ingeniería a las principales compañías del mercado español.
Si te gustan las cifras, te diremos que en España tenemos una facturación de 217 millones de euros, 9 sedes y un equipo formado por 5.240 personas.

Además, en ALTEN nos enorgullecemos de ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades con independencia de género, edad, diversidad de capacidades o país de origen. Nuestro compromiso está con el talento y con las personas que lo tienen.

Si crees que eres talento, ¡apúntate!

4145906623.title: Data analytics trainee
4145906623.description:
About the job
The Information Lab, a leading Self-Service BI & Analytics company, is the leading European partner of Tableau and Alteryx. Our consultants, all experts and passionate about Data Analysis, support the most important international companies in the implementation of strategic projects.
The Spanish branch of The Information Lab, a young and rapidly expanding company, launched the Data Academy project 3 years ago, with the aim of supporting a rapidly expanding market and training the next generation of Data Rockstars, i.e. experts in data analytics and self-service BI models and Data-Driven companies.
The next session of our Academy will take place between March 2025 and August 2025.

The Training Path
This project is an intensive training course focused on teaching models and processes related to data visualisation through the use of Tableau and Alteryx, tools that we consider to be the ultimate expression of self-service analytics.
This course includes an in-depth study of the entire data chain, from data preparation to how best to communicate the insights that data can provide.
During the course, we alternate periods of face-to-face lessons with weekly projects with The Information Lab customers and prospects that allow Academists to put the theories they learn into practice.
The training is held by specialists from our Italian team, with the participation of trainers from our other European regions on specific topics.
The training will be held at our Madrid office.
After a successful completion of the training period, the 'Data Academists' will be employed full-time in one or more departments of the client companies, gaining the necessary experience to then be fully integrated into the consulting team.
They will work three days a week in the office and two days in Smart Working mode.
The companies we work with are among the most important international players in the fields of fashion, manufacturing, telecommunications, pharmaceuticals, publishing, sports and much more...

Job profile required:
- Bachelor's degree in computer science or a degree in engineering/statistical/mathematical sciences with strong design-side skills and creativity, or Bachelor's degree in design with a passion for data analysis.
- We also value profiles from humanistic backgrounds with a strong aptitude for mathematics, a passion for data analysis and strong creative skills.
- Good knowledge of the English language, written and spoken.
Excellent knowledge of the Spanish language, written and spoken.
Plus: knowledge of italian, written and spoken.

What we offer:
- Paid, intensive, full-time (Monday to Friday) training course of 5 months.
- A long-term partnership, to create your professional future together, in a dynamic and engaging work environment, using the industry's most advanced software (Tableau, Alteryx, PBI, Knime).
- A path of continuous growth and learning.
- After "investiture" as a Data Academy Consultant, rotating consultancy activities for medium periods at our main customers
- Reimbursement of expenses during the training period.
Employment contract upon successful completion of the training period.

What you will do and learn:
- Business Intelligence solution development, from A to Z, from preparation to data analysis.
- Data visualisation techniques, dashboard creation and general data analysis.
- You will become an expert user of Tableau, PowerBI, Alteryx and Knime.
- You will delve into the UX/UI side of dashboards, using specific tools such as Figma and Canva.
Y- ou will learn how to manage your time and complete assigned work on time, and according to project requirements.
- You will contribute to internal and external training activities, because "sharing knowledge" is one of the driving forces of The Information Lab!

Availability:
Start of session: March 2025
Place of work:
Madrid for the training phase
Madrid and Milan for subsequent activities at the customer's premises

Position also open to Curricular Interns and profiles of all ages
Our organisation operates with respect for gender equality and with a commitment to supporting inclusiveness and diversity.

About Us
The Information Lab is an internationally recognised excellence in Data Analytics and Data Visualization and in the implementation of digitisation and modernisation strategies. We propose Self-Service Analytics processes and models aimed at transforming the company into a Data-Driven enterprise.
We share information and experience through an internal network that includes 8 European countries. To achieve this goal, the group's strategic choice is to focus on the platforms that we consider the most innovative in the analytics landscape, namely Tableau, Alteryx and Snowflake, which we consider to be the most mature expression of Self Service Analytics: Tableau for Data Visualization; Alteryx for Data Preparation and Advance Analytics; Snowflake as Cloud data warehouse.
In addition to a number of challenging responsibilities, we offer room for your development and the development of your ideas. We work with both large international companies and the SME sector. Our clients operate in various sectors ranging from publishing to finance, from retail to luxury, from telco and logistics to public administration and sport.
If you are looking for a varied and challenging job in a fast-growing company, then you are the right person for us.

4092713751.title: Business Intelligence Analyst
4092713751.description:
About the job
About The Role

As a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting complex data to provide actionable insights that help the organization make informed business decisions. This role involves collecting, processing, and analyzing data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for business improvement.

Key Responsibilities

Data Collection and Management: Gather data from internal and external sources, ensuring accuracy and consistency. This may include working with databases, data warehouses, and cloud storage systems.
Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets using statistical and analytical tools to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations.
Reporting and Visualization: Create and deliver reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to communicate findings clearly to stakeholders, ensuring they are actionable and relevant.
Business Insights: Collaborate with departments such as marketing, sales, and finance to understand business needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making.
Data Quality Assurance: Monitor data quality and ensure integrity across reporting systems. Identify and resolve data inconsistencies or discrepancies.
Tools and Technologies: Use business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Excel, SQL, etc.) to automate reporting processes and support data-driven decision-making.
Continuous Improvement: Stay up-to-date with industry trends and new technologies to improve BI processes and methodologies.

Critical Skills

Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets and extract actionable insights.
Proactive, flexible, and problem-solving attitude, able to prioritize in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
Humble and approachable, a team player with great collaboration skills.
Excellent communication skills to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Job Requirements

A degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a related field.
Experience in a similar role, with a strong background in business intelligence, data analysis, and project management, ideally with exposure to various business domains (sales, marketing, finance).
Experience with SQL and databases (e.g., MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle).
Advanced Excel skills, including the ability to use functions, pivot tables, and data analysis tools.
Proficiency in BI tools and technologies (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, SAP BI).
Strong knowledge of data management, data mining, and statistical analysis techniques.

Diversity & Inclusion commitment

At Kings League we strongly believe in building an inclusive and diverse work environment, where everyone can develop their full potential. We are committed to the integration of people with disabilitites and different capabilities, and fostering a team where everyone has the opportunity to contribute and grow. If you meet the requirements of the position, we invite you to send us your application; we value the richness that diversity brings and look forward to welcoming your talent and experience.

4157971922.title: Senior Product Analyst
4157971922.description:
About the job
🚀 Who Are We?

Welcome to Welltech—where health meets innovation! 🌍 As a global leader in Health & Fitness industry, we’ve crossed over 200 million installs with five life-changing apps, all designed to boost well-being for millions. Our mission? To transform lives through intuitive nutrition trackers, powerful fitness solutions, and personalized wellness journeys—all powered by a diverse team of over 700 passionate professionals with presence across 5 hubs.

Why Welltech? Imagine joining a team where your impact on global health and wellness is felt daily. At Welltech, we strive to be proactive wellness partners for our users, while continually evolving ourselves.

Challenges you’ll meet:

Deliver actionable recommendations that propel product enhancements and overall business growth. 
Collaborate with stakeholders to generate insights that enhance the customer experience. 
Partner with the product team and refine experimentation processes to ensure data-driven decision-making. 
Validate product hypothesis and connect results to business metrics. 
Establish key indicators that track the most critical aspects of the business. 

Your professional qualities:

Demonstrated experience in interpreting data and delivering high-impact solutions. 
Proficiency in SQL, Python and Tableau (or other data visualization tools). 
Familiar with statistics and hypothesis testing principles. 
Adept at breaking down complex challenges into clear, actionable steps. 

Nice to have:

Familiarity with Airflow and Amplitude. 

In our team, we value:

Sociability. Team update, regular communication with the working group on current projects in written (chats) and verbal formats (stand-ups and other meetings). Openness to communication. Ability to formulate tasks clearly and concisely. 
Results orientation. Willingness to bring your tasks in line with the team and company global goals, to implement the necessary changes. 
Responsibility. Attention to details, autonomy, willingness to take on obligations and comply with agreements. 
Proactivity. The ability to set goals and achieve them. Creating opportunities without waiting for them to appear. 
Orientation to development and self-learning, interest in new technologies. A constant desire to learn and develop your skills, gain new experience. 
Zero-Ego and Collaborative Mindset. A flexible, hands-on leader who fosters trust, values diverse perspectives, and promotes a culture of continuous learning and improvement. 

Candidate journey

⭕️ Recruiter call --> ⭕️ Meet a team member --> ⭕️ Skills assessment--> ⭕️ Meet the Leadership team

✨ Why You’ll Love Being Part of Welltech:

Grow Together: Join a culture that champions both personal and professional growth. Here, you’ll thrive as we learn, evolve, and succeed together. 
Lead by Example: No matter your role, your leadership matters. Every team member is empowered to inspire and make an impact. 
Results-Driven: We’re all about achieving meaningful outcomes. It’s not just about the effort, but the difference we make every day. 
We Are Well-Makers: Be part of a movement that’s creating a healthier, happier world. Together, we make well-being a reality!

Check out some of our products

Muscle Booster — https://musclebooster.fitness/

Yoga-Go — https://yoga-go.io/

Omo — bit.ly/OMOio

FastEasy — https://fasteasy.life/

WalkFit -http://walkfit.pro

Deliver actionable recommendations that propel product enhancements and overall business growth.
Collaborate with stakeholders to generate insights that enhance the customer experience.
Partner with the product team and refine experimentation processes to ensure data-driven decision-making.
Validate product hypothesis and connect results to business metrics.
Establish key indicators that track the most critical aspects of the business.
Your professional qualities:
Demonstrated experience in interpreting data and delivering high-impact solutions. 
Proficiency in SQL, Python and Tableau (or other data visualization tools). 
Familiar with statistics and hypothesis testing principles. 
Adept at breaking down complex challenges into clear, actionable steps.

Adept at breaking down complex challenges into clear, actionable steps.
Nice to have:
Familiarity with Airflow and Amplitude.
In our team, we value:
Sociability. Team update, regular communication with the working group on current projects in written (chats) and verbal formats (stand-ups and other meetings). Openness to communication. Ability to formulate tasks clearly and concisely. 
Results orientation. Willingness to bring your tasks in line with the team and company global goals, to implement the necessary changes. 
Responsibility. Attention to details, autonomy, willingness to take on obligations and comply with agreements. 
Proactivity. The ability to set goals and achieve them. Creating opportunities without waiting for them to appear. 
Orientation to development and self-learning, interest in new technologies. A constant desire to learn and develop your skills, gain new experience. 
Zero-Ego and Collaborative Mindset. A flexible, hands-on leader who fosters trust, values diverse perspectives, and promotes a culture of continuous learning and improvement.

4144168388.title: Senior Product Analyst
4144168388.description:
About the job
As a Senior Product Analyst you are an all-rounder who thrives equally working on technical topics as well as value-delivery through insights, presentation and data visualisation. Indeed, your extensive experience and knowledge across technical and business related topics enables you to go “end to end” with a high level of quality and scalability as well as driving best practices within the Product Analytics community. Not limited to one squad or domain, your impact is across the breadth of the business, proactively identifying common needs and pain points across the teams and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practice across our teams.

4100005707.title: Data Analyst Intern - Regional Operations (They/He/She)
4100005707.description:
About the job
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique? 

🤝 Our culture and strong values. 

We have an ‘’office-first’’ culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do! 
We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don’t shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift! 
We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!). 
We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work. 

💪Our career development philosophy. 

We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential. 
We take ownership of our career development. We don’t believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams! 
We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope. 

🤝Our commitment to being a force for good. 

Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact. 
We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives. 
We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Glovo is looking for a Data Operations Intern to join our regional team in Barcelona, supporting operations across the Africa Region, specifically in Morocco, Tunisia, Ivory Coast, Uganda, Nigeria, and Kenya. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven, and hands-on? Do you want to evolve into one of the fastest-growing startups in Europe, building a product that will change people's day-to-day lives and disrupt the on-demand market?

THE JOURNEY

Analyze data generated by our core operations across multiple African markets to improve the experience of our key stakeholders (Couriers, Users, and Partners).
Provide data-driven insights to enhance key performance indicators (KPIs) across supported countries, such as delivery times, cancellations, efficiency, and cross-departmental projects.
Proactively identify inefficiencies, analyze root causes, and propose actionable, data-driven solutions tailored to regional needs.
Standardize and optimize processes to drive operational efficiency in our African markets.
Track KPIs, manage scheduling, attendance, and general administration of Info-Sessions, while supporting daily operations through operational supervision and data analysis.
Collaborate closely with local Operations Managers in each supported country to streamline customer support processes and enhance overall operations.
Work cross-functionally with other departments to monitor and implement structural process optimizations within the Africa Region.
Bring your most innovative ideas to life and make an immediate impact by thinking outside the box!

What You Will Bring To The Ride 

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mathematics, or any technological field.
Passion for analytics: you enjoy deep-diving into problems to uncover root causes and drive improvements.
Strong problem-solving skills: no challenge is too big or small.
Proficiency in Excel.
Experience in SQL is a must.
Professional-level English (French is a plus given the regional scope).
An empathetic, inclusive, and curious attitude.
Individuals from diverse backgrounds, genders, and ethnicities may hesitate to apply if they don't meet 100% of the listed criteria. Don’t let that stop you! We are all about finding the best talent—skills can be learned, and diversity is a key strength.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? 

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

4151322852.title: Online Data Analyst
4151322852.location: Pamplona, Chartered Community of Navarre, Spain
4151322852.description:
About the job
Online Data Analyst - Spanish (ES)


Job Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community
Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

Qualification Path:
No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in Spanish and English
Being a resident in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Spain
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment:
In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4165471176.title: Analista de datos (Machine Learning)
4165471176.description:
About the job
Desde HAYS, estamos buscando un Data Analyst con conocimientos en Data Science, IA y Machine Learning para unirse al equipo de Business Development de una importante empresa en San Sebastián. Este perfil será clave para mejorar y automatizar los servicios de lectura de documentos, reduciendo la necesidad de intervención manual y optimizando los procesos actuales.

Responsabilidades:
Mejorar y optimizar los servicios existentes.
Implementar nuevas tecnologías y algoritmos para automatizar la lectura de documentos.
Colaborar con el equipo para identificar áreas de mejora y desarrollar soluciones innovadoras.
Asegurar la integración y el funcionamiento eficiente de las nuevas tecnologías en la plataforma actual.
Trabajar de manera proactiva para buscar y aplicar mejoras continuas en la herramienta.

Requisitos:
Experiencia sólida en proyectos de IA y/o Machine Learning.
Muy valorable conocimientos en Data Science o manejo de datos.
Capacidad para trabajar de manera autónoma y proactiva.
Habilidad para identificar y resolver problemas de manera creativa.
Deseo de aprender y aplicar nuevas tecnologías.

Ofrecemos:
Salario competitivo según experiencia
Un entorno de trabajo dinámico y desafiante.
Oportunidades de crecimiento y desarrollo profesional.
Participación en proyectos innovadores y de alto impacto.
Flexibilidad y autonomía en el trabajo.

Si eres una persona apasionada por la tecnología y la innovación, y te gusta enfrentar desafíos, no dudes en inscribirte a la oferta o mandarme tu CV a aitor.abad@hays.es

4146117169.title: Product Analyst (Data team)
4146117169.description:
About the job
About us:

Planner 5D is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). Our platform simplifies the home renovation process from concept to execution, and this process has never been more straightforward with our cutting-edge software. You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.

Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. Planner 5D is more than just software; it's a vibrant community of enthusiastic and product-oriented professionals. From diverse backgrounds, our team collaborates across time zones, fueled by a shared passion to revolutionize the home design market.

We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.

The Senior Product Analyst will play a critical role in driving data-informed decision-making and product optimization.

Key responsibilities include:

Tracking Events Design and Specification: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and specify tracking events that capture user behavior and product interactions
Tracking Events Delivery and Quality Management: Ensure accurate and timely delivery of tracking events and maintain high data quality standards
Definitions of Features and Connected Tracking Events: Clearly define product features and their associated tracking events to enable comprehensive analysis
Product and Feature Usage Metrics and KPIs: Develop and monitor key metrics and KPIs to measure product and feature performance
Framework for Feature Usage Analysis and Insights: Create a framework for analyzing feature usage and generating actionable insights
Overall Product Growth Metrics and Analysis: Track and analyze overall product growth metrics to identify trends and opportunities
A/B Test Framework for Continuous Improvements: Implement and manage an A/B testing framework to facilitate data-driven experimentation and optimization
Hypothesis and Experiments Documentation, Delivery, and Analysis: Document hypotheses, design and execute experiments, and analyze results to validate assumptions and inform product decisions
Conduct Quantitative and Qualitative Product Research: Utilize both quantitative and qualitative research methods to gain a deep understanding of user needs and behaviors
Use AI Tools and Approaches for Product Analysis: Leverage AI tools and techniques to enhance product analysis and uncover valuable insights


Qualifications:

Strong Analytical Skills: Proven ability to collect, analyze, and interpret complex data sets
Product Development Knowledge: Familiarity with product development processes and methodologies
Technical Proficiency: Experience with data analysis tools such as BigQuery, Looker Data Studio, and product analytics platforms like Amplitude, Devtodev, Mixpanel, or other modern tools and frameworks
AI and Machine Learning Experience: Knowledge of AI and machine learning techniques and their application in product analysis
Communication and Collaboration: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams
Problem-Solving and Critical Thinking: Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making
Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering) or equivalent experience


Key Skills:

Data Analysis
Product Analytics
SQL
BigQuery
Looker Data Studio
A/B Testing
Experimentation
AI and Machine Learning
Communication
Collaboration
Problem-Solving


Additional Skills:

Knowledge of data visualization tools
Statistical modeling expertise


What we offer:

 Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
 Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
 We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
 Company computer equipment by request
 Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses
 English classes on our corporate platform
 Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building
 Unlimited free Planner5D subscriptions

4059288419.title: Sr Analyst Partner Operations - Spain (They/She/He)
4059288419.description:
About the job
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique? 

🤝 Our culture and strong values. 

💪 Our career development philosophy. 

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good. 

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

The way we manage our company is built on the belief that by giving a WOW service to our clients, we will be able to change the delivery market. How are we doing it? By paying attention to all the details. Glovo is a hyperlocal marketplace featuring the most trendy places in each city and delivering their products in less than 60 mins. As a Partners Operations Regional Senior Analyst, you will play a key role in the Glovo Partners team. You will be directly responsible for improving Partners’ experience across their whole journey, making them grow and improve user UX.

THE JOURNEY

Be an accelerator for the whole Partner Operations team unlocking power of data to create new processes and projects, seeking continuous improvement in methodologies to optimize the operations of our partners (improve preparation times, reduce cancellations and decrease bad ratings)
Understand, deep-dive and have complete awareness of the region’s partner operations situation at all times. Develop analytical frameworks, analyses, dashboards and models for the region
Own all dashboards and build new tools to improve the visibility of metrics in the department
Execute end-to-end projects at regional and country level
Raise product requests to improve partners UX and scalability. Identify tech features improvements and give proactive feedback to HQ.
Work with global and local teams to coordinate and execute projects in the region

What You Will Bring To The Ride

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a technical discipline (e.g. Engineering, Economics, Computer Science, Business Administration or similar)
3/4+ years of experience in high demanding roles or analytical positions (consulting, investment banking, operations, finance, logistics, analytics, strategy, etc.)
A data-driven mentality with strong analytical skills: taking decisions based on data and using good business judgment when necessary
Problem-solving skills and hands on attitude: no problem is too small or too big
You're an owner, you have a natural bias for action, always pushing for things to happen and result oriented
Comfortable working in a high growth and high-performance start-up with a fast pace
Excellent stakeholder management. Experience interacting effectively at multiple levels of the organization is highly valued
Expertise in MS Excel and strong SQL knowledge
Proficiency in English, written and oral

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? 

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
